updates.update_content:
Good Morning Lovelies! 
I officially cut off the codes a few days ago for the campaign set downloads. 
If you haven't downloaded your set, or somehow lost your Gumroad login and don't have access to your files anymore, send me a message here on Kickstarter and I'll help you get the files again no problem.

Good Morning backers!! 
I'm happy to tell you that the final stretch goal, Sepherene, has been added to the Beautiful Night set! 
I think almost everyone has downloaded their set from gumroad by now. If you navigate to that product within your gumroad library and open up the file list, you'll find ALL the models there waiting for you, each inside its own zip file, named accordingly.
Models in your set:

Good Morning! (or evening, depending on where you are) 
Firstly this is just a gentle prod, not everyone who backed the Kickstarter has downloaded their sets. Please go visit your Kickstarter messages to get your download code and use it here to get your set.

Ok you LittleMonsters, I've got some ending notes for you - please read this whole post!
PS You're all amazing ... just so you know <3 
As of this post, there are only 10 hours left on the campaign and 1 semi early bird commission slot just opened up.

Below is a test print and paint of Rhodanthe by Conor O'Kane. 
Printed in one piece at 75mm high on a Phozon Shuffle.

Below is an early WIP image of Zephyra. 
More updates and additions are coming for this one, as well as structural integrity added to the leg/toe to help support the pose without taking away from the flow of the image.

Hey BellaFam
I know it's been rather quiet here the last few days. I had to move out of my apartment of 7 years and I'm in my temp home now for the next few weeks until I make my big move over to New Zealand in March, but I've got my computer and tablet set up and I'm back at it today with a full pot of coffee. 
So, what's happened in the meantime? Well, you LittleMonsters went and unlocked while before I was done with ! And now we're over halfway to unlocking .
Celestria Test Print
Livana at 85mm tall, printed with a Phozon Shuffle and painted by Conor O'Kane.

project_data.project_name: Beautiful Night - Gothic Pinup Set - STL Files for 3D Prints

campaign.story:
----------------ALL STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED----------------
 --------------------THATS 49+ DWARVES!!!---------------------
The Dwarves - 25 miniatures made for 3D printing brought to you by Epics 'N' Stuffs.
Epics 'N' Stuffs is a DnD driven miniature patreon which creates a range of sculpts from varying parts of the lore with their own unique style. The Dwarves have proven to be a popular subject, many have requested that they get brought beyond patreon so this is an effort to remedy that along with some additional rewards/stretch goals.
We also have our own small 3D printing farm and have been selling prints to happy customers for a couple of months, so we want to offer our Dwarves printed to those who might want them.
There are 25 base Dwarves we have created (images below) with the hope to bring more if they prove popular enough. The base set of .STLs offer incredible value which will get greater with the more stretch goals achieved.
 A FREE .STL file is available here to test print for yourself, it also includes a Chitubox file if you happen to be printing on a resin unit. https://www.dropbox.com/sh/5lxbh345cuumtq2/AAC3DwE0uusEhBaVH4zSQLv8a?dl=0
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here are the renders and original prints for each of the 25 base Dwarves. .STL files have versions with both an attached base or no base variations. 
Printed physical models come attached to a black base as shown in the images and are printed in either Elegoo or Anycubic Grey resins. Models are on a 32mm base (apart from the Blacksmith who is on a 40mm, stretch goals might also vary).
Backers of the digital tier will also receive the chitubox project files which contain the models hollowed and supported, the same files I used to print the models below. So if you have a resin machine such as the Elegoo Mars, Epax X1, Anycubic Photon etc... these files will just need slicing and should be ready to go :)
Dwarven Barkeep
Dwarven Barkeep Variant
Dwarven Travelling Merchant
Dwarven Brawler
Dwarven Brawler Variant
Dwarven Brawling Santa
Dwarven Santa
Dwarven Blacksmith
Dwarven Guardian
Dwarven Infantry
Dwarven Rogues
 Here are the stretch goals for this campaign. Work will start on these once the campaign has ended. Any new art will be featured here.
£2,000 - Undead Dwarf ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£2,500 - Dwarven Wizard ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£3,000 - Dwarven Cleric ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£3,500 - Dwarven Ranger/Hunter ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£4,000 - Dwarven Barbarian ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£4,500 - Dwarven Paladin ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£5,000 - Dwarven Death Knight ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£6,000 - Dwarven King ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£7,000 - Female Dwarves x 3 (Artificer/Engineer, Herbalist and Sorceress) ---- UNLOCKED!!!! 
£7,750 - Dwarven Gravedigger ---- UNLOCKED!!!!

£8,500 - Beach Holiday Dwarf ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£11,000 - 3 Additional Female Dwarves (Warrior Tank, Paladin and Ranger/Hunter) ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
£12,000 - 3 Additional Variants, Logger (based on the Barkeep), Druid (Based on the Wizard) and Chef Warrior (Based on the Chef and Santa) ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
SOCIAL MEDIA STRETCH GOALS :
25/25 Shares/Retweets - Dwarven Guardian Variant ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
 50/50 Shares/Retweets - Dwarven Coal Miner ---- UNLOCKED!!!!
75/75 Shares/Retweets - Dwarven Chef ---- UNLOCKED!!!!


104/100 Shares/Retweets - Female Dwarven Barkeep ---- UNLOCKED!!!!

We utilise a combination of Pixologic Zbrush and Autodesk Maya to create our models, Marmoset Toolbag is used to bring you the model renders and Chitubox Slicer is the software for prepping our 3D printing files.
Once we have a 3D file ready for printing we transfer it via USB to one of our 3D Printers. Our farm consists of several Elegoo Mars' MSLA printers along with a Kelant S400 for larger/bulk prints. Prints take varying amounts of time, to maximise hardware consumable life, as well as printing time, we pack our printbeds with more models as long as it doesn't reduce quality or success rate. We have a range of spare consumables and a supply of resin upfront for incoming work.
Once printed we clean our models using a 2 stage isopropyl clean. Models are then given time to dry before going into an ultrasonic bath in warm water. Once done, we remove supports and then submerge them into water and cure via UV lamps to be sure all the resin is completely solid. Models are given a mild isopropyl rub after they have cured/dried, finally they're glued to a base.
With regards to packaging and delivery, we like to recycle as much as we can so will re-use as much packaging as possible whilst also keeping the models safe. We use a combination of boxes, sponge and padding(like bubble wrap) to ensure models are well protected.
Once the campaign has ended production will begin. .STL files will be sent out for the base models soon after campaign end to those that pledged for them. 
If you have pledged to a physical tier we'll need to know which of the Dwarves you wish to get in your pledge, this can include stretch goal Dwarves that have been made at the time, although the manufacturer of these might delay your order slightly. Once the campaign is over and all the pledges tallied we'll send out a survey asking which models you would like, you can also email - EpicsNStuffs@gmail.com with any questions or queries.
Production on both the stretch goals and physical prints will happen simultaneously. If people would like to purchase additional physical prints of the stretch goals if reached then they will be able to at additional cost. You can add additional models by adding the value of them to your pledge (£10 for 1, £15 for 2, £19 for 3 and £22 for 4). If you do this please send us a message either via the above email or direct PM and we'll add a note to your pledge and reference it once all pledges have been processed.
UPDATES - We'll publish updates to the Kickstarter as and when they're needed prior to the campaign ending as well as keeping people informed on progress once production has began. This campaign will have email: EpicsNStuffs@gmail.com dedicated to it, any communication should come to this email to get a fast reply. 
Shipping costs added when you pledge, nothing else is added once the campaign ends. We have shipped plenty of these miniatures around the world, this is simply how much it costs and includes the packaging and postal charges. 
Estimated delivery for this project is June 2020/July 2020. There may be minor delays caused by factors that are not under our control such as postage delays or customs. We haven't currently experienced this in current store sales but there is always the risk of incidents outside of our control. We would endeavor to keep backers updated via the Kickstarter until all items are delivered.
"Please note the above estimate is based on a prediction we have done, if the KS becomes more successful than I thought this will cause the delivery date to shift."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The base set of digital files are complete and have been printed by myself, so with regards to the digital base element of the project there is no risk at all. Additional digital stretch goals along with their test printing is also low risk as we have a track record of producing such assets in a timely manner.

We have delivered over 50 physical miniatures via online stores since enabling this feature a little over a month ago and have received brilliant feedback. We have scaled up to accommodate targets outlined in the kickstarter in terms of hardware and consumables needed for printing.

In crowdfunding projects there are always certain variables that could escape the initial plan. As a consequence there is always the possibility of a delay in delivery although delivery estimates for physical items are currently very conservative. These delays are typically caused by last minute additions to the campaign, such as new Stretch Goals, or are a delay within the shipping process itself such as problems with customs releasing the goods, there is always the potential for 3D printer hardware issues however we have spares and the means to purchase additional hardware if required.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

So in todays post I'll be sharing some stats from the Kickstarter which I put together, most from when it comes to printing the physical pledges. I thought it might be cool to share :3
Also as requested by some, I'll be supplying a partial list of merchants of which to buy Epics 'N' Stuffs physical models from. So here we go :-

Total backers across both campaigns = 1,662

Hey all, I hope everyone is staying safe and having fun :3
Firstly thanks for all the kind words and comments regarding the campaigns, I've loved seeing some prints and paint jobs and  hearing some of the stories of how they're being utilised :)
We're always looking for feedback and ways to make our products better going forward but also being able to support the stuff we've already put out.

We've just added the project to Gumroad as well. Eligible backers have just got a direct message via Kickstarter (not email, we never send emails unless you contact us directly via email).
The message contains instructions on how t claim the Dwarves via Gumroad as an alternative to Sync/Dropbox.
Thanks again,

So just a quick heads up.
Dropbox has already reached it's limit so if you experience a 404 error with the dropbox link, it still exists it means its reached it's daily download limit and takes 24 hours to reset. We've ran into this before and it's one of the reasons we use Sync as they don't have a daily limit.
Dropbox's top plan (which we are on) allows 200GB's of downloads from the account in a day which is reached fairly sharpish. If you're desperate for the download and Dropbox is chucking out the error then use Sync.

Hey all,
For people who backed digital tiers, Dropbox is now available as a download alternative to Sync and you should now have a Direct Message with a link to it along with the password.
If you backed a digital tier and haven't got the link (there might be a few stragglers who added digital facility after the fact) then please Direct Message me and I'll sort you out.

project_data.project_name: The Dwarves

campaign.story:
Legendary game designer James M. Ward brings you Doom on the Warden, a Metamorphosis Alpha adventure of horror in space. The adventure includes pre-generated characters, and is playable as part of a campaign or as stand-alone play. Doom on the Warden is a new frontier for Metamorphosis Alpha, in both style and substance, and for the first time the pre-generated characters include wolfoids.
Floating Above the Starship Warden...
Think you know everything about the starship Warden?
Think again!
It was a little-known fact that the colonization starship Warden had many discrete safeguards and catastrophe protocols in place should complications arise during its long voyage. These safeguards proved insufficient to protect the Warden when it encountered the radiation cloud. When the ship’s computers analyzed the impending threat, the military A.I. enacted the Omicron Protocols, causing a portion of the ship’s dorsal hull to disengage. This portion, hidden within the Warden’s outer bulkhead, contains the classified military cantonment, code named “Level 0.”
Uncontrollably drifting through uncharted space, mankind’s first colonization starship Warden has survived for over 300 years. While floating through the interstellar dark, strange civilizations have arisen - mutant, human, and wolfoid. Battles have been fought, wars have been waged, and finally the end is near…if anyone survives. The moment has come to repair the Warden and return it on its course – or to disable it forever.
In 1976, TSR published Metamorphosis Alpha, the very first sci-fi RPG, written by James M. Ward.
In 2014, Goodman Games worked with Mr. Ward to re-release Metamorphosis Alpha in a deluxe hardcover edition.
In 2016, Goodman Games released Epsilon City, the largest expansion to Metamorphosis Alpha since its debut.
Now, in 2020, James M. Ward is back with an adventure to rival the deadliest crafted by the mind of Gary Gygax, Tomb of Horrors. Goodman Games brings you Doom on the Warden, the adventure that changes Metamorphosis Alpha forever!
Color cover edition of Doom on the Warden
About the Product
Since the release of Metamorphosis Alpha, the story of the starship Warden has continued unchanged, but that ends now. Doom on the Warden is the first-ever official Metamorphosis Alpha adventure that continues the story and answers the question…What next?
Format: Doom on the Warden will be published as an 8.5”x11” hardcover, with an estimated length of 32-48 pages. (This will likely grow with stretch goals.) The hardcover is available with a color cover, or in a gold foil edition. 
Author: Mr. James M. Ward is the creator of Metamorphosis Alpha and a 44-year veteran of the gaming industry, with prior creative credits that include Gamma World as well as many D&D products during his time as a creator and Vice President with TSR. Mr. Ward has already completed the manuscript, expanding on materials, playtests, and notes built over a lifetime of gaming, including some that trace back even to his famed original campaign.
Content: Doom on the Warden is packed with the answers to the starship Warden’s biggest mysteries!
The Adventure: James M. Ward’s most devious adventure ever! Part hex crawl, part deadly delve. Forty-four years after the original release of Metamorphosis Alpha, the story of the second half of the voyage is finally being told.
Campaign-Style Play: Drop this adventure into your ongoing campaign to turn everything on its head. Complacent denizens of the starship Warden will find themselves racing to uncover the deepest of the Warden’s secrets, and to restore its course.
Convention-Style Play: Three teams of pre-generated characters, each with their own individual reasons for undertaking this deadly quest, are ready to populate your table as the adventure was originally run.
The Maps: A map of the mysterious “Level 0” and the military command dome found within.
What is Metamorphosis Alpha?
Metamorphosis Alpha is the original science-fiction tabletop role playing game in which the players are passengers on the interstellar colony ship Warden. Struck by radiation, the ship’s occupants have mutated into unusual and deadly creatures. After several generations, civilization has been cast into ruins, and there is little knowledge of how to use the technology of the Warden. Reduced to tribal barbarians, they must struggle to survive amidst a backdrop of advanced technology, mutant monsters, and the vast spaces on an intergalactic colony ship.
Need a copy of the original rules? Goodman Games publishes a Metamorphosis Alpha Collector’s Edition, which reprints the original 1976 first edition rules set. The collector’s edition also reprints all the original Dragon magazine material for Metamorphosis Alpha, and has new content as well. It is available as both a softcover and deluxe oversized hardcover edition, as well as a foil oversized hardcover, and can be purchased as an add-on to this campaign.
Foil cover edition of Doom on the Warden (mockup)
What is Doom on the Warden?
At its core, Doom on the Warden is a horror story. Characters enter a strange, secluded location and are immediately confronted by incomprehensible foes who often strike without warning. Mad voices taunt them and, no matter how prepared the characters think they are, they are in truth out of their depth. Whether it is the primal dread of the shroud of darkness or the maddening uncertainty that vital equipment will work when called upon, the referee should emphasize the horrific elements of each region, seeking to unsettle not only the characters but the players themselves.
The adventure expands on the mysterious involvement of Earth’s military aboard the starship Warden, previously mentioned in The Warden Armory and the Goodman Games Gazette. There is new information on what happened in the Warden’s early days. Unraveling the mystery sends the characters through 4 distinct geographical regions, into the secret military command dome, and beyond. Along the way, they will be confronted by threats old and new across 54 possible encounter areas.
The Stretch Goals
We love Metamorphosis Alpha as much as you, so we’ve outlined a series of stretch goals to elevate your experiences aboard the starship Warden. Here is the breakdown of stretch goals, which may evolve over the course of the campaign:
Stretch goal #1 ($7,000): CLEARED! First set of printable reference cards. There are 100+ creatures, weapons, and items to encounter in this adventure. We would like to create simple cards to summarize them for players and judges alike. These will be provided in PDF format and can be printed for use in game. This first stretch goal will cover creation of approximately 30 such cards, which should encompass most of the weapons in this adventure. 
Stretch goal #2 ($12,000): CLEARED! Two new colored metal arm bands available as add-ons. First launched in our previous Metamorphosis Alpha projects, these metal arm bands mimic the control bands in the original game. These make great tabletop props and Mr. Ward allows their use in his convention games. At this stretch goal, we will manufacture two kinds of new bands: the bio-science band (first encountered in Level of the Lost), and the military command band (first seen in the Warden Armory). These will be add-ons available at $10 each.
Stretch goal #3 ($15,000): CLEARED! Second set of printable reference cards, similar to the goal above. This will be another 30 or so such cards, which should be enough to cover most of the items encountered in the adventure.
Bonus stretch goal! ($19,000) CLEARED! Backers will receive a PDF of Level of the Lost! 
Stretch goal #4 ($22,000): CLEARED! Printed endsheets with great art to adorn them!
Bonus stretch goal! ($24,000): CLEARED! Backers will receive a PDF of The Android Underlords and Warden Adventures. 
Bonus stretch goal! ($26,000) CLEARED! Backers will receive a PDF of Robots Among Us. 
Stretch goal #5 ($27,000): CLEARED! Third set of printable reference cards, similar to the goal above. This will be another 30 or so such cards, which should cover most of the monsters, mutants, and robots encountered in the adventure.
Bonus stretch goal ($29,000): CLEARED! Backers will receive a PDF of The Mutation Manual.
Stretch goal #6 ($35,000):CLEARED!A sewn-in satin ribbon bookmark to hold your place when you run the adventure.
Stretch goal #7 ($45,000): Expanded page count on the printed books to include some or all of the reference cards. There are some printing parameters we'll have to verify but the goal is to get most or all of the reference cards printed and bound into the book.
And beyond that...who knows?
Doom on the Warden color arm bands (mockup)
Add-Ons
There are so many ways to support this Kickstarter!
Add-On Items from Previous Metamorphosis Alpha Projects: You can add any of the below print items to help support the Kickstarter and achieve stretch goals.
 Metamorphosis Alpha Collector’s Edition, softcover edition, $30
 Metamorphosis Alpha Deluxe Collector’s Edition, oversized hardcover edition, $80
 Metamorphosis Alpha Deluxe Collector’s Edition, oversized hardcover gold foil edition, $120
 Metamorphosis Alpha deck plans illustration, 24"x36" poster, $20
 The Android Underlords (adventure), $10
 The Captain’s Table (adventure), $10
 The Level of the Lost (adventure), $10
 Death Ziggurat in Zero-G (adventure), $10
 Warden Adventures (scenarios), $10
 What are the Prisoners of Rec-Loc-119? (adventure), $10
 Creatures & Gadgets (sourcebook), $10
 The Mutation Manual (sourcebook), $10
 The Warden Armory (sourcebook), $10
 The Long, Hard Mile (solo adventure), $10
 Book of Handouts (visual sourcebook), $10
 Epsilon City, color cover boxed set, $60
 Epsilon City, gold foil edition boxed set, $80
 Epsilon City, leather edition boxed set, $150
 Gen Con 2015 Program Guide, $30
 Gen Con 2016 Program Guide, $30
Color Metal Arm Bands ($10/each as add-on items): With our previous Metamorphosis Alpha Kickstarter, backers have been able to obtain metal bracelets to simulate the colored arm bands in the original game. These make great tabletop props and Mr. Ward allows their use in his convention games. Backers of Doom on the Warden will be able to add on bracelets at a cost of $10 each! We will do a fresh production run to meet demand. 
The colors available are based on the previous two Metamorphosis Alpha Kickstarters, plus the two new ones from Doom on the Warden, and include all except the rare command band. The available colors are:
From the original Metamorphosis Alpha: civilian (brown), ecology (green), security (red), engineering (gray), and medical (white) bands.
From Epsilon City: military (black), programmer (yellow), sciences (light blue), administration (dark blue).
From Doom on the Warden: bio-science band (first encountered in Level of the Lost), and the military command band (first seen in the Warden Armory).
Additional bands may be unlocked via stretch goals. Quantities are limited!
Please note: the arm bands must be shipped separately from books and will have a small incremental shipping charge applied after the Kickstarter (roughly equivalent to an extra $1-$2 per armband depending on destination.)
Timeline for Release
Doom on the Warden is scheduled to ship in September of 2020. Many of our previous Kickstarters have expanded significantly in scope as successive stretch goals are cleared. If this project expands significantly with new stretch goals, we will provide an update on release date.
Shipping & Handling
Shipping and handling costs are not included in the pledge levels. At the end of the Kickstarter, Shipping and handling charges will be invoiced via BackerKit. This allows us to add on stretch goals as the project expands. Expected cost of shipping/handling may change if the project evolves from a single hardcover. If you are unsure how expensive international shipping can be, please ask us for an estimate.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Goodman Games has run many Kickstarters and all have been successfully fulfilled. Our main risk is racking up too many stretch goals and having that delay delivery!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: This pledge level is for new fans. It includes the OVERSIZED deluxe hardcover edition of the Metamorphosis Alpha Collector's Edition (with the basic rules), plus print+PDF copy of Doom on the Warden. When purchased together at this pledge level, they'll be provided at a $5 discount. Shipping will be assessed after the end of the campaign.

support.title: The Metamorphosis Alpha Collector
support.descp: This pledge level is for the ultimate dedicated fan. It is, in short, one copy of most of the Metamorphosis Alpha titles published by Goodman Games, at a discount of nearly 25% off full price. You'll receive a print+PDF copy of Doom on the Warden (color cover), plus print copy of all 12 of the $10 supplements for Metamorphosis Alpha (described in Add-Ons section of the text), plus print copies of the Epsilon City boxed set (color cover) and the Gen Con program guides from 2015 and 2016 (both of which contain Metamorphosis Alpha content), and of course the oversized deluxe collector's edition of Metamorphosis Alpha. All these items have a retail value of nearly $300, but when purchased together to support this Kickstarter they are only $230. Shipping costs will be calculated after the campaign.

support.title: Your Own Doomed Pregen
support.descp: This is a limited pledge level available only to a small number of backers. At this level, Metamorphosis Alpha James M. Ward will stat you up as a pregenerated character, to be included in the printed Doom on the Warden book. You name the type of creature you want to be (including humans and robots), and Mr. Ward will do the rest! This pledge level also includes print+PDF copy of the autographed foil edition of Doom on the Warden.

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We have completed shipping for Doom on the Warden!
By now all backers should have received a tracking number in BackerKit indicating the package is on the way, and hopefully seen the package itself arrive as well.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.

Hi everyone,
Just a quick update to let you know that outbound shipments continue. 
Among this week are "makeup shipments" for backers whose deliveries had missing items, as well as the last of the international shipments. We anticipate that we will close out all shipments this week. 
From the comments, it sounds like the books are landing and you guys are enjoying them! That's great to see.

Hi everyone,
Just a quick update to let you know that Doom on the Warden shipping continues. We're about two-thirds complete at this point.
To answer one common question: if you ordered a Warden deck plans poster, it will arrive separately in a poster tube. The rest of the pledge items should arrive together.

Hi everyone,
Good news! Doom the Warden shipping has begun. Many of you have already received email notifications with your tracking numbers, or perhaps even the book itself! 
About a third of the pledges are processed. We'll continue processing over the coming week or two, and will keep you in the loop as things progress. For now, keep an eye on your mailbox!

Hi everyone,
The books are here!
We will be locking addresses in BackerKit on Monday so we can begin shipping.
If you have moved recently and need to update your shipping address, please do so right now!

Hi everyone,
The Doom on the Warden books are on track to arrive in the next two weeks, so it is time to finalize shipping addresses. When you completed your BackerKit survey a couple months ago, you input a shipping address (if you had physical rewards). If you have moved since then, please log into BackerKit and update your address! For now these are still editable, and we will be locking addresses once the shipment of books physically arrives.

updates.update_userinfo: Add-Ons in BackerKit and a few other things
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
A few miscellaneous updates for you...
Add-On Items in BackerKit
We realized that we hadn't posted PDFs for all the add-on items in BackerKit (oops). That is now corrected. If you had previously attempted to download add-ons and found a couple missing, they should now be there.
The Boat Sets Sail

Hi backers, We have a few updates for you today. The most important is - we have advance copies of the book in house! Everything is still on track for December delivery. Here are some pictures of the advance copies for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Printer Proofs Approved; Estimated Delivery Date: December
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Doom on the Warden is at the printer, and the printer proofs are officially approved!
With this, we can now quote a delivery date. Based on the printer timelines, we expect to deliver backer copies in early to mid December.
Given the state of the world, unexpected surprises and delays do seem to occur more often than in the past. We will let you know if anything happens to change this date.

Hello backers! 
Just a quick note to let you know two things:
1. We have posted the final post-proofread versions of Doom on the Warden to BackerKit. We have also posted the final version of the downloadable item cards.
2. Since the book is now final, we have also sent it off to the printer!

project_data.project_name: Metamorphosis Alpha: Doom on the Warden

campaign.story:
A whole new spectrum of possibilities...
Using unparalleled new color customization tools and the newest, cutting-edge 3D printing technology, Hero Forge is excited to bring you full-color custom tabletop miniatures! 
Hero Forge will provide color design tools that are easy to use and incredibly deep. Design your perfect color 3D printed miniature!
Even the most prolific painters can find themselves overrun with hordes of unpainted figures, but no longer! Join us in our quest to cure the plague of monochrome minis; with your support, we will offer our most customizable tabletop miniatures yet!
Pledge today to get early access to the new color tools. Be among the first to order custom, full-color figures of your own design, printed with cutting-edge full-color 3D printing technology or hand-painted by our favorite mini painters!
With your support, we can’t wait to add color customization to our expansive collection of parts and features, once again revolutionizing the world of custom miniatures and allowing you to express your creativity like never before! 
Color 3D Print
Hero Forge 2.0 Color Tools enable you to bring color to your tabletop, no matter how you play. We are eager to support tabletop gamers of all kinds, whether you play in person or online. Here's how Hero Forge 2.0 Color Tools can help you...
Never picked up a brush in your life?
High-detail, vibrant color prints will capture your creativity better than ever before--no art skills required. 


If you prefer the more traditional route, check out our backer tiers that offer professionally hand-painted options where artists replicate your color design by hand, the old fashioned way.

 Are you a painter?
Use deep “digital paint” tools to plan your color schemes and see them applied to your model in real-time. Experiment with color theory, easily try out different schemes, or work with clients to ensure you have the right design before you even put brush to model. 
Are you a virtual tabletop user? 
Select backer tiers offer new tools for users who play online as well. Design and export custom "tokens" for use in your favorite virtual tabletop platform. These beautiful, drag-and-drop, 2D graphical representations of your characters will be exportable in several styles, at ready-to-use resolutions and formats.

Don't use minis at all?
Even “theater of the mind” players will find something to love! Use new photo booth tools to create the perfect character sheet image which can be updated as your character and equipment grows and changes.
Full-Color Custom Miniatures
Design your own digital 'paints' and see them applied to your model in real-time as you experiment with different designs and color schemes.  In-depth rendering and material design features will allow a revolutionary new level of customization. 
Then, make it real; we will provide two options for producing your custom color model and help capture your creativity better than ever before.  With your support, we’ll offer the most customizable and easiest to use color design tools the web has ever seen!
About the Color 3D Printed Miniatures...
For the 3D printing fan, we are using cutting edge additive manufacturing technology to make your design real with vibrant, highly detailed 3D printing. With groundbreaking 3D printing technology, color figures can be printed with remarkably vivid colors and dimensional accuracy. This represents one of our most ambitious additions to date—never before have we been so excited about a feature! We continue our long partnership with Shapeways, Inc., one of the leading names in 3D printing, to print and ship these revolutionary new figures all over the world.
About the Hand-Painted Minis...
For the traditionalist, we are also offering professionally hand-painted options. Design your color scheme online and have your miniature sent directly to professional artists who will recreate your digital color designs by hand!
We are working with top-notch painting studios like Den of Imagination and Mixed Dimension to bring you high-quality display-worthy professional paint jobs that are true to your digital design.
Our favorite painters will work from your saved color design, replicating your color scheme choices by hand-mixing paints to match your digital design.
Token Maker Unlimited
Design and export unlimited custom "tokens" for use in your favorite virtual tabletop platform. Available in both ‘profile picture’ and ‘overhead view’ style, you will be able to easily populate a virtual tabletop world with your hand-crafted character tokens formatted for easy drag-and-drop use.
This feature represents one of several new "pro tools" we will roll out in the coming year. Pledge for a year of Token Maker access, or pledge more for lifetime access with no future recurring subscription cost. 
Achievement Unlocked! The unlocked Portrait Studio stretch goal features will be included with Token Maker Unlimited, offering new and improved camera options and effects to our screenshot tools for the ultimate character sheet image!
Populate your virtual tabletop world! Export beautiful tokens in a wide range of styles.
At the conclusion of our Kickstarter campaign, your support will immediately go to work helping us deliver these full-featured color tools while continuing regularly to expand the library of parts and customization options on www.heroforge.com.
February 2020: We begin updating our library of thousands of parts for color compatibility. 
May 2020: Finalized user interface for color application, and the launch of beta access to color tools for all Kickstarter backers, and launch Token Maker Unlimited. 
June 2020: We will open order submission to Kickstarter backer for both 3D printed color and hand-painted color custom miniatures. While we ultimately expect to reach our typical fulfillment speeds, note that orders placed during this closed beta may take several months for fulfillment as we ramp up capacity. Fulfillment will be gradual, as we work through orders in the order they are received. 
This timeline is our best estimate, but we will open submissions and start shipping orders as early as possible. Note that, in the case of high order volume, order submission for both hand-painted and 3D printed color miniatures may be made available in stages, with priority based on time of the pledge. Backer reward redemption will be facilitated by digital voucher codes redeemable on www.heroforge.com.
We have been developing exciting new tools to fully utilize the most revolutionary 3D printing technology and hardware. It is a big job, but who better to do it than the makers of the original 3D printed custom miniatures?
High-Quality Web-Based Rendering
Whether you want to fully paint your design with a couple of clicks or hand-tune unique digital 'paints' to capture your character's aesthetic perfectly, we have you covered.
We wanted users to be able to do more than apply flat colors, so we looked to traditional, real-world painting techniques to inform our designs. Our rendering and UI has re-imagined classic techniques for the digital world. Replicate the beautiful subtlety of dry brushing, ink-washing's ability to add depth, and much more. Printed designs will include subtle shading and lighting within the color texture, making details pop and adding fantastic realism to your design.

By giving you the option to hand-tune highlights, low-lights, shininess, hue shift and more, we will give you unparalleled design tools and let you see a whole new spectrum of possibilities.
Cutting Edge Manufacturing Technology
3D printing has evolved at incredible speeds, with new technologies emerging all the time. We're happy to say that this thrilling new print technology means that highly detailed, color printed tabletop minis are finally possible! 
High-tech, full-color 3D printers turn pixels on the screen into atoms in your hand!
Color is produced by mixing a range of color materials on the fly, allowing for full, vivid CMYK prints with beautiful gradients and detail. This technology employs dissolvable support materials, removing the need for support sprues and allowing for smoother, more consistent surfaces than ever before.
This plastic is similar in durability to our premium plastic material. Faint layer lines may be visible on the surface of the figures, especially in strong direct light.
One-Click Color Schemes 
No need to have an art degree or knowledge of color theory to have fun coloring your character. You will be able to quickly paint your character in seconds, using a wide range of artist-designed color motif presets so you can “try on” a wide range of color schemes or use them as a jumping-off point for your own design.
A Multitude of Digital Paint Options
We'll offer a library of artist-tuned paint options for a wide range of materials. Experience the coloring-book joy of turning a character from grayscale to full, rich color quickly and easily!
 We'll also offer the ability to "mix your own paint." Customize more than just the color: adjust shininess, highlight, mid-light, and low-light tones, and more. Your hand-crafted digital 'paints' will be saved with your character, allowing you to revisit and tweak them to your heart's content.
Tons of artistically tuned options for every material, all at your disposal!
Five years ago, Kickstarter's support allowed us to launch revolutionary web-based design tools for custom miniatures. Since then, we’ve shipped hundreds of thousands of miniatures to dozens of countries around the world. We've continued to work tirelessly, adding content and working with the world-leading 3D printing service providers to deliver the latest and greatest technology--and the best custom miniatures on the market.

Since our launch, we've expanded our tools and customization options. We've added over a thousand new parts, two dozen new fantasy races, and ever-improving materials in both plastic and metal. In 2019, we began adding fresh content every single week. 
Tens of thousands of users have visited every "Treasure Tuesday" to see what we’ve added from our ever-growing ‘user wish-list’ of content requests. And we're certainly not done yet! You'll even find several sneak-peeks at upcoming parts sprinkled throughout this very Kickstarter! We continue to develop new models for the site, prioritizing the most commonly requested additions. 
Hero Forge adds new content every single week on what we call "Treasure Tuesdays!"
Why Kickstarter? 
Kickstarter has been an incredible tool to help us connect with tabletop and miniatures fans. This direct connection has helped us work with our most passionate supporters and offers an avenue to hear about what features and content you'd like to see added. Your backing will help us in the process of updating our library of thousands of parts to support rich, in-depth color customization, and launch exciting feature additions sooner.
The Future of Hero Forge

                       Hero Forge 2.0 will expand and enhance the design capabilities that Hero Forge is famous for. You can expect us to continue our tradition of innovation, setting the bar for customization and artistry for custom miniatures. 
Preview just a few of our planned additions and advancements in the hero featured in our splash image: XL epic wings, dynamic and detailed bases, magical weapon effects, and cute new companions represent just some of the exciting new features we have planned, so even more people can design their perfect miniature. With your support, we can add this new content even faster, and with the new Hero Forge 2.0 color tools in mind.
Hero Forge 2.0 is the platform for the future of 3D printed custom miniatures. Design and print the most epic of characters, not only in stunning detail, but in gorgeous full color.
Backer rewards include early or permanent access to a range of new features and tools on www.heroforge.com.
Early Access to Color Tools
Be among the first to start designing in color! Backer tiers starting at $34.99 will be given early access to our color design tools. Watch our UI and tools develop before your very eyes!

The First Opportunity to Order Custom Miniatures in Color
We are employing cutting edge technology to bring full-color custom miniatures to you. Backers will be first in line to have figures printed in this exciting new material as we scale up production.
Early and Permanent Access to New 'Token Tools'
Our token tools and new photo booth options will add a range of easy-to-use image capture features to Hero Forge. While we intend to one day add a range of pro-tools to a Hero Forge subscription services, Kickstarter backers will get access to the Token Maker Unlimited with no recurring subscription fees, receiving either a full year of access at lower tiers, or lifetime access at higher backer tiers!
...and Much More!
Want to offer even more support? Check out backer tiers which will allow you to work with our art team to add parts of your own requests and design to Hero Forge! Pledge to add decals, weapons, or armor to Hero Forge and be credited in the mouse-over flavor text of the character builder!
Do you want more than our existing backer tiers offer? No problem! Customize any backer tier with “Add-Ons.” Simply add the following amounts to your pledge to add these perks to your pledge à la carte:
We have a long list of features that we'd like to add to our color options. Your support will help us deliver them even sooner! Read on to hear about the first batch of six stretch goals, with more to be announced once these are met soon!

We're so excited about these last remaining stretch goals. We can't wait to see how many you will help us unlock during these final days of the Hero Forge 2.0 campaign!
Sky Castle Studios, LLC is a Santa Monica-based development studio dedicated to using gaming and technology to inspire creativity and connect people. Established in 2014 after the runaway-hit Hero Forge crowdfunding campaign, we continue to grow our cutting-edge web-based design application and explore the latest in 3D printing manufacturing. 
Special thanks to Fantasy Grounds for letting us feature screen captures of their virtual tabletop program, Kraken Dice for providing the dice featured in our photography, Izzy Gramp for color design, and Kate Elliot at www.kvephotography.com for editing our Kickstarter video.
We are lucky to work with incredibly talented artists all over the world, and would like to thank them for their contributions to Hero Forge. In particular, for their creativity and dedication, we would like to thank Glenn De Leon Garza, Ilya Bondarenko, Roman and Vadim at ZugZug Art, and Rich Carey.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Q: Will reaching your funding goal distract you from adding new content? Color is great, but I want more stuff on Hero Forge too!
A: Our modelers’ time and effort will still be dedicated to new content, parts, fantasy races, and features, even as our tech development team works on color at the same time. With independent, focused effort by our art team, we anticipate accelerating additions to the site, even as we add our new color features.

Q: Will I be able to redeem my reward for an "XL" or mounted "XXL" figure?
A: For simplicity, we have set rewards for our standard size-range, unmounted figures. If you prefer to redeem your reward's value towards a more expensive XL or mounted figure, that's alright: we will apply your pledge value and you can pay the difference. Pricing on larger-sized XL and XXL figures is TBD.

Q: I saw a part or feature in your video which isn't on your site yet! What's the story?
A: We have new parts, features, and content in development constantly. In order to keep up with weekly content releases, our art team works diligently on future releases, both those near completion and ones much further away. If you don't recognize any particular parts on this page, chances are they are in development and will appear on the site in the future!

Q: When are you going to add X part? Will Y feature be available when color launches?
A: We process all feature and part requests through the following survey, so please feel free to fill it out to have your request added to our official user wish-list: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/HeroForgeRequest. Our user request wishlist has many hundreds of unique entries, so we cannot provide estimated dates for specific additions.

Q: Will Hero Forge 2.0 be backwards compatible?
A: Yes! All of your existing characters and saves will be fully compatible with our new tools. You will be able to revisit old designs and add color.

Q: Will digital download .stl files be available in color?
A: No. Not initially, at least. File formats which support color are less widely supported by 3D printing software platforms, as color is not yet common for home 3D printers. While we expect to one day offer textured, color 3D model files, for the time being we will continue to distribute digital download model files in .stl format: the most commonly supported format for 3D printing software platforms.

Q: What Printer are you using for your color prints?
A: We plan to manufacture full color prints using the Mimaki 3DUJ-553 full color printer. We have experimented with a wide range of color printers, and have found this technology to offer the most vivid color, cleanest gradients, and best quality at miniature scale. At Hero Forge, we are always exploring the latest and greatest materials, and have historically added to or updating our material options as 3D print technology improves--this is always a possibility for the future.

Q: Do I have to use all my rewards at once, or can I order figures one at a time?
A: Backer tiers include one instance of shipping. If you'd prefer to redeem your backer rewards one at a time, you will simply need to pay for any instance of shipping after the first.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans!

We're back again to keep you up to speed on the latest Hero Forge news and Kickstarter developments. With only about a dozen stretch goals remaining, we wanted to pull back the curtain a bit and give some insight into what to look forward to and what's next! Enjoy this infographic and a video update from our CEO, Teagan Morrison.

updates.update_userinfo: 'Mud and Blood' Decals and a New Beta Feature!
updates.update_content:
Hello Hero Forge Fans! 
We’re constantly amazed by the creativity with which this amazing community approaches each new feature, achieving all kinds of inventive looks, effects, and characters that we'd never imagined possible when we first launched Hero Forge. To that end, we're excited to announce two cool new features, including a highly anticipated stretch goal and a new experimental option for our full color miniature prints. Read on for more info!

Hello there, Hero Forge Fans!
We hope the new year finds you well. We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest Kickstarter news and content additions. Since our last backer update, we’ve launched three more exciting stretch goals: “Light Emanating Surface Effects,” “Expanded Hand Items as Side Items with Posing,” and “Banners!” These new features are available to all Kickstarter backers through their beta access privileges and, as always, we welcome your feedback. Drop by our official color feature feedback survey (https://heroforge.com/color-feedback)and let us know what you think.

Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!
We’re back again with a very merry backer update! Read on to learn about how Hero Forge celebrates the season and find out about special Kickstarter content releases for the holidays.
Adventure Calendar

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Update - 3D Virtual Tabletop Models and More Stretch Goals
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!

We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest stretch goal progress, new content releases, and to announce an exciting new Hero Forge® product option! Read on for the latest news.

3D Virtual Tabletop Downloads (Compatible with Berserk Games’ Tabletop Simulator)

Ever since we teased the addition of color, we’ve had tons of folks ask about full-color download options for their favorite 3D virtual tabletop applications. Well, we have some good news! We’re thrilled to announce a brand new way to use Hero Forge: for gamers who play online using Berserk Games’ , we now offer a full color “3D Tabletop Download” option!

3D Tabletop Downloads are distributed in .unity3d format. This single-file format makes importing easy and provides superb faithfulness to your original design. 3D Tabletop Downloads are distributed via your user profile page, just like STL downloads, and we offer a free pre-made sample model which is available on your Digital Downloads page . Instructions for importing these models can be found in our support page . Please note that this is a beta feature which will only be visible for users with beta access--a ”public” release date is TBD.

Greetings, Hero Forge® Fans!
We’re continuing to hustle on stretch goals and are happy to report that we’ve added several new batches over the last couple of weeks!

New Arm Options
We’ve recently added a wide range of design tools to customize your character’s arms. Hero Forge® now supports four or six armed characters, and arm amputation options including shoulder disarticulation, transhumeral amputation, and transradial amputation. We also added a range of wraps and prosthetic choices for artificial limbs in both realistic and fantastical varieties, including the oft-requested pirate hook hand.

On top of that, we’ve also added the stretch goal for a brand new slider: arm length! This will allow you to stretch your character’s arms to longer, less human proportions.

updates.update_userinfo: The First Batch of Stretch Goal Decals Has Arrived: Hair Ombrés!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans
We're excited to announce that we've arrived at another 'first.' Our first set of decals is now available to Kickstarter backers! As a reminder, decals are additional color-customizable graphic elements that overlay existing parts and colors, adding a whole new layer of flexibility. They also represent one of the most labor-intensive additions to our new color tools, and account for a whopping 14 of our unlocked stretch goals.

updates.update_userinfo: Hero Forge Reddit AMA begins tomorrow at 11:00am PST!
updates.update_content: We will be hosting a reddit AMA on https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/ tomorrow at 11:00am PST. We’ll be answering questions about Hero Forge 2.0, 3D printed tabletop miniatures, and more. Feel free to drop by!

Greetings, Hero Forge Fans

We’re back again to keep you up to date on the latest Hero Forge news. Today is a big one, so read on for exciting updates!

Hero Forge 2.0 Released with New Content
After six months of tireless work, we’re excited to announce that Hero Forge 2.0 with color tools has been released publicly! The first thing you’ll notice is a new, more colorful restyling of our background and menus. We wanted to create a more epic environment for your creativity, and a space where color felt at home, so this aesthetic change felt like a natural evolution from our old grayscale background and menu. This also includes some minor, but long-overdue reorganizations, such as moving expression and eye direction into the “pose” menu.

We also wanted this update to be accompanied by ! Keen eyes will spot the arrival of a several exciting features:

updates.update_userinfo: Public Release for Hero Forge 2.0, “Hero Forge Pro” Subscription News, and More!
updates.update_content:
Greetings, Hero Forge Fans,
We’re back again to keep you posted on the latest and greatest Hero Forge news. Read on for important backer information!

Public Release of Hero Forge 2.0 Color Tools
Over the past six months, you've put our color tools beta through its paces, provided us with fantastic feedback, and created some of the most colorful characters we have ever seen! Now that a significant percentage of Kickstarter backers have redeemed their rewards and a multitude of bugs have been slain, we are excited to launch color tools to the public. At long last, we’re ready to announce an official date, and we’re happy to say it is right around the corner! You heard it here first, folks: This transition will also mark the arrival of some neat new features, including restyling our character creator UI with color in mind!

project_data.project_name: Full-Color Custom Miniatures with Hero Forge 2.0

campaign.story:
The coolest game to ever hit the planet first appeared some 38 years ago, featuring an electronic tower that lit up, played music, and somehow ran an epic fantasy adventure game with its state-of-the-art technological wizardry. That game was Dark Tower. We want to bring you that same sense of awe and wonder, pushing the boundaries of what a board game can actually do. After 3 years of painstaking work by a team of two dozen designers, engineers, and artists, we are thrilled to present to you a game with echoes of that long-gone wonder but ultimately unlike any game you've ever experienced.
Return to Dark Tower is a game for 1 to 4 heroes who undertake epic quests, fight fearsome foes, and test their mettle against the looming darkness of the titular tower. Now featuring both cooperative and competitive play. Designed by Rob Daviau and Isaac Childres -- designers of the two highest rated games of all time on Board Game Geek -- along with Noah Cohen, Brian Neff, and Justin D. Jacobson, the streamlined rules offer players difficult choices about when to advance their objective, gather resources, deal with threats, or level up.
Each player controls a unique hero with their own starting inventory and special abilities. Along the way you gain helpful items, powerful virtues, and trusty companions to help you achieve your goal: Find a way into the Tower and defeat a powerful adversary.
Figuring out the best way to utilize all of these assets is the key to victory. The game actively works to stop you, responding to your decisions and taking advantage of your missteps. Foes, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, will stalk your hero and assault your buildings.
Our innovative combat system leverages the power of the processor. Within the app, select virtual "cards" from each foe's unique deck, revealing the potential consequences of the fight. Then, use your hero's advantages to modify those results. Will you mitigate losses across the board, or focus on one to gain valuable resources for your effort.
Looming over the board, the Tower itself is the greatest menace you'll face. Each turn, you drop a skull in, representing the threat of corruption. You decide where emerging skulls are placed, making those buildings less useful. At times the Tower itself springs to life, releasing trapped skulls in a single wave or revealing glyphs that sap your will.
The path to victory is fraught with peril. Battles and events can give your hero corruption. If you don't cleanse skulls from the buildings to keep them in check, the supply quickly dwindles.  
Tarry too long and face the risk of having all of the seals of the Tower break. Corruption, skulls, and time: Any one of these pitfalls can spell defeat.
Return to Dark Tower constantly presents new challenges. The adversary within the tower, the plan to access the tower, and the suite of foes you will face can mix and match in thousands of combinations. Play the same array over again or try something completely new.
For complete information on how to play, you can download the draft rulebook: 
Or check out this live playthrough we'll be doing on the Dice Tower:
We've also arranged for a how-to-play video by Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! at the time of release. 
Created by a world-class team of designers and engineers led by Tim Burrell-Saward, an expert in technology-augmented games, the Tower itself is a game component without equal. From its very foundation, it's been devised to play an integral role in the game. Using a collection of magical-yet-reliable technologies, it generates game moments that simply wouldn't be possible without it. The Tower literally and figuratively dominates the table, drawing upon all of these powers to foil you. You will grow to curse its name.
Learn more about the intense tower development and prototyping process in Tim's designer diary.
The game itself is rich and satisfying. But we have a few additional items in this campaign to upgrade your play experience even further.
For those of you new to Kickstarter, an "add-on" is something that's not included with a regular pledge. If you're interested in getting the neoprene board or any other add-on we might add to the campaign, it's really simple. You have two options:
You can manually add the amount of the add-on to your existing pledge. (For the mat, it's $45 including shipping.) If you have already backed and you go to the top of the campaign page, you'll see a button in the top right that says "Manage your pledge". Click on it and it will take to you a "Change your pledge". Then you can click on the "Change your pledge" button. Then, in the box with your "Pledge amount" you can manually add the cost of the add-on to your pledge. Click "Continue" and your good to go. (NOTE: You can also use this method if you want to upgrade from the Charge the Tower to the Azkol's Fortune level.)
You can add any add-ons in BackerKit (our pledge manager) after the Kickstarter campaign is over. I'll talk more about how pledge managers work as we get closer to the end of the campaign, but it might help to think of it as an online store where you "spend" the money you pledged in the Kickstarter campaign and where you can add new items too, like the neoprene board.
The Alliances expansion offers new rules and components to add further depth and variety to the game. It includes two new heroes, who can be used in any game. The Archwright fortifies buildings to protect the kingdoms; the Haunted Recluse dabbles in forbidden lore to powerful effect. Influence is a new resource that can be used to form alliances with powerful guilds or to thwart the capricious whims of the nobles. It also features new treasures and allies with more intricate abilities for experienced gamers.
The Dark Horde box contains stunning sculpts by Punga Miniatures of all the foes in the game. These figures bring the foes to life. (Keep checking back here as we unlock new foes and show off new sculpts.)
 The Coffers box replaces the cardboard resource tokens from the game and the Alliances expansion with top-quality, heat-transfer plastic tokens that have a great feel and durability.
 This 50mm diameter and 5mm thick metal coin signifies the active player. If you signed up for notification before the campaign launched, you will receive this for free if you back the kickstarter and get at least one copy of the game.
Seriously, folks. This mat is huge and heavy. It's about 80% larger area than the game board. This makes the spaces larger as well of course, which can be a boon if you're playing with the miniature foes from Dark Horde. A real specialty item for those who want to play an epic game on an epic stage.
 Check out this rendered example of a gold foil art print:
Give all your cards a little extra protection. This add on includes enough high-quality sleeves to cover the cards in Return to Dark Tower and the Alliances expansion. 110 standard card sleeves and 85 mini sleeves (plus some extras for lost or broken sleeves). Most sleeves will have a custom print, but some standard sized sleeves will be completely clear to accommodate the double-sided cards.



Part of the fun of Kickstarter is achieving new heights and unlocking those sweet stretch goals. We've already packed a ton of content into the game, but we'll manage to find a way to get even more goodies in there. So let's break those seals!

At PAX Unplugged, we were able to run a number of tabletop media folks through the game. These opinions were freely given and provided without compensation. Here's what they had to say:
We know you'll love Return to Dark Tower. But you might be wondering why you should back now. There are four main reasons:
 You can get what you want. The game itself is not exclusive to Kickstarter. We do have a retailer pledge in the campaign, so there are stores who will have the game when it fulfills. However, we are still unsure if we will be able to sell the game into retail distribution, and the add-ons are particularly unlikely to be available widely if at all. Backing is the one way to make sure you get what you want.
 You'll get the game early. Even if the game does ultimately go into retail distribution, we promise to hold the retail street date for at least 90 days after fulfillment is completed. As a thank you for backing, we want to make sure our backers get the first chance to play.
 You'll get the game cheaper. As you can see above, you will pledge less than the suggested retail price. While it is true that some online retailers often sell games for below the regular price, that's less likely in this case. If the game ends up not going into retail distribution, aggressive discount merchants won't have access to it. Even if it does, the discount is likely not be much better than what we're offering in the campaign.
 You get to be a backer. Being a backer means being part of a community. You'll get to speak up on decisions we make during the campaign and share ideas with other backers. Most importantly, you'll help make this game become a reality. Some publishers have taken to using Kickstarter as a pre-order system. That is very much not the case with Return to Dark Tower. We simply could not make the game without the success of this campaign. You'll be a part of that success and part of unlocking stretch goals to make the game even better.
If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easier than it looks, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun! You can download this PDF file to learn the ins-and-outs of being a backer:

We are once again using Quartermaster Logistics to oversee the fulfillment process. They have an extremely efficient system, quality packaging, tracking information, and their customer service is second to none. We have key fulfillment partners within each shipping region and will freight the games directly to them, so there will be no surprise charges, such as customs fees or VAT, to the US, EU, Canada, Australia, and China.
Please use the chart below to calculate your shipping fees. Due to an error in setting up the Kickstarter page, some countries are charged at the time of pledge, while others will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign. You will also be charged additional shipping if you order add-ons or multiple copies and at similar rates.


We cannot ship to PO Boxes or to the following countries: Afghanistan, Burma (Myanmar), Cuba, Iran, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Russia, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.
We are also thrilled to be using BackerKit again. They are a "pledge manager", a third-party service that lets us manage our orders and fulfillment. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll be able to add items to your pledge at that time. If you are unsure about what items you want to get during the Kickstarter campaign, you can back at the "Map to BackerKit" level. This will qualify you as a backer for any backer-related goodies and will give you access to the pledge manager to fill out your order later.
RETAILERS
We have a special pledge tier for verified brick-and-mortar stores: For Bazaar Proprietors Only. You pledge only $50 during the campaign. In the pledge manager, you will finalize your order. However, you will not have to pay the remaining balance due until the games are ready to ship. Please click here for detailed information and terms.

Restoration Games was founded in 2016 by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory,  bringing the fun we had to a new generation of gamers.
SPREAD THE WORD
A Kickstarter campaign is only as strong as its backers. You will help push this project to be the best it can be. We greatly appreciate anything you can do to let people know about this campaign, whether it's posting to your social media accounts, sending emails to your friends, or letting a co-worker know about us.
If you haven't joined the game's facebook group, go do it. We've got a great group of fans, talking about the game, and it's a good place to go to ask questions.
Another fun way to spread the word is adopting a social media avatar. Tag yourself:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our third Kickstarter, and they just keep getting bigger. So, while we've learned from each one we've done, the challenges keep getting bigger as well. Notably, the tower itself is a complicated component with mechanical and electrical components. Fortunately, we've enlisted Tim Burrell-Saward and Andrew Sung, both with significant experience on these types of projects, to assist us in overseeing the manufacturing process. We've also built additional time into the delivery date to give us a buffer to deal with any potential issues that might arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Titanic Update: Revised Fulfillment Timeline and a Bunch of Other Stuff
updates.update_content:
Lots and lots of stuff to talk about. Everything is picking up the pace as we finalize manufacturing. To keep this update from getting too long, I'm going to update you all on the fulfillment timeline and then do some quick hits about a number of other things. Let's get to it!
Fulfillment Timeline

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: An APP-etizer with Tim Burrell-Saward (and Live Playthrough Next Week!)
updates.update_content: One critical part of the game we haven't shown much of is the companion app. In fact, our app developer, Porcelain Fortress, headed by the inimitable Björn Elíeser Jónsson, has been working non-stop for more than two years on it. And we're finally ready for you all to have an early look. I tapped Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer, to do a deep dive on the app's heroic journey to date. As with all of these updates, keep in mind that we are still refining and will continue to refine until the game gets into your hands and beyond. Everything here is still "in progress". Specifically, a lot of the text has not even had an editing pass. Let me make this extra-clear:

updates.update_userinfo: Final Engineering Prototype and Detailed Plastic Photos
updates.update_content:
As some of you might have seen, the team received a slew of FEPs this past week. "FEP" stands for "final engineering prototype". Sometimes also referred to as a "mass-production copy", it's the first full "game" comprising all of the final files intended to be used for mass production. It's one last check to find any last little problem before we hit the big red button that says: spend a million dollars and make 25,000 copies of this game.
I have to say, it's an extremely rewarding milestone. This is a project that I've been working on for three years. To open a box and see an actual playable game, is pretty amazing. But it's also a bit tense. It's a major checkpoint, where you're likely to run into issues that need addressing. You're just hoping that they're all manageable.

updates.update_userinfo: Call for Playtesters and a Look at the Hero Minis
updates.update_content:
We continue to make steady progress in the production process. All of the print materials have been locked down. Plastic production by Panda is underway. I've got a sweet photo of those hero minis for you in a minute.
But first, I'm putting out a call for playtesters. With the print materials locked down, we're looking to refine the data in the app to further balance the game and make it more fun. These playtests will be done in Tabletop Simulator (on Steam) and (unlike prior playtests) will use the actual app (with a built-in Tower simulator). We know some of you signed up for and did some playtesting for us last year. But circumstances can change -- especially during current events these days. So, even if you signed up before, if you're still interested in testing, please sign up again. To playtest, you will need access to Tabletop Simulator and an Android or iOS device to run the app. You would be able to playtest remotely, but it would be easier if you have a group that can get together in person to share the app device.

updates.update_userinfo: * IMPORTANT: Mobile Devices Survey - PLEASE FILL OUT *
updates.update_content: Listen, some updates are less exciting than others. Although I don't have anything sexy to show off, this is a very important update. The app infrastructure is nearly built. We'll then be moving into testing (and data editing). It would be extremely helpful to know what devices you all are planning on using to play the final game. This will help us make sure that the final version of the app is thoroughly tested for those devices. We'll have a deep dive update on the app with lots of gorgeous screen shots, but in the mean time, please go to this link, preferably with your device in hand, and complete this very brief, 4-question survey: MOBILE DEVICES SURVEY LINK

As I've mentioned, I'm planning on doing more, shorter updates on a regular basis, punctuated by longer, more in-depth updates when something important happens. Today, I've got a quickie.
As you know, we are in the very final stages of the Tower engineering before we sign off and manufacturing begins. Even then, they'll need to test the Towers to make sure they're working. That's easy for the other components: are the cards printed correctly, do the minis look good, etc. But how do you test an electronic Tower?

In this update, I'm going to show off the insert for the game (with a good look at the current state of the box as well). Basically, an unboxing in jpgs instead of video. It's a lot like an onion: multiple layers, and it'll make you cry (cause it's so beautiful). At the end of the update, I'll bring everyone up to speed on the general state of the project and where we are with various other parts of the game. So, if inserts don't tickle your toes, you can jump straight to the end.
Before we get into it, the usual caveats: This is 99% final, but that means it's 1% not final, which basically means things can still change. Not likely but possible. This goes doubly for the box render and the stuff rendered in the insert, like the punchboard and rules and such. Without further ado, let's start at the top.

updates.update_userinfo: A Closer Look at the Competitive Game
updates.update_content: For this update, I'll be showing off a bit more of the competitive game. As most of you know, the original game from 1982 was a competitive game. Players raced to defeat the brigands in the Tower. The first one to do it won the game. Early on in our development, we decided to make our restored version cooperative. We think it's more thematic appropriately and mechanically. But we knew some folks would like to be able to play competitively like in the original. We continued to work on it even as we entered the Kickstarter and finally announced we were doing it way back in Update #11.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Check Out the Box Bottom
updates.update_content:
As we move into this next stage of production, my plan is to post smaller, more regular updates and start showing off some stuff you all haven't seen or that has been updated since the campaign. Today, we're going to take a quick look at the box bottom.
First thing to mention is that it's not really the box bottom at all. The box will, of course, have a bottom, but this ain't it. Bigger picture, we know that you all have paid a lot of money to get this game. Granted, most of the expense is in that beautiful electronic Tower that will sit in the middle of the table. But we want to make sure the rest of the game meets that high bar. Traditionally, a box bottom serves as a marketing piece to attract the eye of someone browsing at the store, and it also has a number of legal requirements, like safety icons and copyright notices. Fine and necessary, but not pretty to look at. So we made the decision to have the traditional box bottom turn into a separate slip sheet that is placed over the box bottom and held into place by the shrinkwrap. When you open the shrink, you can toss the sheet. This meets our needs for the store shelf, but allows you to have a beautiful game box on your shelf at home.

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: Checking in on the Tower with Tim Burrell-Saward
updates.update_content:
I know folks like to get a closer look at the manufacturing process, and there's no one better to fill us in than Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer.
Before we jump in, Board Game Geek's annual "Most Anticipated" list is underway. Nominations are open for games you're looking forward to this year. If you're willing and able, we'd appreciate your support for our nomination. All you have to do is click here and click the green thumb under the box cover. Thanks!

campaign.story:
Thank you for checking out our project.
We have here a project for you to purchase the files to allow you to print your own animal companions for your favourite tabletop games at home.  As much as I would love to produce these as a physical product, costings and economical changes sadly makes this very difficult, so in order to still release these awesome beasties into the big wide world here we are.
These realistic animals have been sculpted by amazing artists, each has its own unique details and have been sculpted using the inspiration from real life counterparts. (with the exception of the obvious :-)
After this project we will have the files available to purchase separately, based on size with a RRP of between £5-15 pounds (excluding T-rex and Tarrasque) So if you want to grab a bargain of STL files, now is the time to do so.  To make fulfilment as easy as possible, the singles will not be offered in this campaign. 
These files have been tested using SLA printers. Those using a filament based printer, please be aware that resolution may vary.
