campaign.story:
Hear ye, hear ye!
Introducing Townsfolke 2: the Free Folke, a sequel to the original Townsfolke campaign that was funded in 2018. This time around we've got civilian/NPC miniatures from the varied fantasy races to help diversify your RPG/wargaming experience.
WHAT IS TOWNSFOLKE?
Townsfolke is a range of 3d-printable miniatures designed by us (Ill Gotten Games). This campaign is for the digital files (not finished miniatures). Townsfolke models (like much of our catalog) are designed to be easy to print at stock settings, and print without support material.
The miniatures from the core rewards printed in resin.
Each Townsfolke model can be printed with or without a textured base. Though optimized for stock FDM printing (with detail levels to match), you can print these models in resin as well (and can do so without support that way too).

WHAT DO I GET?
The base pledge ($15) gets you all 15 miniature files included in the core set:

IS THERE MORE?
You bet! Not only do we have an extensive range of existing Townsfolke sets available on our storefront (and included with a higher pledge level), but as we unlock stretch goals, every backer at the $25 level and higher will get bonus sets added to their haul. We'll update this space as stretch goals are revealed/added.

In addition to these new sets, we have an extensive range of Townsfolke sets that are currently available for purchase. These sets will also be added to pledges at the $70 level and higher.
Plus, we have a free starter set, featuring tavern patrons, town guards, a(n ominous looking) ferryman, and more!
And- we've released a special set, the Interplanar Dutchess with Pet Mimic, that's available for free via Thingivere! 

WHAT SCALE ARE THESE MINIATURES?
Townsfolke are firmly in the 32mm scale, which means they'll be compatible in size with Reaper Miniatures, CMON, modern Games Workshop models, Hero Forge, and most other contemporary/mainstream ranges. However, if you play in a specialty scale, you can easily re-size the models before printing. (If re-scaling, you'll probably want to print the base-free versions and base them afterward to keep fidelity with the rest of your collection.)
The guidelines above should work, but when in doubt, eyeball the scale change next to a model that you know is in the scale you want.

WHAT IF I DON'T HAVE A 3D PRINTER?
If you don't own a 3d printer (or know someone that does), some of our Patreon members are licensed to sell our Townsfolke models (along with the rest of our catalog of designs), and you can find a list of licensed printers here. It's not necessary for you to back this campaign to buy printed versions from our patrons, simply reach out to them and place an order!

MINIATURE GALLERY
Dwarf Traveler (on and off base) printed by Patreon supporter, Scott Frega
Various FDM prints (Ender 3) by Patreon supporter, Mike Sheridan.
Dwarf travelers on a journey, printed and painted by Patreon supporter, Stephen Renwick.
Pixie Pickpockets printed by Patreon supporter, Scott Frega
The Interplanar Dutchess taking Blue (her pet mimic) out for an off-leash stroll.

Well, we did it again, folkes, and all thanks to you!
We hit the final stretch goal (Orcish Nobodies) in that last bit, so when funding comes through (takes Kickstarter a couple of weeks or so), we'll have the whole spread for you! Putting the finishing touches on the last couple of models, so we'll have an update before then.
Thanks again, and we'll be in touch,

Well, we've met the Wood Elf Wedding stretch goal (which means it'll be added to all pledges at $25 and higher), and we've updated the page to include the next stretch goal, "Orcish Nobodies."

She’ll be part of the ‘Orcish Nobodies’ stretch goal set (in regular and ‘pig-nosed/p’orc’ flavors). This’ll be next after we hit the Wood Elf Wedding.
More soon,
-Dutchmogul

campaign.story:
Hello! welcome to the Monstro kickstarter, a large figure set of chibi styled 32mm miniatures cast in high quality resin. The inspiration around these figures are of old RPGs of yesteryear and the goal of creating miniatures that combine a bit of whimsy and retro game sprites. 
This project specifically is a collaboration between myself and a fellow everything artist David Johnson. We are both traditional sculptors that have transitioned to digital as well as molders and casters with around 20 years of experience combined. Miniatures are made in-house with quality in mind. We hope that will bring confidence of the pricing as well as insurance of knowing we are not only in care of the creation of Monstrous but also the manufacturing. Bases will be plastic unless otherwise stated. 
I have also finished and delivered upon a previous kickstarter and hope to show everything I have learned from mistakes to successes. Thank you for reading and I hope you enjoy the rest of the page! 
Shipping delivery date varies, 2020 is only the latest estimate if things go terribly wrong, but should expect deliveries as early as 3 months after the kickstarter. 
We'll do our best to get these packages to where they need to go and offer the best rates we can at the time. These are estimates and we'll do our best to manage customs costs with our shipping partners. 
Your address and shipping will be collected in the pledge manager
These are estimates and can be higher or lower depending on fees and weight. 
 USA: $3.50 - 14~
 CANADA: $8 - 25~
 EUROPE: $15 - 20~ 
 ASIA: $15-30~ 
 AUSTRALIA: $15 - 20~ 
 NEW ZEALAND:$10 - 20~ 
 REST OF THE WORLD $ Varies
Cannot ship to: Afghanistan, Brazil, Myanmar, Cuba, Iran,  Kazakhstan, North Korea, Sudan, Syria, Ukraine, and Yemen. 
Special thanks to
Eric Pyszka, for being a pain in our behinds. 
Kyung-Min, for his mighty efforts. 
Dave's wife Annie for not killing him. 
Nick J. for looking at stuff. 
and the folks at twitch that happen to still follow us despite us not streaming.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Death, death is essentially the only thing that will stop us from getting these figures to everyone. We're very confident on our abilities to mold and cast, which is around 20 years combined. Everything is being done in-house and nothing is being sent off, we control nearly every aspect besides hand delivering these packages to everyone. The timeline has been put down as a year to ensure of any hiccups such as fires, tornados, aliens abductions, or freak resin shortages. 

Joking aside, we both put our reputations in front of us and have much love for what we do, we do not plan to squander such a great opportunity you have placed in our passions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hello everything is gradually shipping, currently working on the last 12 orders. I am estimating that everything will be sent by the end of next week plus or minus a few days. That about wraps everything up, take it easy folks.

updates.update_userinfo: Deliveries should start once more come next week.
updates.update_content:
Hello! with finally some good news the printer has arrived and I have been going through a bit of learning of the machine as majority of how I set up the pieces for printing has changed. As of right now i'm going through experimentation with the new printer seeing what it can and can't do. The Form 3 itself is unfortunately not a large upgrade from what I'd imagine but I feel it's more software related and being an early adopter means I'll have to deal with the growing pains.
 I'm currently re-optimizing all the minis and will be starting deliveries once more at the start of next week. If you have moved locations etc, please double check your addresses on crowd-ox.
So I just got this e-mail:

Hello!, wanted to update everyone about the printer delivery. I have been e-mailed with an update of my form3 printer shipping on before or on August 19th . With that in mind, I should start sending out orders the last week of August and should finish sometime mid September. I do apologize again for the delay and hope to get these minis in everyone's hands in September.

Hello!, this is a follow up from the last shipping update. The 3d printer is borked, at least for any easy fixes, prints everything but the smallest details, the details I need for miniatures. Unfortunately this causes a month delay to the July-August zone for final delivery unless I can magically get this printer fix. On the upside the 3d printer i've already purchased and waiting for is the new form 3 and should be getting even better quality prints than the previous batch. That's about it, sorry for the delay I wanted to get these out in record time but the printing gods have decided not today.

Hi, just wanted to throw out an update while I have a bit of downtime. I am at the last 24 packages, would be at around 12ish at this time but have been repairing my 3d printer. Prints are printing back to semi normal now and I am just doing re-calibration tests, this pushes the expected kickstarter delivery end probably towards somewhere in the middle of June. I'll keep everyone posted if there are any more hiccups. Even if there is, I have a printer coming in July so in the event of a catastrophic failure it's just a month delay. 
That's about it folks, see ya next time.

Hello!, been a bit since I've posted an update so here is all the happenings. 
I am nearing the halfway point on deliveries with a big batch going out today. Bigger orders will have to wait a tad longer as I've had to order some boxes that should arrive mid/later this week. All in all majority of orders should be done by May, if not all, with a few stragglers that may go into June. 
That's about it, should be the last update pertaining to deliveries as they'll be done soon enough! Have a happy week everybody.

Hello!, been a week or so and everything is going well in terms of production, had a bit of a hiccup the very first week with the printer with the dragon being not quite printed correctly but have since remedied the issue and now have correctly printed the dragon correctly. The dragon pictured is the final prototype with the base slightly warped due to peeling too early, which has been fixed. The dragon was printed in 4 parts, the base, tail half, neck half, and head but I really disliked how the seam line was a bit problematic at the tail and neck half so I decided to shrink down the body a tad bit to fit in the 3d printer instead it's at around 170mm now but only requires gluing at the head and to the base which is notched. I figured shrinking it down a tad bit would be better than having a very obvious seam line though I do apologize for the loss of about 20mm.

Just wanted to show the final update in terms of showing preproduction pieces. These are pieces that are pretty raw without any clean up and an actual just plain water rinse, one even has a support I missed. I wanted to show them as rough as I can so everyone can understand what they'll be getting without any frills or advertising tricks. I have made the bases as thin as I could so for people that want to use custom bases can just glue them on without issue. Pictured below is the comparison with the final and the previous prototype iteration.

We have teamed up with the kind people over at CrowdOx to send you an extremely simple survey in order to collect the info we need to fulfill your rewards. You should expect to receive the invitation on or around: 4/9 - 4/10. The entire process should only take a couple minutes to complete.
  The invitation will be sent directly to the email address linked to your Kickstarter account. Be sure to check your spam folder in case it was captured there!

campaign.story:
As a Dungeon Master you never know where your party is going to get into trouble next. Gone are the days of drawing and redrawing the most basic of maps and landscapes. Open Initiative!
banana for scale
one map left!
Many of the maps work cohesively with each other. Get two to make the maps even bigger and more customizable. 
Vualá! Shipwreck Cove
 Add on alert! Add $5 to your pledge level to get a page of reusable vinyl stickers. 
Vinyl plastic ✓ infinitely reusable ✓ never loses its stick ✓
Each Map costs money to make, I need your help to add many more maps to this book. My goal is to get enough funding to end up with 30+ Below is how I think we can do it!
Insta: DMSGUILD
Facebook: Yarro Studios Battle Maps
Twitter: Immersivebattlemaps
Want a little taste of the glory? Download and play on the Boar Booger inn now!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Atlas Mundi's Book of Battle Maps is ready. My friends and I have been playing on it and improving it for the past two months. And we have had amazing, ridiculous, and intense quests. This is cliche, but the biggest risk with this Kickstarter is that you miss out and don't get this book while you can!

With these battle maps, you have a visible world. We feel like this gives you the ability to be more creative as a party- everybody in the group can be on the same page and the Dungeon Master can focus on DM'ing instead of drawing. So be creative, for your character and as a group!

Finally, these maps have made D&D more engaging and faster for everybody at the table. Be open, be creative, and be spontaneous. Make your party's quests through The Book of Battle Maps worth remembering.

We are stoked that you get to experience the maps that we have come to love. We can't wait to hear how your adventures have gone!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Over $100k Canadian Raised! Four Stretch Goals Unlocked!
Time for some real Sweet Rolls!
I created Ice Cream Dice to address the severe lack of nearly edible looking dice in the marketplace. I believe I have succeeded.
OK, OK, that wasn't actually why I started Ice Cream Dice. I wanted dice that were fun, unexpected at a gaming table and a little bit whimsical, all while being usable. I started it because I was so tired of seeing the same dice offered on different sites, by different companies with different names. Names like 'Goblin's Blood' and 'Dragon's Blah Blah Blah'. 
When I got to thinking about fun and whimsical, ice cream came immediately to mind and I started on a journey to design the most ice creamy looking dice I could.
Neo, the classic flavor we all love to hate (well a third of it anyway).
Orange Dream, a dreamy mix of orange and cream.
Rainbow, also known as Schubert's Sherbet.
Your Favorite, whether your favorite is chocolate, coffee or caramel, this set has you covered with just a touch of cream.
Bubble Candy, old school bubblegum and carnival cotton candy.
Kiwi, it's even got the seeds!
The matte set on the left and the glossy d20 on the right.
Razzman, the Kickstarter semi-exclusive set. 
After this Kickstarter is done, Razzman will be offered once a year to celebrate the day this Kickstarter was fully funded.
Butterscotch: The epitome of potential. 
Butterscotch will be redone in production to look like Orange Dream. The original intent was to swirl white and a light brown with a highlight yellow/brown. Unfortunately, these are what I got and with no time to order more test sets, you'll just have to trust me. As you can see, I take my dice palettes very seriously, and will deliver on the potential of these dice.
The Dice You See are the Dice You'll Receive
Unlike some dice companies, there are no renders here, these are the dice you will receive. 
Except Butterscotch. 
Butterscotch will get the Orange Dream treatment with a brown and white gemini/swirled result.
Kiwi's numbers will be re-inked in a pale/golden yellow.
The Waffle Dish
This waffle dish is a Kickstarter Exclusive. They will never be made or sold again. These are each individually hand blown glass waffle dishes. They are made with borosilicate glass, which is often used in cookware. They are not as delicate as soft art glass, however, they are still fragile.
They are small. Roughly 1.5" - 2" high and about 2" - 2.5" across at the top.
This shot shows you how beautiful the inside is.
Ssssssssssstretch Goals
I could easily have done what most dice companies do and locked the popular dice designs behind fake stretch goals, but I won't. I could have easily found something that was sort of related to dice and offered that as a stretch goal, I didn't.
I'm a very small company (it's just me) and this is my first Kickstarter, so over complicating things to make it 'look' cooler seemed both dishonest and foolhardy. There's enough moving pieces already, and I'm confident I can deliver on these stretch goals.
QUICK EDIT: If you're stoked about the D6/D10 Sets and mini D6 Bricks, please read update #17. The graphic below will be changed to reflect the updated information later today.








Right about now you're saying to yourself, well, that's great and seems like you can deliver it all, but I WANT MORE! To that, I say, take a gander.
Add-ons, or...more ways to give me your money!
I have worked with small creators in our community to bring you two add-ons. These will both be available to add on to your order in Backerkit after the campaign ends.
Flavour of the Month
For $5 (approx. $4 USD / €3 / £3 ) You can take your kids, your friends or both on an Ice Cream Adventure written exclusively for Ice Cream Dice by Andrew Morley. The local ice cream maker has disappeared! It's up to your party to discover what happened to him. Along the way you may meet yourself some new elementals inspired by Ice Cream Dice. You'll receive a PDF copy of this sweet adventure by late June.
Handmade d4 Dice Bag
For $15 CAD (approx. $12 USD / €10 / £9 ) you will get a custom, handmade d4 shaped bag that holds over 100 dice! 
These are Ice Cream Dice exclusives. I partnered with people that could create things that were special, a bit whimsical and useful. These d4 dice bags aren't likely to be produced again. If you want one, this may be the only time to get one. The inside of this dice bag will be a waffle cone pattern, rather than polka dots.
Pins
For $5 CAD (approx. $4 USD / €3 / £3 ) You'll receive a soft enamel pin that will not only shout to the world you love dice, but also, ice cream.
If you love pins and just need a couple extra for every lapel you own, I got you covered! The pins are soft enamel with a rubber backing.
Ice Cream Dice Custom Dice Box
For $110 CAD (approx. $83 USD / €75 / £65 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice exclusive dice box made by the wonderful folks over at Dog Might.
For $150 CAD (approx. $114 USD / €100 / £85 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice box made out of stunning Wenge wood. This rare dark chocolate colored wood is stunning and sustainably sourced.
The folks over at Dog Might reached out to me after seeing my project and told me they had a great idea for a dice box. They weren't lying. These boxes have a lifetime warranty and are gorgeous. Dog Might only works with the best of the best in the industry. I will update this with more details and pictures once I have the prototype in my hands and have all the information.
From Dog Might:  The Dog Might Ice Cream Dice Box is crafted from Flame Birch wood and features a hand applied finish. It comes with a removable foam insert cut to cradle your set of dice perfectly. Remove the foam to easily carry two full sets of polys. Like all Dog Might products, the Ice Cream Dice Box comes with a lifetime guarantee. 
These boxes are prototypes and a couple of small changes will be happening in the final production. The edges of the D20 top will be a little crisper, and the front facing number will be a 20, because we all know that's the number we like to see the most!
The Blue Ice Cream Dice Box
This color combo is called cake by Dog Might, but I call it sno-cone!
The stunning Wenge wood box with Your Favorite. A match made in heaven.
Flat Pack Ice Cream Dice Dice Tower
For $25 CAD (approx. $19 USD / €17 / £15 ) you can get yourself an Ice Cream Dice dice tower made by the awesome folks over at Galaxy Gaming Gear.
The awe inspiring Ice Cream Dice Tower of Doooooooooooooooooom!
Galaxy Gaming Gear makes a slew of flat pack minis, terrain and buildings for all your gaming needs. Their designs are particularly kid friendly and it's great to have them on board. I will continue to sell this tower after the campaign, though the price will likely be $30.
I know, Mom said not to talk about the 'S' word, but we have to...Shipping.
Shipping is the one spell that neither creator, nor adventurer, can break. Being based out of Canada, I feel your pain. I have partnered with a Canadian company that ships straight from China. This is hugely beneficial to all of us, myself included, for a few reasons.
We don't have to wait three months for the dice to arrive by freight ship to North American shores, and then wait further while it's unpacked and sent to different shipping centers which then finally get it shipped to you.
It's reasonably affordable and delivered with tracking number and insurance to everybody.
I save money on not having to ship it by sea, which means I pass that savings on to you.
So here's the shipping breakdown, it doesn't cover every possible currency, but it covers a lot.
There, we did it, we had the dreaded 'S' talk.
Matte or Glossy, that is the Question:
Here are the side by side shots of the Matte & Glossy versions of each set. Some key things to keep in mind: 
The glossy look is achieved by tossing the dice into a rock polisher, so the matte dice are a little larger because they've haven't been polished for as long as the glossy sets. The matte Rainbow and Neo d20's are a little larger than the rest, due to being cast in resin.
The powdery look on the matte Neo and Rainbow will eventually wear off. The colors are still softer than gloss, but the frosty look is not permanent.
If you prefer your colors to be vivid and brighter, you'll want to go with the gloss.
Matte isn't very shiny, I know this should seem obvious, but if you like your dice shiny, go with glossy.
They do feel different, but the difference isn't night and day like it is with matte and glossy paper.
With less polishing, there is occasional color bleed around some of the numbers, it is negligible when it does happen and it only happened on a couple of single numbers on a couple of individual dice in the 25 test sets I got. This may be fixed in production, but I felt it was worth noting
Let's get to the comparison shots...
Neo
Orange Dream
Rainbow
Your Favorite
Bubble Candy
Kiwi, the numbers on Kiwi will be re-inked with a golden yellow during final production.
Razzman
The Final Butterscotch will look more like Orange Dream
Let's End this on a High Note
Thank you. They're two simple words that we often toss around without really thinking about what they mean. I think about them a lot and how they relate to this company.
'Thank' is defined as: to express gratitude to or to hold responsible.
So, let me say it again. Thank you. I hold you all responsible for the gratitude I felt every single day leading up to this launch, and will always feel. You cheered me on and you cheered me up, you shared my dice on your podcasts, streams, tweets, instagram, on Facebook. You made sure people knew about me and Ice Cream Dice. 
This company was inspired by some pretty amazing kids and my desire to make D&D and other TTRPG's more accessible to schools and kids. It is my belief that the skills learned and demonstrated while playing tabletop games, of any sort, are the ones we want our next world leaders to possess. Risk taking, problem solving, learning that you can't do everything by yourself, the value of friendship, exploration, listening to multiple viewpoints, among many other things. 
I didn't get here because of a marketing budget or the right analytics or targeted ads. I got here because of my own work and your support. I didn't get here because I hired a team or had an unlimited amount of money to throw at things. I've said from the beginning, what you see is what you will get. Initially I thought I meant my dice, I soon learned I meant that about myself as well. 
This community we're all a part of is amazing. I am proud, and humbled, to be a part of it. Here's to many sweet rolls with friends new and old!
Thank you,
Marc Schubert, aka Ice Cream Dice
A Really Great Facebook Group!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risk in this project is the production & shipping time required to manufacture the dice and get them to you, my backers. I have been working with my factory for a while now and they are expecting my order at the end of March. Production time is usually in the 45 - 60 working day range. So somewhere between 9 - 12 weeks. However, complications can occur, holidays happen and to be safe, I have estimated a 9 - 18 week production range into my timeline. This allows for the custom molds to be created that are required to honor the stretch goals that may become unlocked during the campaign.

I have partnered with a Canadian company that has years of experience shipping dice. They ship from their warehouse space in China which allows me to ensure a lower shipping cost that I can pass on to you, the backers. By choosing to ship from China I save time on the actual mass shipping of the product to North America.

Typically, shipping can take up to three months to get to North American shores, and then you still have to wait for it to pass through customs, get unloaded and then get shipped to the shipping companies who then, finally after a couple of weeks, ship to you. By shipping directly from China, using a Canadian company to do it, it'll take a few days to get to the warehouse and then the shipping to backers will start.

This is my first Kickstarter, and I've done everything I can to ensure that you receive a quality product on time and I have researched and learned from the mistakes of those that have come before me.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Get this Kickstarter Exclusive Hand Blown Glass Waffle Dish to display your beautiful new set of Ice Cream Dice.
You will receive a unique, one-of-a-kind, hand blown glass wafflecone dish that you can eat your ice cream out of (it's great for portion control) or keep your dice in when you're slaying dragons.
The hand blown waffle cone bowls are made with borosilicate glass, which is more durable than regular "soft" art glass. It's similar to what glass cookware is made out of.
Each waffle bowl is also annealed, a form of heat treatment that ensures the stress is taken out of the glass for maximum durability.

updates.update_content:
Finally time to put this one away.
Hey All,
I'll try and keep this as short as possible and outline the steps I'll be taking to finally finish this thing up.

A Half Ton of Dice Arrived!
Alright, so, the dice have arrived, and have been organized and put away, which I will begin shipping dice out next week. It will likely take me several weeks to get everything shipped out, as I want to make sure this is it.
By the time this final bit is taken care of, it's going to cost me over $5k CAD to honor my word to the best of my ability.

updates.update_userinfo: The Dice have Arrived! Shipping will Begin!
updates.update_content:
Finally, some progress...
It's been a while, and this will probably be a long one, so I'll get right to it.
This whole thing has taken much longer than it was ever supposed to, even with anticipated hiccups that were encountered early on. The pandemic has wrought havoc on the world and this Kickstarter got caught up in it, and is still in it, sort of.

Replacements/Never Received Dice
Things are going to start moving slowly in this respect. I am still waiting for my team to ship everything to me, but I received a small shipment of extra dice from this campaign that I had sent to be sold at conventions while everything seemed to be on track to finish up.
I will start going through the form, and next week I will start sending out packages to the folks that need sets replaced. I will also be refunding anyone that has requested a refund and starting to ship the sets requested from the shop as replacements.

I'm Sorry.
I'm sorry this campaign went awry in almost every way imaginable and then some.
After serious consideration, and talking with my team in China, some final decisions have been made. It will add time to things, but it will also ensure every package is tracked and has a better chance of arriving.

updates.update_userinfo: Replacements will Finally Ship in August
updates.update_content:
Replacement & Missing Dice Form Explanation
Alright, it's become pretty clear that what made sense to my brain (which admittedly isn't operating at full capacity these days) didn't make sense to a lot of you, so here's an explanation of the form, broken down question by question.
First though, I want to apologize for not giving you the option of Neo and Kiwi replacements. I will add them to the form, so that if you do want them, you can receive them. I'm going to go into a bit greater detail here about these. If you're here because the form was confusing, just skip to the next headline.

This Should be It.
We're going to cover a lot here, but this should be the final update. Yes, there will be a form to fill out, and unfortunately, even if you've filled one of the previous ones out before, I will ask you to fill this one out as well. It will ensure that you get whatever you need/want, and it will keep everything centralized so that I can send one last spreadsheet off to the fulfillment team and have all the information. There will be no need to confirm bad dice with pictures this time around.

Tomorrow: Pride Vol 1. Launches
And yes, I know not everyone has received their dice from this one yet. And nobody expected this/wanted this to go on as long as it has for some of you.
I came to the decision to launch the Pride Vol 1 after months of consideration, I've had the samples finished since last September, and was originally planning on launching it in February on the one year anniversary of this one launching, then Covid hit. So I delayed until April. Then I realized a small percentage of packages still hadn't made it to their forever homes, so I delayed again, until now.

Thank You. It's Been More of a Ride than I Ever Wanted
...but it's done. Mostly.
I spent the majority of this last year and a bit focusing on all the things that went wrong. And very little of it on the successes. It's now officially time to wrap this thing up, but it's not quite ready for it's bow entirely.

campaign.story:
DRAGONLOCK™ Miniatures are specifically designed to be the easiest-to-print minis you can buy for 3D printing. These miniatures are optimized for FDM-type 3D printers and do not require slicer-added supports to successfully print, as the sculpts are designed to self-support or in some cases have pre-designed supports built in. All of this means you can print highly detailed miniatures easily without having the hassles often associated with printing miniatures at home. Best of all, the miniatures in the photos you see are all printed on a $220 3D Printer (Creality Ender 3 available on Amazon HERE and from Creality) and a standard 28mm miniature only costs around 6-8 cents in plastic to print!  
All miniatures are delivered via DrivethruRPG as a downloadable .stl file, no physical minis are included.
We do not use an after-campaign pledge manager. All pledges must be in before this Kickstarter ends. 
Minotaur prototype sculpt.
Miniatures printed on a $220 Creality 'Ender 3' 3D printer.
'Angry Ball of Eyes' upper body paint example shown on painting stand (included).
We have a Youtube channel dedicated to teaching you how to set up a 3D printer, maintain it, and show you all the tips and tricks we've learned so you can print miniatures and terrain like a pro! Check it out HERE.
The Collection 1 pledge gets you Angry Ball of Eyes (x1), Goblins (x6), Turdles (x3), and Oxidation-beast (x1). Eligible for Bonus Items (but not Stretch Rewards.) 
The Collection 2 pledge gets you Skeletons (x6), Orcs (x3), Tentacles (x3), and High-five Monster (x1). Also includes all 'Collection 1' miniatures. Eligible for Bonus Items (but not Stretch Rewards.) 
The Collection 3 pledge gets you the Great Dragon (x1) and Lizardfolk (x6). Also includes all 'Collection 1' and 'Collection 2' miniatures. Eligible for all Bonus Items AND all Stretch Rewards.





NOTE: Final design of stretch reward miniatures is subject to change as modifications may be necessary to ensure proper printing.
Great Dragon paint example.
Bonus Items are similar to Stretch Rewards, and are unlocked on the Goal Map. Bonus items on the map are specifically listed as 'BONUS'. Every pledge level is eligible to receive all Bonus Items.
BONUS ITEM: 1" base miniature painting holder.

Stretch Rewards are only available for the Collection 3 pledge level. The Goal Map below will show what Stretch Rewards have been unlocked (please note, Bonus Items are also unlocked on this map as well.)

Snake Warrior & Minotaur test prints (Ender 3 printer).



Art by Jim Wampler (http://mudpuppycomics.com)
Add-on sets are previously released sets offered at a discount for this Kickstarter. To receive these, you must add the price shown to your pledge. EXAMPLE: To get the $10 pack shown below, and get the Collection 3 pledge, you would need to pledge $70 ($60 for Collection 3 + $10 for the Add-on set). 
Add $10 to your pledge total to receive this add-on set. You will receive a survey after the campaign ends to select which bundles your additional funds are for.
Add $130 to your pledge total to receive this add-on set. You will receive a survey after the campaign ends to select which bundles your additional funds are for.
Add $159 to your pledge total to receive this add-on set. You will receive a survey after the campaign ends to select which bundles your additional funds are for.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fat Dragon Games is a small company, and we need to be careful what subjects we choose to proceed with for production. One or two poorly selling sets could hurt our company severely. By putting potential projects up on Kickstarter, we can be sure if there is demand for that subject before devoting our resources to it. We also get to connect directly with our customers, rewarding those who are early supporters for a set with cool stuff like exclusive pieces not available to customers who purchase the set later on, and free stretch rewards. We have been in the print-and-play terrain business for 14 years, having released over 200 terrain sets, and have had nine previous Kickstarter campaigns successfully funded and delivered, so supporters of this project can feel completely confident in our ability to deliver a high-quality product as promised.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Baba Yaga! New Kickstarter ends in two days!
updates.update_content:
Our new Dragonlock Kickstarter is entering its FINAL TWO DAYS. Don't miss out on over 30 free stretch reward models that have already been unlocked, and the Baba Yaga's Hut is exclusive to Kickstarter backers only! 
CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFO

Dracolich
If you've ever wanted a Dracolich miniature with LED glowing internal organs, now is your chance! Our new Vallis Mortis Kickstarter has just such a miniature available as a free stretch reward - don't miss out, we are entering our final week before this campaign ends! CLICK HERE

VALLIS MORTIS IS HERE
 Our new Kickstarter is now LIVE! Lots of LED illuminated terrain models and new miniatures are available, and we set an opening day record for pledges, beating our previous opening day record by 50%. Lots of free stretch rewards have been unlocked and many more are to come, so don't miss out!

Our new Kickstarter launches Tuesday June 30th!
Preview page: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/fatdragongames/vallis-mortis

NEW KICKSTARTER COMING SOON
Here is the project preview page for our upcoming Kickstarter, click the link to be notified when we launch!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/fatdragongames/vallis-mortis
Mushroomfolk released -  only one set remains to be done!

Revised Ogre Warband
We have revised the Ogre Warband set. Figures have been enlarged, base size decreased, ears pointed, tusks a little more pronounced for better .4mm nozzle printing, and added armor and some other requested details. Everyone eligible to receive stretch rewards has been sent a new download link (or you can log into your DTRPG account and simply re-download the original set to get the new sculpts).

Final Stretch
Everyone eligible to receive stretch rewards should have now received their download links for the Ogres, Hill Giant, Slime, and Dead Orc, (if not please check your Kickstarter private message folder). Also, all backers should have received their free miniature bases as well. All that remains now is the kobold warriors and mushroom warriors, both of which are in final development and will be out over the next few weeks thus concluding this campaign. Thank you all again for supporting us!

updates.update_userinfo: Ogres, Hill Giant, Slime, Dead Orc, and miniature bases delivered
updates.update_content:
Minotaur Warriors and Dragon Eggs released! 
Everyone eligible to receive stretch goals should have received their download links by now. If not, check your Kickstarter private message folder for a copy. Thanks again for supporting us and I hope you all have a wonderful holiday season!

campaign.story:
Welcome to Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf! I'm so glad you ventured onto our Kickstarter campaign. 
Note: Pledge levels have been updated and all previous pledges are honored. 
 This is just something that has occurred naturally due to the length of our campaign
$500: We Funded! (Day 1 Funded!)   - Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf gets all podcast and web hosting covered for 2019 
$1000: Better Mobile Equipment (Un-Locked!)   - Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf gets his laptop upgraded so he can bring you even more episodes on days Lady Leaf is down and out and he can't use the office. (And they won't sound like they did when he began podcasting). And when he's able to make it to Cons he'll be able to do on-site recording.
$1500: Yoga Instruction (Un-Locked!) Fan Created Stretch Goal (Note: Fan may have taken the term 'stretch goal' literally)
- Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf learns Yoga and then gives you a backer exclusive Board gaming with Yoga episode. (If Successful this will continue to be a thing on his regular show)
$2000: We Get Video Equipment (Un-Locked!)   - Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf gets video equipment so he can bring his passion to those who prefer video.
$2500 -Gamer Leaf Board gaming with Yoga Video (Un-Locked) Lady Leaf says this will come across better in video medium
$2800 -Video Editing Software for 1 year  (Un-Locked) (So I don't just hand the camera to the kids and say go to)
$3200  (Un-Locked)-Puppets/other video stuff so Kids can come on videos too!
$3500 (It was slightly late, but what the heck, Un-Locked) Before we hit the 48 hour mark, my interview with Stephen M. Buonocore of Stronghold Games will go out to all of you backers during the campaign at least 1 week before it goes out to the masses.
$4000-John Christopher helps me write comedic scripts about boardgames to be used in my videos!
$4500 We get some new audio tracks for all of the segments on the show.
$5500-We review at least 1 game per month for the rest of 2019 (Podcast)
$6000- We will bring every backer of this campaign a special ad free monthly newsletter for the rest of 2019. This one is inspired by No Pun included who are also running a Kickstarter campaign currently! See update #15!
$7000- We review at least 2 games per month for the remainder of 2019( 1 podcast 1 video)
$7500- Those 2 board game reviews will be done for both podcast and video
$8500- I will stream us doing a live play-through each month in a 3-piece suit
$10,000- I will put out 1 podcast episode every day for the remainder of the year except on Sundays
$What else? I really want some fan choices!!!!

 Are you new to gaming? I used to think this was one of the only games out there: 
 I was wrong! My wife showed me a few games here and there. But, Bloodrage was the game that showed me what hobby games are and really hooked me! 
2 years ago I set out to make other families aware of the infinite possibilities out there as well. That's when Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf was born. It is a gaming podcast from our family's perspective. The Podcast includes:  
Story (we will tell you the story of our gameplay of the featured game) and then our reviews of the game. 
We also highlight Kickstarters that we find interesting or wish we could back. 
AAA (Adventures in Application Acquisition) in which we tell you about both ios and android applications (Some compared to their tabletop games and some that aren't games outside of the app) 
The story of our Role Playing as a family (We started off playing Too Many Bones). We also interview game designers, publishers, game store owners, other media content creators & everyday gamers. This is a family show!
We've come a long way from our 1st episodes! Catch some of our latest episodes HERE:
PLAY

Full episode can be found here! 
And, here's a directory of podcasts!


I could tell you about the podcast till I'm blue in the face. But, Let's see what others are saying: 
Founder of one of my favorite podcast and also runs a board game publishing company both under the same umbrella of Tuesday Knight Games, Alan Gerding had this to say “It is obvious that Gamer Leaf has a sincere passion for gaming and provides an abundant amount of content with incredible consistency.” 
Chris the Founder & Editor-in-Chief  of Casual Game Insider as well as the Creator and CEO of Boardy.TV said "I love the kids' perspectives. They are probably the most blunt reviewers I know of, and their comments can be very humorous at times."
Richard Simpson of We're Not Wizards Tabletop and Board Games Podcast said: "Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf podcast is the second hardest working podcast in the world"
Josh from who brought us Frontier the Card Game and will be re-launching Monster Maina had this to say: "Getting Geeky With Gamer Leaf is one of my favorite podcasts. We love being featured on it as well as listening to it!"
JC with Wooden Shoe Games says "Getting Geeky With Gamer Leaf is my go-to podcast for getting through the day."

John Christopher said "It's more fun than poking myself with a cattle prod"

 But, we'd like to make it even better! That's where you come in!
That's a great question. I'm glad you asked.
We’d like to continue providing you with great content so the lights must stay on!
 Plus, we'd love to be able to expand on what we already do by upgrading our equipment and adding some new segments to bring you even better shows.
By upgrading our current equipment, we will be able to bring you a more crisper cut podcast that will allow for you to Get Geeky, Stay Geeky and Bring others into the Geek fold as we boast. Plus we'd love to be able to review even more games for you and your family. So, you can know what we thought before you go out and spend your hard earned green.
 So to boost those funds, we're running this modest campaign. Like stated in the AWESOME video (Top of the page) created by Glendon who brought us the game Zombs (Catch our interview with him down there.
 and our review of his game: 
  This all boils down to: We want to make THE BEST podcast we can for YOU! But, I know that might not be enough for you, so how about this click on your favorite content based pledge reward on the side of this page. Remember, nothing will be charged to your card unless the campaign is successful. Plus nothing comes out until the end of the campaign. What do you have to loose? Nothing! Back now! Or, keep reading if you want to know a bit more about the AWESOME REWARDS you'll get!
What does your Geekiness get you, or how can we bring your geekiness to our fans?
 We will shout out your company and/or product within a single podcast episode. 
Want it shouted out in more than one episode? No problem! Pledge for that amount and send me a message letting us know how many episodes you'd like us to do that for. Just send me a message letting us know how many episodes you'd like us to do that for. Note: We release at least 3 episodes per week. Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.
Come on Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf to geek out about what you're backing on Kickstarter (limited to 15 minutes) A way to help get those games you're excited about to funding or that next stretch goal. 
Ever want to be on the radio? Now's your chance! You and a friend of your choosing join me on an episode of Getting Geeky with Gamer Leaf to talk about whatever y'all'd like to. Limit 30 minute chat that goes on the show within 1 week of recording.
You get to help us pick what games to play and review for your family via a Family Funday Friday episode of the show. Getting the insights of the Leaf's which would include some if not all of our opinions: Almost 40 year old parents, 16 year old Boy, 11 year old girl, 10 year old boy and 5 year old girl. 
Wait, I thought you said in your video you wouldn't charge for reviews? We don't this is to get us to be able to play a game sooner than we would other wise, because there is a cost 
$25 if it be a game we already have on our shelf.
$55 if it's not part of our collection and it costs less than $40 (Can be a board or video game) Some limitations may apply.
Limited to 2 per month.
You will get a whole segment dedicated to our preview of your application and/or video game that you'd like us to review in this segment of our regular show.
Want us to include a video as well going out to our 800+ YouTube Subscribers as well as our over 1,000+ FB Followers? For an additional $75 we will throw a video option onto your reward.                                                                     
We will shout out your company and/or product for every podcast episode for 1 month. 
Want it shouted out for more than 1 month of episodes? No problem! Pledge for that amount and send me a message letting us know how many months you'd like us to do that for. Note: We release at least 3 episodes per week. Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.
Plus, We will also create a small 5 minute commercial episode to air all by it's lonesome that we create with your collaboration that we will air 2 weeks before or after the ad campaign. 

In addition to what you're already getting in the Publisher's Potted Plant you will also get:
We will be devoting a whole podcast episode to YOU our sponsor.
In which we will Talk about/review the games in your catalog. 
The episode will be themed around you the publisher. We will do all the work in preparing your specially tailored episode. If you'd like to provide input that is completely okay. But, I know you're busy. (Hey, that's what you're pledging for us to do)
No other sponsor's or anything will appear on this episode. 
Want us to include a video as well going out to our 800+ YouTube Subscribers as well as our over 1,000+ FB Followers? For an additional $75 we will throw a video option onto your reward.                                                                     
 A bit about the show stats:  
Each episode typically gets between 500-1,550 listens during the 1st 30 days. Trending up from there. Plus on FB we're getting a 2,500-10,000+ reach per post
  A month of my podcasting services (worth almost $400) by backing us on Kickstarter we'll give these all to you ( Kickstarter Corner, Episode Sponsorship spots, Interview before Kickstarter Corner and a super Secret e-mail episode going out to my almost 1500 e-mail subscribers) for only $225. 
Plus we'll have you on the show before you launch your campaign and at the last of your campaign as well. The general population of publishers only comes on one episode per campaign at a rate of $35-$60.Not something offered to the general public. 
Can be used anytime within the calendar year
  A years worth of Sponsorship spots. We release at least 3 episodes per week. 3 choices to choose from: 1 episode per week @$250, 2 episodes per week @$500 & 3 episodes per week at $600(Limited to 3 of each). If you choose to sponsor more than one episode per week just pledge the extra cost here and send me a message here on Kickstarter. 

 If you made it this far down the page, I salute you. Remember, nothing will be charged to your card unless the campaign is successful. Plus nothing comes out until the end of the campaign. What do you have to loose? Nothing! Back now!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A season of podcast content requires a substantial and sustained effort. Having completed two years of content already, I'm fully aware of the effort and time commitment required to interview and/or play games, edit, upload, and share content.

Over the course of a calendar year, an assortment of personal/life matters can come up. I endeavor to always stay ahead of schedule to mitigate this risk, but in the event something unexpected occurs, I'll endeavor to get back on track as quickly as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Help Everything Board Games Digital Magazine come to life!
updates.update_content:
In case you hadn't heard, last year I acquired The Giveaway Geek. This year I acquired, Everything Board Games where we focus on News, Reviews and Interviews. We always do reviews and previews at no cost to you! We mad a new digital magazine and are Kickstarting a limited edition copy right now! Plenty of room to advertise in it. Plus get the limited version for only $1!
THANKS!

updates.update_userinfo: Working on making sure all rewards have been met. Plus some GREAT NEWS for you!

updates.update_content: WE MADE IT! THANKS!
See my latest Facebook post!

updates.update_userinfo: Less than 2 hours to go! Doing a giveaway if we can get to 200 backers!
updates.update_content:
We have a special treat for you.  
If we reach $4000 my good friend has agreed to join forces with us and add a little comedy to our videos.  You may know him as John Christopher, JC from Wooden Shoe Games, or even Fallapart as he calls himself.  It was his idea to include the 'Yoga Stretch Goal', something I'm still trying to wrap my head (and body) around.  If you haven't checked out his work before we encourage you to so that you understand just what we're in for.

updates.update_userinfo: Shall we add comedy to GGwGL?
updates.update_content:
WILL WE MAKE IT? THAT is up to you!
Thanks again!

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Backer exclusive (meaning earlier than everyone else( interview with Stephen from Stronghold!
updates.update_content:
So, I think we can really do this now! Want to hear my interview with Stephen from Stronghold Games before your friends? Well if we can somehow dig through our couch cushions or get a few friends on board we just might hit it. What do we need? We need $93 before 1:55pm MST. If everyone were to up their pledges by $1 that would be no problem at all. What do you think? 
Either way I am truly honored by y'all's support.

campaign.story:
PRE ORDER now to get exclusive price on RGG 360°!  
You can still pre order on our website RGG 360° the best ergonomic handle for miniature painting
Please note:  You will not gain access to the pledge manager and will not get the same bundles and offers. Please visit our website for more details
 Follow us on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/redgrassgames/
Subscribe to our awesome newsletter:  
https://www.redgrassgames.com/ (at the bottom of the homepage)  
new products  
painting tips  
our favorite painting tutorials on the web  
Pro-painters we love  
Masterclass and events
UPDATE: Special offer during the Pledgemanager, buy one supply for Everlasting wet (our first Ks campaign) get one free supply (paper, foam, wavy up to 2 free supply by backers)! Back us now on KS to access the pledgemanager after the campaign.
Ergonomic handle to stay focused and to hold your miniature naturally without causing hand fatigue.
360° rotation to offer more control and help you achieve a better painting on every angle-Effortlessly.
Stick them all! Round, square, small, large, exotic bases…10 to 50mm you can stick them all
10 € only! You can even save more with our bundles and offers on Everlasting wet palette. FREEBIES!
Reviewers and pro-painters truly love it and are already using it daily.
When painting miniatures, you cannot hold your miniatures with bare hands: You need a miniature handle. Today, there is no straight forward solution on the market: they are either too clumsy, not ergonomic, or overly expensive.
That's why we created RGG 360°, the first natural ergonomic handle for miniature painting. 
With our unique design, you will be able to hold your miniature for long and comfortable painting sessions. No more cramps, no more unnecessary movement, just having fun painting.
RGG 360° has been designed by painters for painters and developed with the feedback of pro-painters. 
It is already considered as the best tool available.
"[...] Once you’ve got used to the rotating platform [...] may end up being one of those features you never knew you wanted." Sorastro's painting
Vous pouvez trouver une VF de la campagne sur le site de Redgrassgames/holder
3d printed prototype

RGG 360° is the only natural ergonomic handle designed to create the best connection between you and your miniature, help you adopt the best painting position and minimise unnecessary movements.
The added benefits are greater stability, better precision and minimised fatigue to paint for hours. 

3d printed prototype

Many do not pay attention to the handle of their holder. It is however at the heart of your painting experience. The handle is how you connect with your miniature. It needs to be perfect. We perfected it for months!
RGG 360° is the only handle designed to fit naturally in your hand with its unique shape. 
As there is no strain on your hand and fingers, you won't have to move them and you can enjoy full control of your miniature.
Once you have it in your hand, there is no turning back.

3d printed prototype
360° rotation axis is not an afterthought, it is inherent to the natural ergonomic design. Thanks to the handle, you can rest comfortably your wrist on the desk when painting. The 360° rotation allows you then to access any part of your miniature fast and reliably. No more parasitic movements. You will rediscover the joy of painting.

No additional accessories needed. You have the best handle and the best mounting solution for the best price! Exclusive, save on the retail price, only 10€ a piece during the KS.


Adopt the best painting handle, for a pleasant, fun and perfect painting session
Free shipping for pledges above 35€ for USA, CA and Western EU; A flat fee of 5€ worldwide collected during the pledgemanager in all other cases. More details in the shipping section below.

Read below to have all the details!

3d printed prototype
A straight simple handle does not fit your hand comfortably. To achieve a good quality painting, you need to stay focused and to hold your miniature naturally without causing hand fatigue. For that, RGG 360° is slightly curved and designed to feel very natural in your hand. No odd shape. That's why the sculpted handle has been designed to sit comfortably in the hand.
PLAY

RGG 360° has been tested by many pro painters, painters and even by a 9 years old (Vivien's daughter) to ensure a comfortable handling for most hand size.
Quite the opposite because the hand on the handle helps improve your overall precision.
Also it offers more control and allows you to get around your miniatures without removing your hand from the handle. This innovation will help you achieve a better painting on every angle- Effortlessly
RGG 360° can rotate easily yes, but once you stopped the rotation it will just stay in place. You don't need to hold it with your thumb.
Thanks to our custom made mounting putty, you can fix a large range of miniatures from your favorite games! The putty is of course reusable, we have been using the same putty for months. 
Square, round, oval up to 55mm
Round, square, small, large, exotic bases… miniatures bases come in many shapes. When designing RGG 360°, we tried some mechanical designs and all kind of sticky materials but they were either non adaptive, clumsy, heavy, none reusable... anyway, they always had disadvantages.
 So we have created a custom made mounting putty, as the perfect mounting solution for your miniatures: Reusable, adaptable, safe, for long. We have been testing the putty for several months, and it never dried out.
With 15 grams included with the handle, you have 3x the amount needed to stick your miniatures. 
PLAY

    Made in Europe.
RGG 360° is weighted for optimal stability.
Additional custom-made mounting putty included: Our orange putty was customized to have the perfect stickiness and consistency.
High quality axle of rotation: We tried it all, plastic friction, ball bearing... but nothing compare to our special designed axis. It will provide a smooth, accurate and fun rotation, and will last up to several hundred thousand of rotations. Rotate it freely with your thumb, it will stay in place during your painting. Axle of rotation will be graded up to 500k+ rotations.
Made of PREMIUM plastic: we selected ABS as the best plastic for our handle, due to its density and toughness. The weight will just be perfect in your hand and the handle will last for long
Graining and engraving on the plastic for optimal grip: Instead of smooth plastic, we decided to add some areas with slight engraving, to improve the handling.
3d printed prototype
Colour selection available during the pledge manager

Pro painters understand and have come to expect advances on miniature tools. All those who tried it said it just feels right and gives a lot of comfort when painting.
"[...]  Once you’ve got used to the rotating platform, may end up being one of those features you never knew you wanted." Sorastro's painting
"[...] This is pretty awesome!" The Beasts of war (Ontabletop)
"[...] RGG 360° fits better in the hand and the 360° feature is really a great help, which ensures a lot of comfort. For me personally it is the better choice." Bruckenkopf online (DE) 
"[...] The bearing (axle) is easy but it is not too “loose” so you will not be afraid to move your mini just by moving your brush or removing your hand I repeat, for me it’s very well done." Le temple de Morikun (FR)
"[...] the handle is excellent. This is now my default paint handle. I don't reach for the GW or other brands as much as possible. Totally recommend this handle for any painter !!" War of sigmar 
"[...] The key feature and the best thing about this holder is the fact that just with the touch of your finger you can actually turn around  so when you airbrush in a miniature you can literally be   airbrushing and just touch the top of   the holder with your thumb and you can brush all around  [...] it's also nice to obviously hand brush and use a 360° feature of this holder now" Orcpainternerd 
"[...]Thanks again to Redgrass Games for the use of the fantastic painting handle. [...] I think this is a great little tool and it genuinely surprised me how much of a difference that little pivot at the top there made." Sonic SledgeHammer 
"[...] The product is really good, and the rotation feature adds a major product to the market. [...]  this is an essential tools for me!" Salaise Figurine (FR)
"[...]If you want the spin and a nice grip. This is absolutely spot on!" WatchitPaintit
"[...]The size and grip are really nice and comfortable and fit nicely in my hand." Shoshie's magnificent mini painting
The most used wet palette by pro-painters!

Everlasting Wet Palette: Painter

- Our first Kickstarter campaign

- 20 000 active users around the world

-Used by major pro-painters and award winning artists like:  

PRO PAINTERS:  

Daemon Rich (multiple award winning painter)  
Andy Wardle (multiple award winning painter)  
Rogland (multiple award winning painter)  
Salaise Figurine 

YOUTUBERS:  

Sorastro painting 70 k followers on Youtube  
Orc Painter Nerd 50 k followers on Youtube 
TWG The War Gamer  41K followers on Youtube
L'atelier d'Hutif 7k followers on Youtube

BOARDGAME EDITORS:  

Mantic Games (painting studio)
Monolith Edition (painting studio)
And many more!

Everlasting Painter and Studio XL are simply the best wet palettes for miniature painting.  
From beginners to the best painters in the world, all can benefit from the best in class hydration system and ergonomics.
Once you tried it, there is no turning back!

Everlasting Wet Palette: Painter & Studio XL

TERMS, CONDITIONS & REFUND POLICY : 
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards and the project are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project page. 
To participate to our campaign, you must pledge during the Kickstarter campaign time frame and then confirm the pledge through the pledge manager. These 2 steps are necessary to successfully participate. You can find below details on the steps and terms and conditions applicable. 
Confirmation of pledge
After the Kickstarter campaign ends, you will have to confirm your pledge and provide the necessary information through the Pledge Manager:
-Detail of your order
-Filling out of your delivery information
-Payment of any additional shipping fees
-Validation and confirmation of your order in the pledge manager 
We will announce the opening of the pledge manager through a Kickstarter update. After the opening is announced, you will receive by email an invitation with your connection details. You will have to fill in the pledge manager within the allowed time frame. It is your responsibility to check your emails and spam to make sure you received the invitation to fill in the pledge manager in time. 
In case the pledge manager is not completed and confirmed within the allowed time frame, your pledge will be considered cancelled. On request we will refund 90% of the backed amount through Kickstarter in accordance with our refund policy. 
Delivery
Once the project is ready, we will deliver to the shipping address provided during the pledgemanager. 
You are kindly asked to keep the delivery information updated and error free. In case an address change is needed you will be able to do so until 2 weeks before the products are shipped. A summary email will be sent to you before the shipment for you to review and amend if needed. It is your responsibility to check your emails and spam to make sure you received the invitation to review and update your address in time. 
In case the delivery address was incorrect or incomplete and the delivery was not possible, the subsequent shipment will result in additional shipping cost. 
The delivery will be performed by the most adequate shipping company at the time of shipment. For some cases and countries, in particular for smaller shipments, the shipping might be performed untracked at our discretion.
Please note that to offer you the lowest shipping rates, we unfortunately cannot ship products in separate shipments even if some items are available earlier.
Backers are responsible for possible taxes and extra charges of their countries for themselves. Project will be EU and USA friendly. In other countries, no tax should be levied provided your orders are below the appropriate threshold. Kindly check with your tax and custom authorities for precision.
Due to too many past delivery issues, we regret we are unable to ship to the following countries: Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan and Afghanistan.
Communication and support
We will communicate on a regular basis on all the important steps and update. For this matter, we will use Kickstarter updates and will duplicate these updates on our facebook to make sure everybody receive the information timely. Do not forget to follow our page on facebook to receive the updates more easily: www.facebook.com/redgrassgames
Request for support must go through this email exclusively: support@redgrassgames.com 
We do not guarantee any answer through the direct messaging of our Kickstarter, Kickstarter comments or facebook pages due to the lack of traceability. 
Refund policy
We will answer positively to refund requests according to the following rules.  Regarding the payments made through Kickstarter:
 - Refund in full without any conditions within 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign
- Thereafter, from the 15th day after the end of the kickstarter campaign, until the start of the first shipment of rewards, 90% of refund without any conditions.
The start of the first shipment will be announced through a Kicktstarter update

Regarding the payments made through the Pledge Manager:
- Refund in full without any conditions until the start of the first shipment of rewards.
The start of the first shipment will be announced through a Kicktstarter update. 
Refund requests are to be sent to support@redgrassgames.com. 
 The refunds are made in Euro through Kickstarter and the Pledge Manager. If the refund through Kickstarter or the Pledge Manager is not possible (invalid debit/credit card, expired card, virtual card or for any other reason…), the refund will be made by a bank wire transfer. Additional bank fees may apply. 
 If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have gained a lot of experience thanks to our first Kickstarter project last year : The Everlasting wet palette. The first KS was a very complex project, coordinating many different suppliers worldwide. But it was a big success with more than 8.000 backers. We have learned from this experience how to create a technical product with a lot of backers from all around the world . For our second Kickstarter campaign, RGG 360° will be made in Europe. This new Kickstarter project is driven by one goal: to create a high-quality miniature holder for your painting sessions.
As with any production, there are risk concerning the time needed for production and the control of quality. We however believe one point is key and necessary to our project, and will be worth delaying the production, in case the quality is not satisfactory : the quality of the rotation axis. We will focus a lot of attention on this production part. Sample productions showed excellent performance, we will make sure that the mass production rotation axis will be on par with it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 1 Day Left To Back Our Newest & Most Historic Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
With the RGG360 project, we had decided to produce for the first time our handles in Europe. The reasoning behind was to have more control over the production and increase the quality. Thanks to your support on this campaign, this strategy has been a great success and we decided to build on that with our newest wet palette: Everlasting Wet Palette v2. The first palette with a reusable membrane, now produced in Europe.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for your support! Get a FREE painting book written by Angel Giraldez
updates.update_content:
Hello,
During these difficult times, we hope you are all doing well.
To thank you all for your support, we have created with the very talented Angel Giraldez, a beginner's miniature painting book.  
 In this FREE miniature painting book, discover basic techniques and a lot of pro-painter tips by one of the best miniature painter. A nice way to stay at home and improve your painting skills:)

RedGrassGames turned 2 (woot woot) 
For this very special event, we’d like to thank our loyal Kickstarter Backers & Customers by organizing a photo contest with AMAZING PRIZES from our friends at Monolith Edition and Kaha miniatures!
This contest will run on Instagram & Twitter from 12/05/19 to 12/15/19 at 11:59 PM (GMT+1).

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment complete. RGG360° available on our website
updates.update_content:
Hello,
These past few weeks, our partner Aimplify/crowdpilot has successfully dispatched every parcel. (over 4000) The fulfillment is finally over! Once again we are pretty pleased by the level of service provided by  Aimplify/Crowdpilot. 
   On a side note:  If you have not received your parcel yet, it is probably on its way to you. Check your inbox and tracking number regularly to ensure a smooth delivery on your end.  No tracking number? a question? Please write to us directly here: support@redgrassgames.com

updates.update_userinfo: 85% of the deliveries completed, only a few more days to go to complete the fulfilment!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
85% of the deliveries have been shipped out ! Aimplify/Crowdpilot has been working on the fly, with available quantities and colors to ship everything as fast as possible. The bottleneck has definitely been the assembly itself, but we are getting there.
So, for those who have not yet received their shipment confirmation, you just have to wait a few more days.  You will receive an email confirming the shipment with the tracking number when it leaves our warehouse. If everything goes well, 99.9% will be out before Saturday this week.  Please contact us Tuesday next week on the 19th if you still have not received your tracking number by then(and as always, please check all your emails and spams).

Hey everyone!
ASSEMBLY IN PROGRESS:
Last week, we went to Germany to supervise the assembly of our RGG 360° Miniature Holders. We had to go there to make sure that everything was going perfectly well because the whole assembly process is hand-made. ( Plastic parts + rotation axle + weight ).

updates.update_userinfo: First deliveries will start beginning of next week!
updates.update_content:
Dear All,
Our quest is at an end! All plastic parts have been produced and assembly is ongoing for the first production batch. The second batch will soon follow. It means that we will start the shipment really soon, as early as the beginning of next week. So to get delivered as quickly as possible, please read carefully this update!
You will be receiving an e-mail from support@crowdpilot.com starting tomorrow, telling you to confirm or modify your delivery address. Change the address if necessary, or simply confirm it by clicking on the confirm button.

updates.update_userinfo: Production update: First batch of mass production completed, assembly to start shortly!
updates.update_content:
Dear all,
The first batch of plastic parts has been completed and we are already moving it to the assembly workshop in Germany next to the fulfilment center:

Dear All,
We are making progress on the mass production side, as we finally secured production capacity. The manufacturer reported that the raw materials have been sourced, and the production has started a few days ago. We expect to see it finished in 2 to 3 weeks. The manufacturer did not report any issue during the production so far, which is good news.

updates.update_userinfo: Production update: Mold is finished and validated, let's start the mass production!
updates.update_content:
Dear All,
Good news, the mold is finished and we have validated it today! We have received the latest injection samples, and they look good and work really well. You can read more details and see the pictures below. It means we can move onto the next step: mass production. 
We are now waiting for the lead time confirmation from the manufacturer. The production itself does not take long, but we need to have some production capacities available. We hope we won't have to wait too much for that. We keep you updated as soon as we have some feedback on it.

campaign.story:
Use the Links Below to Stay In Touch!
These emblems were created by the community of backers during the first campaign while on a Livestream with creator Matt Lloyd.
Survive 15 waves and destroy all the Drakka to successfully defend the  Empire of Arcadium. Accomplish this by building & upgrading towers,  using magical powers, leveraging taxes to create War Chests, and  managing Spy Networks.  
First, choose a race and a character from that race. 
 Then you create a map with a path using Terrain and Build Spot cards.  
 As the Drakka march past, you attack the Drakka with your towers,  gaining GP as a bounty from the Emperor for each kill. There are 3 waves  per Battle, and Victory Points are added up for each player at the end  of every Battle. If a Drakka gets through the defense, they raise the  Panic Level in the kingdom according to the Threat they present.  
Phase 1: Advance
Phase 2: Draw
Phase 3: Defend
Phase 4: Resolve 
Phase 5: Develop
 If the players last through all 5 Battles in the game and clear the  board, they are victorious & the game ends. If the Panic Level  reaches 10, all armies must retreat and the game ends.
The player with the most Victory Points wins the game. 
Click the image to download the full-color .pdf
Click the image to play right now!
Click the image above to submit your idea or vote on a different idea!
Click the image to read the full preview
Click the image to read the full preview
*The following are from a previous version of the game, and a few  things have changed: it's 4 players now, Bosses, Poison & Slow, and  the leveling system.   Most of the gameplay remains the same.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is definitely a passion project of mine (8 years so far!), and as such I will see it through if at all possible. I can think of 2 things that might delay or somehow jeopardize the creation of this game:

1. Manufacturing & Fulfillment Issues
This is my first project, and I will readily admit that some things might sneak up on me. However, I've made it a point to surround myself with industry veterans, incredible resources, and trustworthy partners to mitigate any potential delay, and handle any bumps in the road.

2. Injury, Illness, or Death
Fingers crossed nothing like this will happen, but because this is primarily my creation, a lot hinges on me staying healthy. So far there's nothing to be concerned about, and I'll do my best to keep it that way. Although because I'm from Alaska, a random bear attack isn't out of the question - but not very likely. Also, rest assured that I have amazing people around me that will make this happen in any case.

If there's anything at all you're concerned about, please feel free to email me at info@terminusbreach.com and let me know. I'll be happy to address any questions or issues personally.

Once again, I want to assure you that if there's any worldly way to make this game a reality, I will find it. It's been a long, amazing road to get here, and I'm so excited about seeing this through.

Thank you so much for your support,
Matt Lloyd
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
