updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!
As some of you already know, I have launched a new Kickstarter project.  The new project is all about Plinths and Display Bases for your miniatures and busts.  I have sculpted up some really cool plinths, and the project has already been funded!  Please check it out here :
 https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1665755336/plinths-and-display-stands-for-figures-miniatures-and-busts?ref=creator_nav

Hi Everyone!
It has been a busy summer over here as I have been working on some fun commission projects.  I met a lot of amazing people at Adepticon, and so I have been working with some of them on their projects and it has been really exciting.
As for this Kickstarter project, I still am trying to contact 2 backers so I can deliver their rewards.  I sent out new emails to those 2 backers today, as well as a message through Kickstarter.  Hopefully I can get ahold of them, I will keep trying.
REAPERCON is next week!!  AARRGH!  It will be a long drive, but it is really worth the trip.  Seeing a lot of friends, and making new ones each time we go.  We are really excited, and the packing of the van has already started.

Hi Everyone! 
I hope you are all enjoying some warmer weather!  And hopefully you have been getting some painting done!  
Artis Opus Kickstarter project featuring my busts as Add-Ons

Thank you all for your patience.  I just walked in the door from Adepticon, and it was an amazing show.
Shipping update :
So, it seems there were some packages that didn't get mailed last week.  This has been fixed, and all remaining packages have now been sent from Sandy, Utah (today 4/3/19).

Just a quick note today. 😁
We are all setup at Adepticon. Please come by and say hi if you are here. 😁. Booth 905A in the foyer. I am nervous about today, but excited also.
Shipping the kickstarter items has almost been finished. Packages are still being packed and sent, so if you haven’t received yours yet, please be patient as we are trying our best to finish it all.

I am beginning to box up the approximately 100 packages to send out to you!!! 
You should start receiving shipping information this week, and I will be taking the packages to the post office on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday of this week.  
Inside your packages you will find your miniature figures and busts!   SOME of the figures and busts will be packaged in my regular retail packaging, BUT others will Not be packaged in the retail packaging.  Just an FYI so when you open your packages it isn't a surprise.  :-)

updates.update_userinfo: The wait is almost over! plus Adepticon and ReaperCon!
updates.update_content:
We are getting so close!  The first package of figures and busts will be arriving to me tomorrow, with another package arriving on Thursday!  
Tomorrow, I will make sure to take lots of pictures as I begin the process of checking everything and boxing them up for you.   My plan is to have everything mailed out by the end of next week, so it will be very busy around here (like usual)!  
I will also make sure to take pictures of the figures and busts that I will be painting over the next week.  I am very excited.

Here are a couple of painted Barbarians that I finished yesterday.  They were really fun to paint, and I am looking forward to painting some more.     :-)
Also, I am expecting to receive the first shipment of casts next week, so I should have more exciting pictures soon!

Hi Everyone!
We received 3 feet of snow over the weekend, so a lot of time was spent shoveling and shoveling.  Overall it was fun.  :-)
Here are some pictures of the completed Summoning a Dragon 2 Figure (3D Renders).  I am expecting to receive the resin casts in about 2 weeks, and I am getting very excited!

I hope you had a great January.  It was a long month, and a lot was accomplished!
All of the figures/busts from the Kickstarter are being made right now.  I should have some pictures of the production resins towards the end of February, and I am aiming to have everything shipped out in March.
Not too much to announce, only that things are on track!  We are getting close!

project_data.project_name: Summoning a Dragon! Fantasy & Sci-Fi Miniatures / Busts

campaign.story:
Board games are becoming more common and present in the Ludic life of many of us. 
 Together with them, great attention has been paid to the components of these games: from tokens to cards to graphics and MINIATURES. and it is precisely on those that we focus on this project, giving you the opportunity to have unique miniatures to improve your ludic experience, from your games of adventures up to those of Zombie. 
 they are not normal miniatures that you buy and put on a shelf, they are miniatures for your 3D printer! By buying this, you will receive files to print miniatures directly by your own 3D printers, while cozy at home!
 -if you already own a 3D printer, it's cheap and also funny, you will print unique and incredible quality models.
 -If you don't own a 3D printer, it can be an opportunity to buy one! Costs for a printer are already low and accessible to anyone. You can still use a service like: 3D hub, shapeways, or any other that the net are crowding. 
 -No shipping cost! Anywhere in the universe, you just download the files and print! -You can print it as many times as you want, for you and your friends. 
 -You can decide any printing dimension, from miniatures to real size titan sculptures! 
 - You can use these miniature for other games, as proxyes in games like ninth age or fantasy football. 
 for a correct miniature print in 28mm scale, it's suggested a good quality printer, with at least 100micron resolution, so that all the details of the miniature are visible and the high quality of the sculptures is adequately exalted. 
Don't be afraid if your printers have lower specs, you can still print them giving up to some details, or print in a bigger scale(suggested for filament print), getting over the printer problem.
 To obtain superior results, the use of a resin printer is recommended. But excellent results can also be achieved with the filament
 Free files Example stl files 
 downloaded freely:
http://www.crosslances.net/File/Roughandtumble/shaman%20%28repaired%29%20%28repaired%29.stl
 The shaman ogre from the first episode of rough-and-tumble 
 some printing examples offered by Makex M-One and by Milkshake 3D 
 Do you produce 3D printers? Do you have a printing service? Are you part of a Magazine? Do you wont to hel and see your logo on our kickstarter? Don't exitate to contact us, we only ask for a visibility exchange! Thanks a lot! 
 If you can't buy the miniatures or you don't have the possibility to print with either a 3D printer or a service, but you still wish to support the board game future, you can help us donating 1€.
 Pick up any of the miniatures in this kickstarter, you can tell us which model you desire at the end of the pledging period and we will send you the the file in .stl 3D format. 
 A sci-fi style 3D miniature in a 54mm scale.
 The miniature is decomposed into various parts to allow an easier printing.
 In addition there are two variants of heads: with helmet and without 
Four characters in Horror style that will help you solve the cases in your games.
 we introduce you to Kean, xin, queen and max. 
 will you be able to solve this mystery too?
 brum brum! what about a race?  
well with these really bad vehicles, it will all become much more exciting.  
pawns ideal for any racing game!
Inspired by some famous zombie games, here is our pirate crew!
 You can find a sailor, a runner, a large and burly pirate, an abominable marine mutation, and finally the captain of the crew.
 Here is a classic! A company of adventurers for your fantasy and role-playing games.
 Some of these characters have been made for the web series "20naturale" that will soon be out on youtube, do not miss it!
 Another useful series that can help you improve your gaming experience.
 A series of medieval style pawns: houses, castles, towers, and church domes. 

You can use them in the most classic of games, from monopolies to risiko to any other game you have in mind.
We wanted to have fun on this series! we have made some adventurers, but this time they have a touch of unique originality, it is infatitated with adventurous fruits, coming from a fantasy world.
 From left to right: Strawarrior, Lemage, Bananabard, Perathief, Raspaladin, Clericapple and Rangerananas.
 Perhaps one of the most challenging and complex series we have created, it is in fact eleven sculptures that are highly detailed and cared for, designed to be played in a wargame or just for the pleasure of being painted. 
 A series from a world of paladins, monsters, wolfmen, dwarfs and many other fantastic creatures!
In this project we want to propose again this fantasy football team already protagonist of our previous kickstarter campaign.
 Here we propose the complete pledge of two teams and including all the add-ons related to the campaign.
 Here the link for details on the composition of the package.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/crosslances/nurgoblin-your-first-3d-team-for-fantasy-football
Monsters, monsters and even monsters, what game is it without the monstrous antagonists? 
 With this package you can have a great choice of creatures to fight with, from dragons to elementals of air, water, fire, light earth and darkness.
Do you want them all? you are hardened players and you can not give up anything.  
Ok we love you and we decided to make two special offers. 
 Here is the first: all the miniatures shown above except for the group of nurgoblin (fantasy football team) at a special price € 63 instead of € 97 that you would spend buying them individually.
 In addition exclusively for these two packages, we add these two monsters! 
 For this package and above this fantastic driad is also available!
  For this package and above this battle elephantd is also available!
 For this package and above this Dwarf on Boar is also available!
  For this package and above this Centaur is also available!
  For this package and above this Viking girl is also available!
 If you are really insatiable and want to print tons of miniatures here is our super offer. 
 Everything! really everything you see inside this kickstarter, including the fantasy football team and its add-ons, at an even better price.
 € 80 instead of € 122 that you would spend buying all the packages individually.
 For a total of over 80 files! Less than 1 euro each! 
 To thank your support we decided to start adding some sculptures.  
They will be available free for anyone who has purchased a level 4 or higher pledge. It can also be purchased with level 3 at the price of 3 euros.
We plan to add more sculptures in this way, but we need your support, help us by sharing the project, talking to friends and in your social forums.
The more the kickstarter will rise, the more we can present new sculptures. Meanwhile, we ask you what you would like to see as the next miniature? a space military? a bard? or what else? give us your suggestions and perhaps you will see your sculpture realized.

 As a first miniature in addition we propose this girl paladin.
 Butcher
 Butcher, zombie version
 round bases for play.

Cyber punk girl
 Here is a large barbarian ready to enter the battle!
 Here is a rogue with his bow.

Crosslances studios is founded by 3 artists and their commons passion for the world of games. Students at the Comics courses in Florence, made by the greebo games sculptures, they approached the world of miniatures. It has actually became a revelant studio in the world of miniatures and digital miniatures prototyping. Our products can be found in many places, we had collaborations with: Labmasu, Megalith Godslayer, Hidden Dreams, Minuteman miniatures, Fireforge , and many others
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Crosslances is a dynamic studio researching for innovation, our challenge is to renew ourselves by renewing our opening game, hoping it could give us a good lift. 
We hope the world will always be more prepared to our little revolution: bringing 3D printable games into houses.

Risks for customers are minimal, with a good preparation with your own 3D printer, it will impossible to have problems. 
Biggest difficulties are found in supports positioning, in fact printing quality of complex objects can be improved wit adequate supports.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Here we are! In another crazy project!

Yes, this time the project is really peculiar!
In our family we have 4 nieces and of course they are super in love with princesses, and various fairy tales, that they make us read or see on repeat!

Good morning here are some news for you from the crosslances world:
Our new kickstarter:d ecorations for your tree in 3D.
Ready for download.
http://kck.st/33mYqzK

Good morning

From today we launch a new small initiative: a facebook group with all our supporters, not only kickstarters, but also cgtrader and Patreon, to be able to help, share and suggest.

Please read the group rules in order to properly understand the function of the group.

A new adventure awaits the crosslances world: let's go back to a project that we already faced years ago: a Fantasy football team, but with a completely new look!
Very angry leprechauns! Inspired by the funny  Saint Patrick's day, but not only, come and find out more inside this new kickstarter!

Welcome to the new crosslances kickstarter project.
This time we are going to face up to a new topic: for the first time our studio lands in the future!
Exactly today we offer you fantastic new futuristic scenics designed for the most varied wargame and skirmish games set in the future (but not only).

we are happy to present you our new adventure!
http://kck.st/36q9UT1
This time the crosslances studio will take you inside an epic battle that will see soldiers of human armies (paladins), sylvan elves, and evil knights of chaos in opposition!
Are you ready to sharpen your 3D printers?

here is finally our live project!

http://kck.st/2MYuArY

I personally want to thank all the backers who supported us!  
The campaign went very well, better than any of our expectations!  
Thanks a lot!  
As soon as we receive payment from kickstarter, we will start working on file distribution.

project_data.project_name: Miniatures for 3D players

campaign.story:
Earlier in 2018 Art of the Genre ran a campaign to create The Folio of Fiendish Monsters, however that campaign was the only product we've ever done that didn't include 5th Edition D&D mechanics.  Now, before we print this product, and after a lot of fan requests, we are offering the chance to add a 5th Edition monster appendix to this volume.
It is our hope that before this book goes to press we can add the 5th Edition content that I've already been writing with each monster I create.  
Get this incredible monster book with 1E & 5E monsters covered by TSR master artist Jeff Easley!
What will be included in the 5th Edition appendix? Currently I've been writing a 'base-line' stat block for each monster in 5E.  I hit the bigger points of each monster that relate most commonly to game play.  The current blocks look like the following:
5E Block:
Ice Goblin [AC 14, HD 2d10+2, HP 12, Initiative +4, #AT 1, Hit +2, Dam Ice Dagger 3 (1d4+1), Stealth +5, Cold Blood (DC 14 Dexterity or take Freezing Acid 2 (1d4) per successful melee attack that damages this foe)]
STR: 10 (-) INT: 10 (-) WIS: 8 (-1) CON: 13 (+1) DEX: 15 (+2) CHA: 8 (-1) 
CR: 1/2 EXP: 100 
Monster Type: Small Humaniod
Stretch Goals within this campaign could expand on the 'block', providing Speed, Saving Throws, Full Skills, Senses, Languages, etc. 
Ice Goblin illustration by Simon Adams, and they are nastly little buggers!
What are the monsters in this book?  I'm going to provide an incomplete list (76 monsters), just so you have a taste of what the 115 new monsters are like.
Ice Goblin, Frost Ogre, Tundarian, Frost Skeletons, Blizzard Giants, Plated Woolly Rhino, Winter Witch, Hobgoblin Ice Raiders, Warmth Wisps, Ice Wall Dragons, Monofilament Kobolds, Dwarf Eaters, Simsisiun, Demon Prince of Changelings, Lyzinia, Arch Devil of Sin, Tournament Knight, Hell Fish, Typhoon Elemental, Black Sands Lich, Tether Worm, Fey: Dragon-Linked, Fey: Nature-Bound, Fey: Bridge Guardian, Fey: Nightborn, Dungeon Lurker, Tomb Shambler, Shadow Ogre, Karasian Dwarf, Spider Troll, Gloom Husk, Gloom Interloper, Gloom Brute, Gloom Knight, Stone Goblin, Legion Orc, Goblin Wanderer, Feral Kobold, Deep Forest Orc, Tethered Beast, Tethered Humanoid, Bender Scout, Out Island Reaver, Out Island Taskmaster, Out Island Captain, Bojun, Warfang, Sinner Hangman, Old Man of the Woods, Maiden Hag, Fallen Totem, Cuddle Creeper, Marigold Man, Fool’s Paradise, Dire Pine, City Stalker, Beast Spirit Haunt, Street Slitherer, Barkempkin, Brain Larva, Sewer Man, Drowning Fountain, Crimson Roses, Were Owl, Were Gull, Were Pigeon, Moon Child, Dravarian Highwayman, Chaos Bringer, Bastian Born, Devil’s Minions, Blood Caliph, Sand Rippers, Silk Whisperer, Shell Collector, Zhamaran, VirVir, Bonecrusher Dog
What is a Folio? The Folio series is a OSR inspired throwback series from Art of the Genre that revolves around gaming modules and supplements.  Currently there are 19 Folio adventures, dozens of Folio mini-adventures, and 3 Hardcover books.
What do the AD&D pages look like? I've already been playing with designs from the original campaign, but there will have a feel like the monster blocks in the original AD&D Monster Manual, although I WILL be including experience for each creature as seen in Monster Manual II.  
Hopping Brains are coming for you!
What are the other Folio Hardcovers? By the time this book is published in December 2018, there will be 5 'orange spine' hardcovers in the Folio Hardcover Series.  They are The Complete Roslof Keep (which compiles the mega-dungeon from Folio #1-Folio #6), The Complete Cities of Sorcery (which complies two trilogies from Folio #8-Folio #13), The Storyteller's Arcana (a DM supplement cataloging some of my best rules additions over the past 35 years of gaming), The Folio of Fiendish Monsters (as above), and The Complete White Ship (which compiles the mega-adventure from Folio #14-Folio #19).
*TRADEMARK DISCLAIMER
"D&D" and "AD&D" are trademarks of Wizards of the Coast, LLC. Art of the Genre is not affiliated with Wizards of the Coast LLC. We make no claim to, or challenge to, such trademarks.
Just a few of the products Art of the Genre has produced on Kickstarter since 2012!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a fantasy fiction imprint working exclusively on Kickstarter, Art of the Genre has produced and fulfilled 8 novels using this platform as well as delivering 19 Folios early to all backers, and dozens of mini-adventures and other gaming supplements!

This book is already nearing completion for December 2018 release, so adding the 5E monster appendix should add very little risk.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: Backer receives PDF copies of The Complete Roslof Keep, The Complete Cities of Sorcery, The Folio of Fiendish Monsters (with 5E appendix), The Storyteller's Arcana, AND The Complete White Ship! A $125 value for only $65!

support.title: Monster Dedication + Hardcover
support.descp: Backer receives a Hardcover & PDF of Fiendish Monsters + you get your name beneath the picture of monster in the book! So basically... gaming immortality!

support.title: 5E Orange Spine Hardcover Mania!
support.descp: Backer receives a Hardcover and PDF copy of Fiendish Monsters (with 5E appendix), The Complete Roslof Keep, The Complete Cities of Sorcery, The Storyteller's Arcana, and The Complete White Ship. (Save $50 off retail!)

support.title: Folio Adventure Series + Hardcover
support.descp: Backer receives physical and PDF copies of all 19 Folio adventures + The Folio of Fiendish Monsters. A $105 savings!

support.title: Create A Monster!
support.descp: Backer receives 2 copies of the Fiendish Monster Hardcover + PDF, AND you get to create a monster for inclusion in the book (must be submitted by Oct 30th 2018).

campaign.story:
The more we raise through the Super Kickstarter!, the more new Aquabats music and Super Show mini-episodes you'll get!!!
And during our FINAL COUNTDOWN LIVESTREAM, we smashed through our $600,000 stretch goal, unlocking ALL of this:
And here's what that means... 
UPDATE: We reached our first goal in under 30 minutes, which means...
Next year, The Aquabats will write and record a BRAND NEW ALBUM.. our first since Hi-Five Soup in 2011!
It also means we'll have NEW SONGS to play next year, so we can celebrate in your town when we hit the road for our THE AQUABATS! 25TH ANNIVERSARY TOUR!
UPDATE: We reached our second goal in under four hours, so...
The Aquabats will also make at least six NEW MINI-EPISODES of The Aquabats! Super Show!, and release them online! 
UPDATE: We reached our third goal in the final week, which means...
Now The Aquabats will make at least TWELVE NEW MINI-EPISODES – enough to have new episodes every month for a year! – and release a LIVE CONCERT ALBUM!
The concert album will be from April 2018's epic The Fury of the Aquabats: 20th Anniversary show at the Fonda Theater, which brought back Catboy, Chainsaw, Prince Adam, Baron Von Tito and more for an insane reunion!  And... 
All backers at the $35 PLEDGE LEVEL AND ABOVE now get the live concert as a FREE DOWNLOAD!
UPDATE: We reached our fourth goal during our FINAL COUNTDOWN livestream on September 29th, which means...
The Aquabats will be able to record TWO BRAND NEW ALBUMS in 2019... and all backers at the $55 PLEDGE LEVEL and above will get the extra album, before it comes out, as a FREE DOWNLOAD!
So you see, Oh Righteous Comrades, it's up to you to decide: does the world still need The Aquabats? The answer – and how much cool new stuff The Aquabats can make – is up to you!
Looking for our original stretch goals? 
Our original plans for more stretch goals also included a LIVE CONCERT FILM (at $750,000), a PRIVATE LIVESTREAM CONCERT for backers (at $1,000,000), and up to a year of weekly online episodes! We changed it up because you requested more new music, but we're not giving up on the other goals! Keep checking our UPDATES PAGE after the campaign, and we'll tell you what's next.
When you pledge, you'll get all kinds of super rad, exclusive rewards. 
See for yourself!
PLUS, all kinds of SPECIAL REWARDS and ONCE-IN-A-LIFETIME OPPORTUNITIES!
And don't forget, you can also get all kinds of extra rewards and exclusive items in our official ADD-ON REWARD STORE, including one of our most requested rewards:
CHECK OUT THESE REWARD DESIGNS:
                No problem, new friend! Start by watching this quick video: 
Awesome, right?! You can also...
LISTEN to a bunch of our songs and albums! 
WATCH some full episodes of The Aquabats! Super Show! 
Some professional TV-watching people really liked our show too:
In fact, believe it or not...
There are a MILLION ways to help the Super Kickstarter succeed, and get the world that much closer to having a brand-new Aquabats album and more Super Show! mini-episodes. 
SEE THE FULL LIST!
Or, here are some easy ways to help right now:
PLEDGE NOW!
Even if you change your pledge later, it helps to have as many Righteous Comrades as possible! Plus, you aren't charged anything until we meet our goal AND the campaign ends!

FOLLOW US! 
We're @TheAquabats on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube!
TELL OTHER PEOPLE! 
If you love The Aquabats and think you might know other people who would too, now's the perfect time to get them into it!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This won't work, and no one actually likes The Aquabats...?

Also, even though we know we've got friends all over the world, it's always possible that we won't be able to reach enough of them before this Kickstarter ends. But, if we reach our minimum goal, we'll be able to keep raising more funds AFTER the Kickstarter ends, which will give us time to reach more old friends!

But, as long as the Kickstarter succeeds, we've GOT THIS! We've made albums before, and we know how to do it again. We also have made two seasons of Super Show, and just made a new mini-season for this Kickstarter, so we know we can make some great new episodes for you, even on a tight budget!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp:
How's this for super rad? At this level, you'll bring up to 4 guests and JOIN THE AQUABATS for PIZZA + A PRIVATE ADVANCE SCREENING of the new "SUPER SHOW" episode(s) at The Aquabats' top-secret headquarters in Orange County.*
You and your guests will be picked up in the BattleTram at a mutually agreed rendezvous, blind-folded and then transported to the secret headquarters that only legends foretell of. See the vintage blacklight poster room, walk through the BattleTram garage, see ancient relics, toys and collectables from around the world. See storage and junk that we should have thrown away years ago. But, most important, swear to protect the secret location of our heroes' HQ!
*We'll arrange a date that works for you and your guests. Travel & accommodations not included.
PLUS... You'll get all of the rewards and benefits included in the $300 pledge level!
SHIPPING NOT INCLUDED. You'll be charged for shipping of any/all physical rewards after the campaign ends. See the FAQs for more details and estimated shipping costs!
INCLUDES:
Everything in the $350 Pledge Level!
Visit Aquabats HQ for Private Screening + Pizza!

support.title: IT'S *YOUR* SONG!
support.descp:
You probably think this song is about you, don’t you?
Well… that’s up to you, homie! At this level, The Aquabats will WRITE AND RECORD AN ORIGINAL SONG FOR YOU**. You can choose the topic, help write the music, and even perform on the track with us! Or, give us some direction and then let us do the heavy lifting. It’s up to you!
Then, come VISIT THE RECORDING STUDIO*** while The Aquabats record your song, and get the MASTER COPY. Want to keep it for yourself? You can! Want us to share it with the rest of the Legion? Right on! It’s YOUR song, so it’s up to you!
Plus, you’ll get everything in the $10, 25, 35, 55, 75, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300 and 350 Pledge Levels!
*SHIPPING NOT INCLUDED.
You’ll be charged for shipping after the campaign ends! See FAQs for details + estimated shipping costs.
**FOR NON-COMMERCIAL USE ONLY.
Not to kill the buzz, but this reward is for personal use only, not for getting rich by selling a new Aquabats single! If you want to use the track for commercial purposes, please check with us before making your pledge. See the FAQ for more details!
***SESSION TIMING TBD.
We expect to record your song in Southern California, and plan to schedule your studio visit for early 2019. You’ll get at least 1 month notice before your studio visit. Travel & accommodations not included.
INCLUDES:
We Record a New Song JUST FOR YOU!*
A VIP STUDIO VISIT! (See Us Record Your Song!)
VIP Access to Every Aquabats Show in 2019!
Everything in the $350 Pledge Level!

support.title: PRIVATE AQUABATS CONCERT!
support.descp:
Tired of waiting for The Aquabats to come to YOUR town?
At this level, The Aquabats will come to you** and PLAY A PRIVATE PARTY OR CONCERT, just for you and your guests!*** Want five awesome superheroes at your wedding, birthday bash or pool party? No problem. Want to book a venue in your town and arrange a private show for 100 of your closest friends? Consider it done. You can even decide what goes on the set list!
Plus, you’ll get everything in the $10, 25, 35, 55, 75, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300 and 350 Pledge Levels AND a PERSONALIZED VIDEO MESSAGE from the MC Bat Commander to help get your friends PUMPED for your private show!
*SHIPPING NOT INCLUDED.
You’ll be charged for shipping after the campaign ends! See FAQs for details + estimated shipping costs.
**Depending on your location, there may be additional charges to cover the cost of travel and accommodations. We’ll coordinate with you to figure out the details after the campaign ends.
***There are a few terms and conditions on this one, so be sure to check out the FAQ before pledging for this reward.
INCLUDES:
Aquabats Play A PRIVATE CONCERT For You!*
Personalized VIDEO MESSAGE!*
Everything in the $350 Pledge Level!

support.title: BE OUR EXECUTIVE PRODUCER!
support.descp:
Time to throw your weight around, boss.
At this level, The Aquabats will make you an official EXECUTIVE PRODUCER for the ENTIRE YEAR OF ONLINE EPISODES! The number of episodes will be determined based on how much the Kickstarter campaign raises, but could be anywhere from 6 to 60 – and your name will be on all of them, and on the NEW ALBUM!
You’ll be listed as EXECUTIVE PRODUCER in the credits of each episode, on IMDB, and on the OFFICIAL POSTER reward. You’ll also get a VIP SET VISIT FOR 2,** which includes a PRIVATE TOUR, LUNCH WITH THE AQUABATS, and all kinds of high-powered executive perks, like a Director’s Chair with your name on it!
Plus, you’ll get everything in the $10, 25, 35, 55, 75, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300 and 350 Pledge Levels!
*SHIPPING NOT INCLUDED.
You’ll be charged for shipping after the campaign ends! See FAQs for details + estimated shipping costs.
**SHOOT TIMING TBD.
We expect to shoot most episodes in Utah, and will aim to schedule your set visit for Spring 2019. You’ll get at least 2 months notice before your set visit. Travel & accommodations not included
INCLUDES:
Everything in the $350 Pledge Level!
EP Credit on All New Episodes!*
EP Credit on the New Album!
2× VIP On Set Experience*
VIP Access to Every Aquabats Show in 2019!

support.title: IT'S *YOUR* EPISODE!
support.descp:
Ready to get creative?
At this level, you’ll COLLABORATE WITH THE AQUABATS to MAKE A NEW ONLINE EPISODE!** You’ll work with our team to write a script based on whatever insane ideas you suggest, then team up with director and show co-creators Jason deVilliers and Christian Jacobs in any role you want! Once the script is worked out, you’ll join The Aquabats on set to produce and shoot YOUR EPISODE… and when it’s done, it’ll be included as part of our online season!
We’ll even throw a SUPER RAD SCREENING PARTY to celebrate at the end of production, so that you and your friends will be the first to see your masterpiece.
Plus, you’ll get everything in the $10, 25, 35, 55, 75, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300 and 350 Pledge Levels!

You’ll be charged for shipping after the campaign ends! See FAQs for details + estimated shipping costs.

INCLUDES:
We Create A NEW EPISODE Just For You!*
VIP Access to Every Aquabats Show in 2019!
Everything in the $350 Pledge Level!

support.title: The AQUABATS FUN DAY!
support.descp:
Want a day to remember? At this level, you'll bring up to 3 friends along as The Aquabats take you out for A DAY OF ADVENTURE IN SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA!*
Want to race Ricky Fitness, go putting with Jimmy The Robot, or take the mic from the MC Bat Commander? Now you can!
The Aquabats will pick your group up in the Battletram, and you'll choose between fun activities** like karaoke, go-karting and mini-golf… and, of course, a pizza party. Then, you'll sit with The Aquabats in traffic on one of the world's most congested freeways and breathe some of the most polluted air in the world! When in Rome...

support.title: BE OUR PRIME MINISTER!
support.descp:
This is it. The end of the line.
At this level, you'll be APPOINTED AS THE HONORARY PRIME MINISTER of The Aquabats' lost homeland of Aquabania.

campaign.story:
2-6 players  |  15-25 minutes (Realtime) 30-45 minutes (Turn Based)  |  Ages 14+  
                                              Realtime  |  Turn Based  |  5 Gameplay Modes
                Printed in English | PDF Translation for German, French and Spanish
Click through to see the campaign for our first game Dawn - Rise of the Occulites
Contents of the game before any stretch goals
Eye for an Eye is an innovative, realtime or turn based, dice driven game of arena combat for 2 to 6 players. Roll your dice, allocate them to actions on your player board and tribal cards and then call these out to resolve them on the board. Move cleverly across the arena, dancing around your opponents, build up for a strong attack, or pepper your enemy with quick ones. Play for your Tribe, or team up with another Chief or two, combo-ing your abilities with each other to devastating effect. With five different gameplay modes, all available in both realtime and turn based modes, replayability is huge.
 All of the stretch goals that we hit will be included with every game.
With many more Stretch Goals to be announced!
We have added a lot of content  to the game since our first go on Kickstarter earlier in the year. You now have the option of playing in either REALTIME or TURN BASED modes in one of five of the different GAMEPLAY MODES:
Every Eye for Themselves Arena
Alliances Arena
Nymphlet Ceremony
King of the Hill
Domination Mode
Check out a game of Every Eye for Themselves!
Roll and reroll the dice! (In REALTIME this is as many times as you like - in TURN BASED you get three total rolls with some exceptions)
You can allocate any dice that you choose at any point during your rolling to actions that have a matching symbol.
In REALTIME mode, you can then keep rolling, or call out and resolve an action. Remember, there are no turns.
In TURN BASED mode, once you've allocated all your dice, you grab a TURN ORDER MARKER. Once all players have grabbed one, you move onto the TURN PHASE. 
Then at any point in time in REALTIME mode, you can call out an action and resolve it. In TURN BASED mode, when it is your turn, you can call out and resolve up to two of your actions.
 In REALTIME mode, there are no turns, so you can call out and resolve an action whenever you like.
In TURN BASED mode, you need to wait until it is your turn to call out and resolve actions (up to two actions).
Whenever you call out and resolve an action in REALTIME or TURN BASED mode, you must then clear the dice you used from that action.
In REALTIME mode, you can then start rolling those dice as soon as the action is fully resolved.
In TURN BASED mode, you may need those dice to roll for an attack or defence. Once the action is then fully resolved, set the dice aside for the next round.
 Check out the changes made for TURN BASED mode here:
 If you just want to see games in play, then check out the videos below:
Here is a REALTIME game of Every Eye for Themselves Arena being played:
Here is a TURN BASED game of Every Eye for Themselves Arena being played:
Nymphlet Ceremony Playthrough Video coming soon.
King of the Hill Playthrough Video coming soon.
Domination Playthrough Video coming soon.
Players can choose to play Eye for an Eye in either Realtime, or Turn Based mode. Each of the different game modes can be played in either of these modes.
Every Eye for Themselves Arena sees you fight against the other players with the Chief that has essentially done the most damage winning the round.
Alliances sees you team up with up to two other Chiefs to coordinate your moves and fight against another team or teams. The most effective team will win the round.
Nymphlet Ceremony has you controlling one or more Nymphlets (dragonfly like creatures) as well as your Chief. Your goal is to keep your Nymphlets out of harms way while capturing your opponents. This mode introduces a different style of play that isn't just combat.
In King of the Hill you want to control an important section of the arena and then while you're in it, trigger the scoring mechanism. This mode of play focuses on movement and positioning and will see you and your opponents manipulating each other to ensure that you are the only one that scores.
Domination mode uses changing objectives throughout the game as the scoring mechanism. When the trigger in the soundtrack sounds, the designated area scores and a new one is drawn.
As you can see in the above image, the figures in Eye for an Eye are quite chunky and beautifully sculpted by Bob Olley. We have produced physical sculpts rather than going with digitally sculpted files because we love the quality and depth of Bob's work.
The sculpted base is 40mm flat to flat to provide stability during the realtime matches. None of these figures are at any risk of being knocked over.
We believe that the rulebook should always be available from the start. So please go ahead and download it, read through it and ask any questions that you might have. We have also provided Print and Play files to give you a taste of how it plays out if you would like to give it a crack!
Check out their video preview of the Realtime part of the game below
Watch Dan's How to Play the Realtime section of the game below
Watch the video preview for the Realtime section of the game with Nick Welford below
  Click the image to read the preview with Dane
Click on the image to check out the Kickstarter preview by Dez Maggs
Click the image to read the interview Ben did with Rowan
     More info to come...
The characters available in the Core game are:
Find out more about these characters in future updates or check out our rulebook:
Palaudis Chief Grublic
Hydris Chief Riparian
Floris Chief Banksia
Ignis Chief Incendiary
Nimbus Chief Pluma
Luftle Chief Echo
Eye for an Eye is made all the better by every single one of our contributors. Together, we have produced what you see before you - Eye for an Eye - a labour of love, hard work, blood, sweat and tears. The amalgamation of many years of work, Shae and I would like to acknowledge and sincerely thank the following people for their amazing contributions to our game.
As you may already know, Eye for an Eye is part of a series of games called the 'Rise of the Occulites' Saga. The very first game published in this series - Dawn: Rise of the Occulites, also takes place at the very beginning of the saga, a long time before Eye for an Eye. This narrative, scenario based skirmish game allows you to step in as Tribe Chief of your own Occulite Tribe. Powered by the Natural Selection Deck and sporting 19 scenarios, it has a metric tonne of replayability.
We've had a lot of people asking if Dawn will be included here as an add on. Instead of doing that, we got together with Eagle Games and organised for them to run a sale on Dawn alongside our campaign. The best part is that you can order it right now by CLICKING HERE!
Find out how the Occulite Saga began and pick up the complete Dawn - Rise of the Occulites game for a great price and play it while you wait for your copy of Eye for an Eye to arrive. Get immersed in the world!
Dawn - Rise of the Occulites is available both in pre-painted and unpainted, so pick one up that best suits your needs!
Shipping is not included in any of the pledge levels for this campaign and will be charged some time after the campaign has ended. This allows us to ensure that we charge an accurate amount for shipping. It also gives us time to ensure that we get a good balance between quality and low cost shipping solutions once we know how much content is going to be produced for the game.
We have engaged Quartermaster Logistics to fulfil our project which means we are EU, Canada, Australia and United States friendly. Below you will find our estimated shipping costs. It is possible that these may change as we cannot control the global market, but we believe that these should be fairly accurate costings.

Due to the fact that we have to run this Kickstarter in Australian dollars, we are at the mercy of fluctuating currency conversions. The currency conversions that we have provided on this campaign were true and correct as of our launch date (4th September).
To minimise any issues post campaign, the money will be converted to US dollars as soon as possible as this is the currency that all our manufacturing and shipping will be paid in. This ensures that currency conversion is no longer an issue post campaign.
Find out more about Darwin Games and Eye for an Eye through these links.
Please consider sharing this campaign around with your family and friends so that we can produce this game in the best possible fashion!
We have provided a series of Avatars so that you can proudly represent your Tribe not only in the Eye for an Eye Arena, but also in the Kickstarter arena. Who will you represent?
Palaudis Chief Grublic and his Luftle Advisor Cobbie
Hydris Chief Riparian
Floris Chief Banksia
Ignis Chief Incendiary
Nimbus Chief Pluma
Luftle Chief Echo and his Luftle Guards
Lucky Gretin
Nymphlet
Even more info to come...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Darwin Games has been involved in the manufacturing phase for two games previously - Dawn: Rise of the Occulites (along with Eagle Games) and Survival - Frogs of South Eastern Australia. Based on these experiences and extensive research, we are confident that we are well equipped to handle this process.

We have already paid for all of the art, figure sculpting and soundtrack creation in advance (and these components are all complete). We have also been in regular communication with our chosen manufacturer pre checking files and component details. This is in an effort to ensure that the project minimises the chances for any delays and so that we can get it into manufacturing as soon as possible after the campaign ends.

Having said that, there is always the possibility of delays occurring. Shipping times and getting through customs can cause delays as can the length of time with manufacturing, especially in regards to the tooling of the figures. We have put a realistic timeline on production, but will always be striving to deliver as early as we can. We want to see the finished game in our hands too!

We have been in contact with fulfilment services who will be prepared to ship the game when it gets to them.

At Darwin Games, we value honesty and integrity very highly and as such we will be transparent throughout this process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs,
This update is an important one so please read it in full and if you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask them. Please feel free to email Shae and I on occulites@gmail.com or post your comments / questions in the comments.
This update contains several sections: The Basic Plan, The Plan in More Detail and our Update Schedule.
THE PLAN IN SHORT

G'day Tribal Chiefs!
There hasn't been a lot to report lately, so we didn't want to bombard you with empty updates. However, we did go to PAX Australia recently and were able to demo two of our games - Eye for an Eye and our hand management / trick taking game 'The Trick with Occulites' (better name incoming!)
We had the pleasure of demoing these games on the Friday and Saturday of PAX Australia pretty much back to back in the Collaboratory and Free play areas, which meant that a slew of new people got to experience the game firsthand. Here is a video with some of their reactions...

G'day Tribal Chiefs,
We are working hard in the background to organise our relaunch for Eye for an Eye. We will definitely be back and will share more details with you all as they emerge.
While we will continue to post here on Kickstarter, it would be awesome if you could also jump on over to our website and sign up for our newsletter. This will allow you to find out about everything from background story and lore, to new games and upcoming events. You can sign up here: .
PAX Australia October 26th - 28th

updates.update_userinfo: What does that mean for the game?
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs,
Well... we didn't fund for the second time. Its tough... it really is. But all this does is strengthen our resolve to get Eye for an Eye produced. We love and believe in the game. We have content planned that will cover the next few years at least for it.

updates.update_userinfo: The Final Countdown, Chief Play Styles and Sneak Peeks
updates.update_content:
G'day Chiefs,
Before we jump into the update, Shae and I just want to say a very heartfelt thank you to those of you who are still with us here on the final day of the campaign. Whether you have been here from the start (or even before that!), or have just found and joined us recently, it is great to have you in the Arena with us now.
We are unlikely to fund in the next six hours, but we wanted to share some more information on the gameplay of each of the Chiefs and give you all a few sneak peeks as well. If we don't fund today, then we have some back up plans and it will just depend on which plan we go with. Whatever plan that is, regardless of whether you are a seasoned veteran of the Occulite world, or are just joining us now, we will need your help and support to make a splash on the first day of any relaunch.

G'day Tribal Chiefs,
As we head into the all important final 48 hours of our campaign, we are going to cover some generic strategies before going onto talking a bit about Alliances.

updates.update_userinfo: History of the Arena Part 3 and King of the Hill mode
updates.update_content:
G'day Tribal Chiefs,
Not many days to go now! In this update we present the third part of the 'History of the Arena' as well as a focus on one of our new game modes 'King of the Hill'.
History of the Arena Part 3

G'day Tribal Chiefs,
Today's update brings you the second part in the History of the Arena and after that a little message about where we are with the campaign.

G'day Tribal Chiefs!

For today's update, we thought that we would start to tell the story of how the Arenas came to be following on from The Drums of War. We'd love to hear what you think, so let us know in the comments!
History of the Arena Part 1

campaign.story:
DesktopHero is a web-based tool that lets you craft unique miniatures to use in your tabletop games.
Once you've designed a miniature, you can export it as an STL file and have it 3D printed, either by yourself or through an online service. 
What sets DesktopHero apart from other tools?
Create tons of minis at low cost. Downloading STL files for your models is free, which means you can create entire armies of miniatures for only the cost of printing - about $3.50 - $5.00 USD per mini if you are ordering online, and even less if printing at home.
Upload your own assets. Can't find anything matching the sword/helmet/tunic that you're looking for? Find it online or make it yourself, then upload it to DesktopHero to use with your characters.
Create your own poses. DesktopHero gives you fine-grained control over every bone in your miniature's body. Create a pose from scratch, or load a pose from the library and fine-tune it for your character.
Share your creations with the community. DesktopHero is a community effort where you can share assets, poses, and characters.
Try it out! The best way to see what DesktopHero has to offer is to jump right in and use it! It's live and waiting for you at www.desktophero3d.com.
Photo by Daniel Herrero
Psst! There's a freebie 3D model for sharing the project! See Updates page for details.
      We have 3 new features lined up for the next round of development: 
3 brand-new professional asset packs featuring Fantasy, Sci-fi and Modern genres
A prettier, more intuitive user interface
The ability to order 3D prints of your characters directly through the site
Since DesktopHero's release, our most requested feature has been for more and higher-resolution 3D assets. To that end, we are adding three new asset packs, built completely from scratch and with DesktopHero in mind to ensure a consistent look and feel. The assets from the different packs will be fully compatible, so that if you want to have a modern police uniform with a medieval vambrace and a techy laser gun arm, you can. Everything will just work together, without the clipping effects you often see with the current library.
Unlike the current public DesktopHero library, these premium asset packs will only be accessible to backers. (All current DesktopHero assets will continue to be freely accessible to everyone, as will assets uploaded by the community.)
Fantasy Asset Pack - Concept
Sci-fi Asset Pack - Concept
Modern Asset Pack - Concept
As DesktopHero has expanded to include new features over the last several months, the user interface has become more complex and less intuitive. We're working with a professional UI designer to rebuild DesktopHero's user interface from the ground up, focusing on the following goals: 
Provide simple controls for newcomers, advanced editing features for those who want fine-grained control
Easily find specific assets you are looking for (rather than having to browse through all of them)
Start with a preset character, then make minor edits (rather than having to construct a dragonborn piece by piece)
Manipulate character pose in a way that makes sense intuitively
These changes will result in a system that makes creating miniatures fun instead of frustrating.
It used to be that in order to take advantage of DesktopHero, you had to have a 3D printer. No longer! We'll be working with Shapeways to add 3D print fulfillment to DesktopHero, so that you can order physical prints of your characters directly from the site.
Shapeways offers a number of different material options, including Strong & Flexible Plastic (standard), High Detail Plastic (for painting), and even a variety of metals (in case your characters are fighting a dragon).
How much will it cost to order a mini? From my experience, printing a 28mm scale mini through Shapeways using standard plastic costs between $3.50 - $5.00 USD per mini. Printing in high detail plastic seems to fall in the $7.00 - $10.00 realm.
For those of you who have access to your own 3D printers, DesktopHero will continue to allow you to download STLs for free.

All the best,
Andrew & the DesktopHero Team

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having successfully delivered on our first Kickstarter - the one that got DesktopHero to this point - we are confident in our ability to deliver again. 

One additional complication that we are taking on with this Kickstarter is that of offering physical rewards. In order to make sure we understand the shipping process, we did a test run earlier this year, shipping a batch of DesktopHero miniatures to various volunteers from the DesktopHero community (with excellent results).

We will do our very best to make sure all backers receive their rewards regardless of any challenges that arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
PLAY

Mo Hawk Troll (Courtesy of Olivier Lord)
Rhum Runner Troll (Courtesy of Olivier Lord)
This project has been very close to our heart for several months. It can now be brought into being. 
We are associated with a young Russian company, Punga Miniatures, which will manufacture our resin figurines. The rendering is well detailed and the resin of good quality. Moreover this partnership allows us to offer you a wide selection of interesting add-ons. 
Our original idea was to highlight our origins here in North America. Canada has a history during which First Nations peoples and French and English settlers lived together and built our roots.
We want to pay tribute to those natives peoples who didn’t have an easy life and who were often evicted from their own lands and suffered terrible clashes. In the colonies, there were also many French “coureurs des bois” (wood runners) who worked very hard alongside the native peoples. These explorers discovered the territory and allowed the colonization to expand from coast to coast.
Our project had a hard time because our Mo Hawk Troll was carrying a scalp in his hand. Blood Bowl is a violent game in which the heads are torn off, crushed and the limbs ground. At first, we didn’t have any discomfort due to the presence of the scalp. However we intended to create beautiful new figurines without any bad aspects.
In the wake of some comments, we decided to replace the hand of the Mo Hawk. We will make an alternative hand with a corncob. You will understand that we cannot modify more the previously mounted figurines, videos, etc. So, we apologize to those who won’t find it fit with the original hand.
***** Shipping: Will be calculated according to the options chosen by each of you. Available all over the world. *****
************************************************************************************
PLAY

Mo Hawk Troll (Gracieuseté d'Olivier Lord)  
Rhum Runner Troll (Gracieuseté d'Olivier Lord)  
Voici un projet qui nous tient à cœur depuis plusieurs mois et qui peut maintenant voir le jour. Nous sommes associés avec une jeune compagnie russe, Punga Miniatures, qui produira nos figurines en résine. Le rendu est bien détaillé et la résine de bonne qualité. Ce partenariat nous permet aussi de vous offrir un vaste choix de add-ons intéressants.
Notre idée originale était de mettre en relief nos origines ici en Amérique du nord. Le Canada a une histoire au cours de laquelle les Amérindiens et les colons français et anglais ont vécu ensemble et établi nos racines.
Nous voulons rendre hommage à ces Amérindiens qui n'ont pas eu la vie facile et qui souvent se sont fait évincer de leurs propres terres et ont subi de terribles affronts. Rendre hommage aussi aux coureurs des bois qui, au sein des colonies, ont énormément travaillé aux côtés des Amérindiens. Ces explorateurs ont découvert le territoire et permis l’expansion de la colonisation d'un océan à l'autre. 
Ce projet a connu un moment difficile à cause du fait que notre Troll Mo Hawk portait dans sa main un scalp. Blood Bowl est un jeu violent où les têtes sont arrachées et écrasées, et les membres broyés. Au début nous n'avions pas de malaise avec ce scalp. Notre intention était pourtant de créer de magnifiques nouvelles figurines sans aucun mauvais trait. 
 Après avoir reçu quelques commentaires, nous avons décidé de modifier la main de Mo Hawk. Nous allons produire une main alternative tenant un épi de maïs. Vous comprendrez que nous ne pouvons modifier davantage les figurines déjà réalisées, les vidéos, etc. Aussi, nous nous excusons envers ceux qui ne trouvent pas appropriée la main originale. 
***** Shipping: Nous allons calculer le tout en fonction des options choisies par chacun de vous.  Livraison partout dans le monde. *****
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our risks are quite minimal, because the figurines have already been made through testing. Our Israel sculptors Delgado Laborda (Miniaturas Ezipion) and Radmir Akhmetov and Rif Mukhamadeev (Punga Miniatures) have already completed all the projects of this Kickstarter. As soon as we finance this project, we will start production.

The delivery time is long, because we will have to wait for the production which is made in Europe and must reach us later in Quebec.

We are going to have a small challenge regarding the shipping of all pledges, because we are only two guys to carry out all the shipments. We will calculate the shipping costs according to your choice of options and which country you live in.

*****************************************************************

Nos risques sont assez minimes, car les figurines ont déjà été produites en test. Nos sculpteurs Israel Delgado Laborda (Miniaturas Ezipion) et Radmir Akhmetov et Rif Mukhamadeev(Punga Miniatures) ont déjà terminé tous les projets de ce kickstarter. Dès que nous aurons financé ce projet, nous commencerons la production.

Le délai de livraison est long, car nous devrons attendre la production qui se fait en Europe et doit nous parvenir au Québec.

Nous allons avoir un petit défi concernant le shipping de tous les pledges, car nous sommes que deux gars pour procéder la totalité des envois. Nous allons calculer le shipping en fonction de vos choix d'options et d'ou vous venez dans le monde.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Animal Adventures brings intelligent animal characters to your favourite fantasy roleplaying game! Dungeons and Doggies is the first in a planned series of Animal Adventures releases! It is a set of highly detailed miniatures combining some favourite dog breeds with the different classes of the fifth edition of the world’s greatest roleplaying game!
Tedric, Cornelius and Montague prepare for a new adventure.
This set features not only the miniatures in preassembled ready-to-play or paint PVC, but also a bespoke set of fifth edition compatible rules for using your Animal Adventure miniatures and playing as dogs in ANY campaign setting. 
You will be able to mix canine characters with your regular adventuring party or create an entire doggy team of heroes to save the world! The miniatures also make perfect companions and familiars for your existing characters in any fantasy setting or game!
Cornelius the Golden Retriever Wizard
Our range of canine characters are true dogs, four legged companions true of heart and pure of soul! We have chosen to develop a range of ‘non-humanoid’ minis to offer as much of a unique play experience as we possibly could.  
Each dog has been lovingly designed and sculpted, by some serious dog fans, to be bursting with personality and detail. From the panpipes of Monty, the bard, to the magical spell bones of Cornelius, the Wizard, care has been taken to add flavour and fun to every model.
Nightingale the Pomeranian Monk
Tedric the Chihuahua Rogue
Montague the Cocker Spaniel Bard
 The Fetch! Pledge $35/£27
Because this is Painting and Polygons’ first independent Kickstarter project (despite our experience on other projects), we have chosen to keep things as simple as possible to make it easy for us to support, while ensuring smooth delivery.  
The Fetch! Pledge brings you 13 doggy miniatures along with the Rules and Adventure Companion PDFs, as well as art prints from our artist, April Prime.  
Rather than include stretch goals that would complicate the process, in an attempt to encourage more participation, we are keeping things really easy with only one pledge level, that gets you everything we can cram into this campaign!  
We have many more ideas for the future too, including more doggies (and maybe even kitties) so don’t panic if your favourite breed isn’t here! The world of Animal Adventurers is just opening up, and with your support, we hope to be able to make this our first step on our journey into it!
The dogs are designed on 25mm and 20mm bases and scaled to fit in with existing RPG miniatures ranges. And, although we are providing full rules to create your own doggy adventurers, each miniature comes with its own pre-generated character, complete with character sheet and short story! Whether you fancy being Hartley, a gruff and stoic fighter or Freya, a noble guardian druid, there’s a dog for every player.
We are proud to be able to support the excellent online comic Dungeons and Doggos! As part of our collaboration with them, every backer will receive as part of their pledge, a Kickstarter exclusive cross-over miniature; Tonka, the Mastiff Bard. 
You can read all about Tonka, and the rest of our fearless canine friends, by joining in with the adventure, as depicted by V Lee Illustrations, every Friday at dndoggos.com.
Alongside our range of miniatures, we are proud to present and include in our campaign a full set of digital rules and a unique adventure that provides a perfect setting for a great one-shot RPG experience, for absolutely free! 
Our rules set contains OGL fifth edition racial rules for creating an intelligent dog, unique canine feats and class options, notes on a canine deity for divine doggies and magic items specially tuned for dog use (which of course, are chew proof as well!).  
The accompanying adventure, titled “Who’ll let the Dogs Out?”, is designed to be played either with the characters included in the rules or with any party of equivalent level and tells the fateful tale of sinister magics, dark druids and a chance for some brave dogs to save themselves, their canine cousins and the local village from a terrible fate! 
Both the adventure and the rules pack feature stunning artwork from professional illustrator and dog lover April Prime, who’s previous work includes the excellent Baby Bestiary for Metal Weave Games. 
Alongside the free rules PDFs, we are excited to be able to offer some of April’s illustrations as art prints, included as part of the campaign for free for every backer! 
If you want to find out more about April's work, you can do so at: www.artstation.com/april-prime, or by following her on Twitter, @April_Prime.
Russ Charles is part of the team and principal sculptor behind Painting and Polygons - a Twitch channel that regularly hosts painting and sculpting spotlights for the games industry.
Russ has worked in the games industry for many years and has contributed to projects as wide ranging as Reaper Bones, Dr Who, Warmachine, Resident Evil 2, Guild Ball and most recently Critical Role.
Shipping will be charged after the Kickstarter finishes based on actual costs incurred to ship and is collected via our pledge manager system. This allows us to charge fairly for all backers and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping.    
We will ship your pledges to several hubs around the world at our cost. Your pledge will arrive via one of the following hubs:  
• United Kingdom (UK and Rest of the World backers)  
• USA (US backers)  
• Canada (Canada backers)  
• Germany (EU backers)  
• China (Asia Pacific backers)  
• Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers)  
Below are our initial rough estimates for shipping the sets (2kg volumetric weight). These are just estimates, and may change:  
• UNITED KINGDOM: £6. Channel Islands, Highlands and NI £6-£13  
• USA: £7-£11 to the contiguous US and the US Virgin Islands. £17-20 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico.  
• CANADA: £7-£15 to most cities.  
• EUROPE: £8-£20 to most countries. £20-£30 to non-EU countries.  
• LATIN AMERICA: £25-£40 to most countries.  
• ASIA: £15-£25 to most countries.  
• OCEANIA: £9-£18 to Australia and New Zealand.  
• AFRICA/OTHER: £25-£50 to most countries.  
Any pledges confirmed after our pledge manager deadline will be shipped from the UK hub at a later date and will likely incur increased shipping costs.  
Below is the general schedule once the Kickstarter ends so you know when to expect money to be taken and our overall shipping plan. Again these are estimates: 
 Kickstarter Campaign Ends 
 • 0 Day – Pledges are charged. 
 • 1 Week – Survey sent confirming emails. 
 • 1-2 Months – Pledge Manager sent to backers taking payment for shipping. 
 • 1 Month Before Shipping – Pledge Manager deadline - any late confirmations after this deadline will be shipped from the UK after all other pledges are completed and may incur additional cost. 
 Shipping Starts 
 • 0 Days – China starts packing EU/AUS/US hub orders. UK/RoW orders are sent to the UK hub by sea freight. 
 • 2-5 Weeks – China begins packing and shipping Asian hub orders. 
 • 6-8 Weeks – UK hub receives items and begins packing and shipping to backers 
 • 9-12 Weeks - EU/AUS/US hubs receive items, ship everything out to backers within 2 weeks. 
 • 13+ Weeks – UK hub completes shipping of the UK and RoW orders.
Customer service requests for missing/broken items are dealt with via support@paintingpolygons.com. We are, unfortunately, not able to ship to PO Boxes.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
========= 

 Challenges 

========= 

This is our first Kickstarter project, however, we are fully aware of potential delays that may happen with products that are produced in China, the common ones being delays in production, shipping, and customs. 

We have estimated the delivery for May 2019, but please understand this is only an estimate. Due to the global logistics involved in shipping, some regions may receive their pledges sooner than others. 

We have prepared as much as possible with our production for a successful Kickstarter; however, we will refund pledges if for some unforeseen reason the product cannot be delivered at all. 

======= 

Refunds 

======= 

Refunds may be given within 60 days of the campaign ending, including fees. After that time, refunds may be given minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees, as we will not be able to claim those back after 60 days. 

We are unable to issue refunds once we have begun the packaging and shipment stages of the project (around 6–8 weeks before the actual shipping date). 

Refunds within 60 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit/debit card. Refunds after 60 days of the campaign ending are processed via PayPal only. 

This is a GBP Kickstarter and refunds will be processed in GBP for the amount received, excluding any applicable fees dependent on the day on which the refund is processed as detailed above. 

================= 

Terms and Conditions 

================= 

If you do not confirm your shipping and pledge details within 10 weeks of our notification via email to confirm them, your pledge will be treated as abandoned. We will, however, look at each case sympathetically and try our best to satisfy each customer. 

By pledging on this Kickstarter you agree that our responsibility to you is for shipping your order as entered into the pledge management system. You are responsible for import or other duties that may be payable to relevant tax authorities. You also accept that you are fully liable for incorrect shipping details and will risk your pledge being unable to be delivered or lost in transit. 

If you do not accept the proposed terms please do not pledge on this Kickstarter project and wait for the global general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Dr. Horrible’s Evil League of Evil is a cooperative/competitive strategy game for 2-5 players that insists you work with others to complete evil schemes, then pits you against one another for that one seat at the table. With two different win conditions you need to keep a close eye on your fellow villains. Changing locations, managing your resources, and using your powers to devastating effect is just as important as making sure the League recognizes your accomplishments. So if your evil schemes aren’t enough to get their attention, you might have to do something really drastic–like build your own secret weapon and take on Captain Hammer mano-a-hammero. Yeah that’s right. He’s back too, and he’s sure to put his fist in your plans.
In Dr. Horrible’s Evil League of Evil, you play the role of an aspiring Villain who would love nothing more than to be recognized by the new leader of the Evil League of Evil, notorious Dr. Horrible. While the League still considers you small potatoes, completing Schemes, using your Powers, and betraying your “friends” might just do the trick. But be careful--after ten years of therapy, Captain Hammer is back, and his preferred handshake is a punch to the face. Literally. So you and your fellow villains will have to stay on the move. Meanwhile Hammer will patrol the town, heroically fixing your mayhem and stopping any Schemes in his tracks, which means it would take a Weapon of truly epic proportion to defeat him again. Now if only you could get all this foreshadowing off your shoes...
Everything Boad Games Preview: CLICK HERE (just kidding link soon)
Team EXE at one of our playtest events: CLICK HERE
Shipping will be collected after the campaign to ensure best price possible.

PLEASE NOTE: Damage may occur during transit by the various shipping carriers used. We make sure to keep shipping and handling costs as low as possible for our backers, because without you our company would not exist. PLEASE NOTE: Our Customer Service Troll will be available to email anytime if you have issues with your delivery that cannot be resolved with the carrier. To assist you we will always need your backer number, address and backer name, so please include those in any email communication.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hello backers, Head Troll here (taking off the villain hat for a moment). We at Lucky Troll want you to know that we've spent over two years playtesting and developing this game to make it fun, challenging, and rewarding. We know where and how we're going to print, box and ship everything. Finally, we're going to be as transparent and easy to talk to as possible, so if you have anything on your mind please reach out to us. All that said: stuff happens. It could be a problem with our manufacturer, or our licensing, or our shipping. It could be all of the above. It could even be a BOAT! (Couldn't resist.) So we promise that we will keep everyone as informed as possible, warts and all, in case things change. We want to earn your trust as well as your dollars. So in this regard, we won't be acting anything like villains--as tough as it may be, we'll try to act like *blech* the good guys.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
There are a couple things I'd like to share with everyone that first backed us and showed interest in our game.
First off we are excited to announce we are Re-Launching today at 6:30 PST under the re-branded name "Evil Upheaval" It has been a wild ride and a lot has happened in the past year. We have been working with an amazing new artist that has redone almost all of the art and helped us redesign the "Hero" Captain Mallet. He helped keep the same campy silly feel we were looking for and we can't wait to see what custom villains you all have for us.

First of all.
I want to thank everyone that has taken the time to stop by and say hello at the cons we have been to in the last month. It's been pretty hectic, but everyone we have met and took the time to play the game has been the greatest. I'm listening to all the feedback and honestly and sincerely doing everything I can to address everything brought up. I love hearing from you guys and can't wait to give you more information.

We have been working with a couple different artists to change the look. Meanwhile we have come up with a new name of the game that we think both keeps the feeling comical and lite while still being a good ode to the original show. We wanted to stay away from the obvious parody version because we don't believe it sets the right mood. That being said we will keep everyone updated as we get closer to relaunching the Kickstarter. 

We are also still making attempts to open a dialog about licensing. No more fingers crossed, but not giving up. 

Best regards
Nicholas Engel - Head Troll

Dear Backers,
After 10 years of no sequel, my heart still aches for more Dr. Horrible in my life. 2 years ago my wife and I started development on this game with that exact thought in mind. I want to play a game so I can feel like Dr. Horrible. When we started introducing the game to friends and family, I was shocked to find out so many people have never heard of one of my biggest passions. We would stop playing the game immediately and force them to watch the DVD. We even gave out a couple of the extra copies we bought (knowing at the time when we got them they would make great gifts). This is what started it all. I want to revitalize what is so dear to me and I know is dear to so many others.

Attempting to attend a convention during the launch of our first Kickstarter was a mistake. I’m sorry I did not address this sooner. It’s clear that mistakes were made, and rushing to meet the 10 year anniversary should not have been as important as securing the IP.

It is very important for me that you, the backers, understand that it was never my intent to hurt or deceive anyone. Attempts have been made and are being made to contact both the company who currently holds the rights to the IP, and Joss himself. They have a copy of the prototype and they have been informed of everything we have done. I now know we should have explicitly and clearly stated that this product is currently unlicensed, and more importantly not gone into the Kickstarter in the current stages of licensing. As a new and overly enthusiastic board game creator I ask for your understanding and forgiveness.

For those of you that have played the game, or are still willing and eager to play the game. I’m very sorry that you will have to wait a bit longer. We will go back to the drawing board and do this right. I can’t say how sorry I am for the miscommunication and more importantly for the distrust this brings, but please know that this is sincere and I’ve learned a lot from this.

To the game stores that welcomed us into your locations and showed us so much love. I am deeply sorry for any damage this may have caused your stores name and reputation.I hope our future actions serve as proof of our sincerity and that you allow us to make it up to you in the future. I would ask everyone involved not to hold these stores accountable for my actions.

To the fans of Dr. Horrible: I feel my passion has clouded my eyes from what is truly important here. The excitement you felt and love you have is the same thing I want to share. For those that thought this project was licensed or in any way directly affiliated with any related parties, you have my sincere apologies.

Funded in less than 2 hours, 4 times the funding in about 48 hours. This shows that there is an interest and we share a common goal. However, the decision to cancel the campaign is the most honest thing we can do. Thank you for your comments and advice.

Sincerely
Nicholas Engel
CEO and Owner of Lucky Troll Games, LLC

PS: If you have any further comments or questions you may reach me here. headtroll@luckytrollgames.com

Fellow Villains, 
Obviously we need to start off by acknowledging your incredible response--we BLEW past our goals practically overnight, and now our Head Troll is going straight from working himself to death at our launch con this weekend to working himself to death coming up with new enhancements for everyone to enjoy. But before we start that fun we need to address the elephant in the room. One big issue is clearly on everyone’s mind: How does Mr. Muscle keep his hair so luscious? Just kidding. It’s licensing. The short answer is, it’s all part of the plan--a plan we wouldn’t plan if we didn’t also plan on following through. The long answer is, we’ve done everything short of a skywriting campaign above Los Angeles, but the trick is getting the RIGHT attention. And believe it or not, this comment section is exactly the kind of helpful we’d hoped for. After all, overwhelming love and passion for the musical led us to where we are now--what matters is taking matters into our own hands. We’re not giving up without exhausting every last option, and that includes riding the lightning of a mercurial, motivated and vocal online fandom. In the meanwhile we’re going to keep our promises of honesty, transparency, and respect, whether you like it or not.
