updates.update_userinfo: Earn Promo Cards with Shepherds of Woe Quests!
updates.update_content:
The Shepherds of Woe program is getting a massive overhaul for the better! Each month a new quest will be available with a new reward. When you complete the quest, simply send an email to support@studiowoe.com with your mailing address and your reward will be sent to you immediately. Shipping costs may apply for orders out of the US, basically if the order costs more than $5 I may ask you to pitch in.
  There are some huge advantages to this system over the previous way of doing Shepherds of Woe. You will no longer need to register. There is no chance of not getting credit for points earned in the past. Rewards are sent immediately rather than at the end of the year, and this system is no longer a competition between shepherds! Everybody wins!

What an amazing journey this has been so far! I have to admit I was terrified to embark on this leg of the journey. This is my first time doing "Self-fulfillment" for a Kickstarter campaign. I learned a lot along the way, but we got the job done. 
Many of you already have your games, If not they should be coming very soon! If you have not yet received a tracking number for your package, it may be for one of the following reasons.

project_data.project_name: Gruff: Stuff of Nightmares

campaign.story:
When we started Restoration Games, we asked you to tell us which games to bring back. The number one request, by far, was Fireball Island. After more than a year of hard work, we are thrilled to announce: Fireball Island is back!
If this is your first time checking out the campaign, good to see you! You'll be thrilled to know that our amazing backers have already unlocked tons of stretch goals (and more still to come). As you check out the page, keep in mind that your pledge will also include all of this amazing stuff.
On the other hand, if you know you want it all and you want it now, we've got you covered.
So what are you waiting for? Come on and join the fun!
Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar improves on the art, components, and game play of the original. If you loved the game as a child, you'll see we turned that "delightful chaos" up to the max. If you never played it before, you'll appreciate it as a fun, exciting game for kids, families, and gamers alike.
We found a way to make the new island bigger, taller, faster, and cooler -- all while fitting in a smaller box.
Tom Vasel and the Dice Tower crew sat down with Justin Jacobson, the president of Restoration Games for a full, live playthrough of the base game, which should give you a good idea of how the game plays.
Sometimes, you may face Vul-Kar the way you want...
... but even then you can't be sure which way it will come out.
Even as the marble careens down the mountain, the paths and trees can divert it one way or another.
A tree might even save your life.
While the fireballs are unpredictable, we made sure that players have more control over their actions and more meaningful choices.
On your turn, play one of your two action cards to move your pawn and perform a special action.
Grab a snapshot from each part of the island and get back to the helipad.
Earn points for collecting sets of treasure.
If you get knocked down, you'll lose a treasure but gain a useful souvenir.
If you draw a Cataclysm, Vul-Kar gets to take a turn.
In all, the game remains fast, fun, and light, but offers meaningful choices.
We've also made arrangements with Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! to do a rules video at the time of release. 
NOTE: The board in the images above is a hand-painted prototype and does not reflect final art for the island. Here is the near-final art for the island and some renders showing off the detail that will show up on the finished board.
Blades of grass and cracked stones ease your path.
A lonely crab woos visitors at Skeleton Head Beach.
There are four expansions available in this campaign, and they are fully interchangeable with the base game and each other. We've also added some amazing new components, through hitting stretch goals, with no additional charge to backers.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       The view from the poop deck.
Hope you got that snapshot, Saul.
                                                                                                                                                                                        If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easy to get involved, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun. All you have to do is:
Click on the pledge level you want to back.
Enter your email address and “Continue as guest”.
Enter your payment information.
Click the big green “Pledge” button 
To keep things simple, there are only two tiers for regular backers.
(You can order additional copies or optional buys by increasing your pledge amount. See Shipping and Fulfillment below for more details.)
For verified brick-and-mortar stores: We also have a special pledge level that is just for you. You pledge only $20 during the campaign. When we are ready to ship the games, after the campaign closes, you will use our pledge manager to finalize your order and pay the remaining balance due. If you have any question about your status, please message us, and we will confirm before pledging. All the terms and other information about this pledge level can be found in this special update.
We've blown through dozens of stretch goals, like a fireball through a rickety bridge, and unlocked tons of great additional content. Backers get the Treasure Trove expansion pack for free, and it's already full of new souvenirs, injury cards, and more.
Unlocked sleeves (optional buy, manually add $15 to your pledge).
Painted minis (optional buy, manually add $10 to your pledge).
Maker Kit (optional buy, manually add $40 to your pledge)
Not much time left to hit those stretch goals!
Given the unique design of the game, we only have one prototype and couldn't send out review copies. We wanted a fun way to let a bunch of people play the game, so we took the show on the road! J.R. Honeycutt, our Tinker-in-Chief, set off on a 30-day, 13-state road trip, including a stop in Canada! We met up with some of the most amazing game stores, cafes, conventions, and content creators to bring you a chance to play the game in person. And, of course, we got to meet our amazing fans and backers. It was truly a special happening. Below are some videos from the trip. (Note: These videos are of the hand-painted prototype board; the final version of the board will have printed art and won't be as shiny.)
One of our backers, MAJBrown22 was able to make it to the Secret Cabal Meetup at Beermongers and wrote up his impressions in this Board Game Geek forum post. 
Chris has apparently been ensorcelled by Vul-Kar.
 Check out some epic skill shots in this supercut:
PLAY

We are using key fulfillment partners within each shipping region. There are no additional customs fees, VAT, or similar charges.
There is only one shipping charge per region regardless of what reward you get -- we're subsidizing the rest.
For the US, Canada, and the EU, we are proud to partner with Quartermaster Logistics, the premier provider of Kickstarter fulfillment in the gaming industry. Your games will be safely packed by their professional team, and you’ll be emailed a tracking number when your package ships. For Australian backers, we'll be using Aetherworks, who we used on our Stop Thief! campaign and who did a great job.
If you would like to order a second copy, just increase your pledge amount by the cost of that pledge. You do not need to add anything for additional shipping. If you want more than two copies, add the shipping charge for each additional set of one or two. For example, if you wanted to get three copies of the base game sent to Canada, you would pledge a total of $220.
We are using BackerKit, a third-party service that lets us manage ordering and shipping. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll have the chance add items to your pledge at that time. Importantly, though, there will be no additional fees due after the campaign. When you pledge, it will automatically calculate and add all shipping charges. The only additional charge is if you decide to get more stuff. Both pledge levels will be available in BackerKit. You can back the campaign now at any amount and choose your pledge later, or you can back at the Feel the Burn level and upgrade to the Full Vul-Kar.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Due to the limitations of our license, we are only able to offer the game in English and in the US, Canada, EU, and Australia. Please see the FAQ for more information.
As we head into the final hours of this campaign, every point of contact and bit of buzz can help. Send the message out far and wide on social media. Use these social media avatars to show your love for the game. And, remember, sometimes the best way is a direct, personal email to that one person you just know will get a kick out of it. Every little bit helps.
Restoration Games was founded by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We knew there were a lot of great treasures hidden beneath the sands of time. When we announced our plans, the response was overwhelming. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory, bringing the fun to those with fond memories, and publishing great games for demanding gamers.
We must acknowledge the rest of the team who put in an unblelievable effort to make this a reality. Jason Taylor is our Visual Restoration Wizard, who is the reason everything we do looks so good. Lindsay Daviau is our Production Superhero, who ensures the finished products look amazing. JR Honeycutt is our Tinker-in-Chief; he helps get a game from the idea to a finished design. Suzanne Sheldon, our Master-of-Fireworks, makes sure everyone knows what we're up to.
We had lots of talented help with the art and design of the game. George Doutsiopoulos did the fantastic cover illustrations for the base game and the three main expansions. Card art is by Victor Perez Corbella. David Kegg did the retro art that appears in various places in the game, branding, and this campaign. Jean-Louis Sirois helped with some extra foliage illustration you see on this page and on the gameboard. Additional thanks to Matijos Gebreselassie and Bill Tiller for early concept illustrations. 3D sculpting for the miniatures and island features is by Chad Hoverter. Noah Adelman of Game Trayz, LLC did the initial design work on the island trays. Design Innovation, Inc. finalized the island trays. The video work was done by Josh McDowell, and the voiceover was performed by Graham Rowat. Rulebook editing was done by the Meeple Lady. Our thanks to all of them for their unbelievable effort in bringing this project to fruition.
And, of course, we would be remiss not to mention the original masterminds behind the game, Bruce Lund and Chuck Kennedy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter and fourth game overall. Our first Kickstarter, for Stop Thief! was, by all accounts, a huge success. We received many compliments on how we handled everything, making sure everyone got their games in a timely manner. We pride ourselves on our customer service. If something happens, we'll work hard to make it right.

That said, Fireball Island is a design project unlike any other, involving three-dimensional, mechanical, plastics. Rob, Jason, and Lindsay have decades of experience working at Hasbro on such products.

This is also a licensed product. However, Justin negotiated complete creative control in the licensing agreement. Therefore, no final approval is needed to move to production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Sorry for the extended delay, folks, but we've just released the Fun Run mode in the app. You don't need to do anything special; just download the latest version of the app from your platform of choice and get playing.
The new mode introduces a real time element to the game, making it even more frantic. Once enabled, the app plays a soundtrack that randomly and periodically plays three different sounds. If a sound plays while it's your turn, you suffer the corresponding penalty. So you'll want to move as quickly as possible. Remember, finishing your turn also means resetting the marbles on the board, so a 4-fireball Cataclysm can be positively nerve-wracking. Even when you make it to the Hello-Copter, you'll still have to act quickly so you don't lose any treasures.

Just a quick update to let you all know that the app has been updated to include scoring for the Spider Springs expansion. Still working on the art assets for the Fun Run update, which should be soon.

updates.update_userinfo: Roll for Initiative! -- Artist Poster Series!
updates.update_content: Gather your party and grab your potions of fire resistance. We've recently uncovered a promotional adventure module that EmberCorp made. This was a stretch goal, but moreso, a labor of love for Rob and myself (and our friend Kit, who's a great writer). We hope you enjoy.

updates.update_userinfo: Spider Springs (and More) at Gen Con
updates.update_content:
Hard to believe, but Gen Con is just around the corner. This is always a hectic and exciting time of the year. This year's Gen Con is shaping up to be a big one.
First things first, let's talk Fireball Island. We were able to demo the new expansion, Spider Springs, at Origins, and folks are going bananas over this one. We learned a lot developing the base game and the initial slate of expansions. We figured out which things work best and what people like the most. What's fun, and what's too fiddly. We've taken all of those lessons to heart in producing Spider Springs, and I think this is going to be a must-have expansion for die-hard FI fans. It adds a healthy dose of mayhem and whimsy while still fitting in seamlessly to the regular game. You can learn more about the expansion on its . (Our website is in the middle of a makeover.)

Hello, everybody! For those of you that don't subscribe to our newsletter -- shame on you! -- we just announced a Fireball Island Maker Kit contest. We know that some of you have been doing some cool things with the game, but we want to share these creations with everyone and have some fun. 
All you have to do to enter the contest is share an image of your Maker Kit creation on social media (twitter, facebook, and instagram are all fine) and tag Restoration Games with #MyFireballIsland.

Just a quick update to let everyone know that, at the request of some backers, we've made the .stl files of the player pawns available for download on our website. Or you can get them directly using this link.
These are for non-commercial use only, but they're a good way to 3D print a replacement pawn if one goes missing or breaks (or if you are always fighting over who gets to play Saul).

updates.update_userinfo: EmberCorp Team-Building Exercise AKA Cooperative Mode
updates.update_content:
If you want a change of pace, now you can work together to take on Vul-Kar. You can download the cooperative rules here:
Fireball Island Cooperative Rules
If you have questions about the rules, you'll probably do best posting them at Board Game Geek, where they'll also live on to help others with similar questions. But, of course, I am happy to answer questions here as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Talk About Some Other Kickstarters
updates.update_content:
There are a couple of new Kickstarters out there that might be of interest to Fireball Island fans.
The Secret Cabal has launched their 2019 campaign. Yes, we have a promo card in there. Yes, you can only get it as part of their full promo pack, which is $50. Obviously, we fully support them. They are great content creators and supporters of the hobby. However, if you are not inclined to support them or don't have the means, we intentionally designed the card as an injury card, so it would not impact core play. I do want to be clear though: We do not have any of these cards ourselves, so we cannot offer to sell them directly. I know some folks are just anti-promo. But we know, for a fact, that these promo cards help content creators like the Secret Cabal to meet their costs, and we believe strongly that media voices such as theirs contribute to a strong and growing hobby.

updates.update_userinfo: Golden Geek Award Nominations - Spare a Vote?
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update. We're thrilled that Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar has been nominated for a Golden Geek Award in the categories of Family Game, Thematic Game, and Artwork and Presentation. If you're inclined, we'd really appreciate your vote, especially in the Family Game category.
Golden Geek Award Voting Page
Thanks!

Pardon the shortness of this update. I’m out in Reno, Nevada at the GAMA trade show, telling all the retailers about our great games. It’s also a popular time to announce new products. Yesterday, we announced Unmatched, a new take on Star Wars: Epic Duels. But we’re also announcing the next Expansion for Fireball Island: Spider Springs!
This new expansion is another island tray, like Crimson Cutlass, but it actually slots into the main island in one of the gaps between the side trays. You still get to it through the caves, but now it interacts with the main island. Specifically, a broken bridge connects them, with an ember marble on it. When a fireball hits it or when you launch it directly, it drops down into the new tray. At the base of the tray, is a spring-loaded web contains small plastic spiders. When the marble hits, the catch releases, launching the spiders into the air. In short, more mayhem.

project_data.project_name: Fireball Island - 80's Board Game, Reignited and Restored

campaign.story:
The Ashen Age
When the war between the fey races and the humanoids reached a fever pitch, it boiled over in the unleashing of the very power that gave Everglow its name. Disrupted and set free, The Blaze tore the world of both sides apart.
Fire, Ice, Lightning, Acid, and more worked to reduce the past age to a fading memory. Even the sky seemed burnt with the fury of it, and the Ashen Age began, or so those that survived to see it called it.
The old dividing lines faded away. What did it matter if those you lived with had two legs or four, so long as you knew them. Friends were beyond precious, and strangers were a constant source of danger. The world was dashed, but hope lived. People are putting themselves back together. This generation may have been born in the ash, but it will rise from the same.
It is time to marshal your skill, resources, and determination. It is time to rise From The Ashes.
This will be a setting book for 5th edition, Starfinder, and Pathfinder.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Hello everyone! You may have heard of us before, because this is the fifth Kickstarter we've done. We have never failed in delivering, and we don't plan to start.

In fact, this book is already well underway in writing, and we're quite happy with how it's shaping up. This Kickstarter will help pay for the gorgeous art that will make this world come alive! I, David, do not 'pay' myself. I get what's left over, but art is not free, and that's why we are here.

Come and let's make this book as lovely as it can be.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
https://buff.ly/30unCAt Head to here, click on fan's favorite, and let them know Silver Games LLC (That's us!) is your favorite! Well, if we are. We are, right? Why are you looking away...? 

Ahem, no! Go on, vote! Rally!

We did notice an error after shipping this out to everyone, namely that an extra page snuck in at the front, pushing everything back a page, which pushed the left side to the right and the right to the left and oh no!
This has been fixed, but I can't send everyone another book. Instead I made a link to chop it down to basically print price, which will be good for a week, go here:  https://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse.php?discount=901116cae8 
Get it, if you do desire, and enjoy pages being on the right side. No additional content, just nicer looking content, with the 2 page spreads actually being visible at the same time.

As the gritty wind blows past, we can take up arms with confidence, knowing that all that could be done, was done. The vital intel would reach its deserving destinations despite all odds.
Thank you all, this Kickstarter is now officially complete!

We are now at 181/274 fulfilled. You may have gotten an email from drivethruRPG about it, as I put in orders for your books. There is a slight delay as money I put on ice to pay for this defrosts, but I could not wait to get the first wave moving, so that's already happening!

Thank you all so much for being patient, but we have arrived!

Good day, Survivors,

The proofs should arrive tomorrow. If they look good, the mass ordering will begin shortly after that to finally get this book into your deserving hoofs, hands, talons, or whatever else you may have. Sorry this has taken so long, but the end is in sight!
Tomorrow!

I have the proof of this massive book and it is glorious.... but has a typo on the front.

It says 'Campaigng Setting'. This unfortunate blemish does not reduce readability, but it is there, and it poses a question. Do we fix it and delay things another few weeks and a proof cycle again, or do we accept it in all its imperfection and move forward?
Go here:  https://linkto.run/p/4HWKE5K7

Download it with a vengeance. Did you NOT get your PDF? Find the email from DrivethruRPG and do that! It should look much better now. Feel free to pepper us with anything you see (including compliments, aw).

Version 0.6 of the PDF has/is fired at all of you faithful backers. Redeem the coupon, now. This will let you get it for $0.00 from DrivethruRPG and also get any updates (There will be updates). This is also a fine place to post comments on mistakes you spot.

The rules are there, waiting to be enjoyed! Sorry for taking so long, and we're not quite done, but it's happening and I wanted to get this in your waiting hands/hooves/talons/etc. right away.

We come bearing gifts. Check out https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oYRk2BNYBts3YriplqJqXuQFebSm6b_d/view and enjoy a little snippet of layout work. We're further along than this, but I thought showing some of it would be nice.
Happy New Year!
David

campaign.story:
I’ve been gaming since the early 1980s, and each time I set down to do another AD&D campaign, I’m always facing the same resources, the venerable Monster Manual, the less stellar Monster Manual II, and the oddity that is the Fiend Folio.
Considering how many Monster and Bestiary books have been created for other editions, it has always seemed a bit of an affront that there wasn’t another classic monster book for AD&D, and the more I thought about it, the more I wanted to make the dream a reality.
So, after producing twenty Folio adventures, and with each introducing a new monster for the classic setting, I figured why not work with incredible cover artist Jeff Easley and my awesome fans to give us all another ‘orange spine’ 1E supplement that would expand on cool monsters that can come into play for gaming tables hungry for new creatures to encounter.
Now is the time to unite and expand your collection with The Folio of Fiendish Monsters!
What's in it? Our plan is to create a 128 page book (like those in the original AD&D orange spine series) and fill it with as many monsters as we can get in there.  All monsters will be set up for 1E AD&D.
Yes indeed, we're going to get you as close to an MMIII as we can!
What is a Monster Sponsor? Well, art is expensive, and even old TSR didn't get images for all its monsters in the original books, so this campaign features a level called a 'Monster Sponsor', and as a backer you are helping create a piece of art for one of the monsters in the book, and in doing so, you will get credit posted next to the image, so you'll be immortalized inside the book.
Sponsor a monster image and get your name in the book!
When is the release? We plan on having this book out before Christmas 2018, so get extra copies for your friends, especially if your name is in it!
Complete your Orange Spine Hardcover Collection!
  $11,000: Monster Level Encounter Appendix [UNLOCKED!]: Break down monsters by HD to better customize campaign building or DMing on the fly.
$12,000: Monster Climate Encounter Appendix [UNLOCKED!]: Break down monsters by geographical zone for better encounter charts and easier DM reference.
$13,000: Regional Treasure Type Table [UNLOCKED!]: Break down treasure to a specific geographical region for better customized treasure distribution.
$14,000: New Ability and Powers Appendix: Get a quick reference for various new powers and abilities of monsters in the book.
$15,000: Full 5E stat appendix expansion! Add 5E D&D gaming stats to all monsters in the book with this special appendix.
What are the backer levels? We have so many great reward levels for this project, and it is everyone's chance to get into a book on their gaming shelf!
           *TRADEMARK DISCLAIMER
"AD&D", "Monster Manual", and "Fiend Folio", are trademarks of Wizards of the Coast, LLC. Art of the Genre is not affiliated with Wizards of the Coast LLC. We make no claim to, or challenge to, such trademarks.

This is a personal passion project for all the authors and artists involved, so we are as anxious as our backers to see these volumes become a reality as quickly as possible.

campaign.story:
Rough-and-Tumble is a board game for your 3d printer. Rough-and-Tumble is a board game with a new and unique game mechanic: a game of chess with hexagonal boxes. You will choose between four teams: dwarves and orcs, from the first edition of the game (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/crosslances/rough-and-trumble-the-first-3d-self-printable-boar/description) Chaos and high elves introduced in this game expansion. It's also possible to play Rough-and-Tumble with the only expansion, the two editions can be used separately from one another.
The game is featured by movement limitations, dependent on the occupied box. Every character has special abilities, making the game tricky and engaging!
 Here come some map preview. Also available in vectorial to be printed in any dimension.
It's not a normal board game that you buy and put on a shelf, this is a game for your 3D printer! By buying this, you will receive files to print miniatures, map and markers, directly by your own 3D printers, while cozy at home!
-if you already own a 3D printer, it's cheap and also funny, you will print unique and incredible quality models.
 -If you don't own a 3D printer, it can be an opportunity to buy one! Costs for a printer are already low and accessible to anyone. You can still use a service like: 3D hub, shapeways, or any other that the net are crowding. 
 -No shipping cost! Anywhere in the universe, you just download the files and print!
 -You can print it as many times as you want, for you and your friends.
 -You can decide any printing dimension, from miniatures to real size titan sculptures!
 - You can use these miniature for other games, as proxyes in games like ninth age or fantasy football.
for a correct miniature print in 28mm scale, it's suggested a good quality printer, with at least 100micron resolution, so that all the details of the miniature are visible and the high quality of the sculptures is adequately exalted. Don't be afraid if your printers have lower specs, you can still print them giving up to some details, or print in a bigger scale(suggested for filament print), getting over the printer problem.  
Easter special  
Crazy rabbit!  
A little crazy bunny with chainsaw, available now from download for all backers!  
Even with only 1 euro!  
You can find it in updates reserved for backers
Free files Example stl files

updates.update_content:
Here we are! In another crazy project!

Yes, this time the project is really peculiar!
In our family we have 4 nieces and of course they are super in love with princesses, and various fairy tales, that they make us read or see on repeat!

A new adventure awaits the crosslances world: let's go back to a project that we already faced years ago: a Fantasy football team, but with a completely new look!
Very angry leprechauns! Inspired by the funny  Saint Patrick's day, but not only, come and find out more inside this new kickstarter!

Welcome to the new crosslances kickstarter project.
This time we are going to face up to a new topic: for the first time our studio lands in the future!
Exactly today we offer you fantastic new futuristic scenics designed for the most varied wargame and skirmish games set in the future (but not only).

we are happy to present you our new adventure!
http://kck.st/36q9UT1
This time the crosslances studio will take you inside an epic battle that will see soldiers of human armies (paladins), sylvan elves, and evil knights of chaos in opposition!
Are you ready to sharpen your 3D printers?

The Cemetery Gate 
here is finally our live project!

http://kck.st/2MYuArY

Lovers of 3D printing here is our latest news!  
finally our project is live!  
http://kck.st/2yBAdp6  
You can find lots of miniature pawns and other playful items for your 3D printer! What are you waiting for?
As suggested by one of our backers we found that the balance of the wyvern was not optimal, so we added a new piece that will make the statue more stable.

At the doors of the last week of the campaign we want to thank all of you who are supporting us more and more!  
We take this opportunity to show you the prints of some of our collaborators and friends who have the opportunity to test the files with their printers.  
In all cases they are extremely economical printers for their type:

campaign.story:
Santa Chaos, the first ever magnetized Team
What's better than the opportunity to custom your chaos team showing off all the gift you earned?
Mutations! What a gift!
What's better than do it with magnetized parts?
Each Warrior and the reindeer minotaurcomes with magnets
If you agree with me that's the best so this campaign is for you!
The Campaign
This campaign concerning a 16 players team for fantasy football composed by
4 Santa Chaos warriors made in resin with 4 magnets each and provided with 32 mm bases.
1 Reindeer Minotaur made in resin with 4 magnets and provided a 40 mm base.
11 Satyirs made in resin and provided with 32 mm bases.
 and the pitch built on ice and painted with the blood of the little elves of Santa Claus. It will be realized by Deep Cut Studio on 34mm squares.
The pitch
The Early Bird
for the first 24 hours each backer will receive for free Marcof the Boneshacker
Free for the first 24 hours, later it is available as add-on at 7€
The Raffle
Spread the seed and try to win!
The Story of the Santa Chaos Team
Rudenolf was thinking, a strange novelty, the concept of novelty itself was new. Like obscene streamers, the bowels of the red-clothed fat man adorned his mighty antlers; that old bearded man, his fixations, he had never paused a moment to think of him!
Character design by Marcof
  Did he ever stopped to think of red as the color of blood? And that the blood itself could compete to overcome the intensity of his hateful dress?
Concept by me
  Those were strange thoughts, they jumped in all directions ... like his companions! ... those strange little goats on two legs, so similar to the odious little elves with pointy ears, pimps servants flatterers of the fat one, similar not so much in appearance or in the intent, as for the frenzy, the elves to fulfill the silly and repetitive mission of the red fat man, the goat to annihilate everything in their sight!
Sculpture by Cross Lances Studio
  Rudenolf still had the harmony and the beauty (other new things he had just discovered) of the jumpy ballet in his eyes, a hypnotic dance between the heads of goat and the little elves. The former bound to destroy, the latter desperately trying to escape in panic amids torn bodies, entrails pulled like crimson ribbons to adorn those corpses like badly discarded gift packages... a chaotic motion that contrasted with the immobility of the Four.
Yes, the Four. Rudenolf became aware of them only when they granted him such notion. No matter how but he suddenly opened his eyes and he saw them, cruel simulacra of the red fat one, similar in appearance, but glorious in the aura of their intent!
it could be purchased as add-on for 15€
And there they stood, true bearers of gifts. Gifts for all, not only for the odious and boring good of spirit, whose luminous souls had marked step by step a destiny of slavery for Rudenolf.
The Four threw the fat man dressed in red before his feet (Rudenolf was standing!) bloodless and panting. They said to him: "Play with him!", what is "play" he asked, and one of the Four beckoned him towards the brothers with a goat's head, "They are happy, they have fun" he said, and as he watched the latter wearing the limbs of the elves like obscene vestiges, Rudenolf understood, and as he eviscerated the fat one he was really happy.
Each one of them be purchased as add-on for 7€
"Now it's enough!" the Four said, "now the game changes, it will have rules, our rules!. Now you can dress red clothes too and you can bring to all the gifts that you will consider just ... pain, fear, despair, your revenge, your new game "... Rudenolf understood, his nose lit up with a dark red, cruel, not a guide in the night, but a threat, an ominous foreboding, memento of an inevitable promise, joy and expectation yes, but only for Him and his too many buried desires.
"Now enough" shout one of the Four, the one with the wolf helmet, which until now had not spoken, "stop playing with the bowels of the Elves! ... you prepare Rudenolf, walk with us, at our side, the Coach is waiting for us!
Each one of them be purchased as add-on for 8€
Look at prototypes
      Model and bases shown are here only to compare sizes. The team will be provided with 32 mm bases
Delivery
There are no delivery fees for the team pledge and the team + pitch pledge. Add-on only pledge starts fro 7 euros, those are delivery fees.
Social Stretch Goals
Like my page to unlock new mutations for the warriors and the reindeer
Unlockables
at 3500€ 2 Heads will replace a non mutated satyr for free - it could be purchased as add-on for 7€
  at 4000€ 3Arms will replace a non mutated satyr for free - it could be purchased as add-on for 7€
  at 4500€ BigHand will replace a non mutated satyr for free - it could be purchased as add-on for 7€
  at 5000€ Claw will replace a non-mutated satyr for free - it could be purchased as add-on for 7€
  at 5500€ DisturbingBell will replace a non-mutated satyr for free - it could be purchased as add-on for 7€
  at 6500 Metal could become an option: You could have your team in lead-free metal
Optional Add-Ons
  complete with 2 dought - 38€
  20 extra magnets - 5 €
  1 set 9 €
Who We Are
 My name is Giovanni and in the last 12 years I was behind a lot of miniature games project as miniature painter, conceptist or art director.
This is my first kickstarter launched by my own.
follow me on facebook atwww.facebook.com/ilnanonefasto/
 I am Filippo, I'm from Florence and I studied at the arts college in my city. I opened Crosslances a pair of years ago and I sculpted at last 10 blood bowl team in the last 18 month (other than historical miniatures). I won the gold medal in sculpting during Lucca Comics and Games 2016.
Follow my social on http://www.Facebook.com/crosslancesstudio
FAQs
Q: why this team costs more than GW ones and Willi miniatures elfs
A: Unfortunately GW gives you 11 models with double poses, we love our buyers and we are offering a full team with interchangeable parts.
If you are in Europe but out of Spain our team has the same price than Willi's. if you are outside Europe we are cheaper
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Production will be completely made in our workshop in Italy. If the project raises levels over our expected production times could be longer, anyway we still have agreements with other companies to give away same part of productions so you should not worry.

The estimated delivery date is MAR 2018, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize these problems as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if, for some totally unforeseen reason, the project couldn't be delivered at all. Since it is 90% complete, we don't believe this will happen.

We have no ongoing projects currently other than this so we're 150% on it.

DISCLAMER 
Our miniatures and terrain are not official miniatures or terrain for any game listed above and we are in no way affiliated with or endorsed by these games companies, nor do we use any copyrighted material of these games or intend any copyright violation. We too are fans of these games and respectful of intellectual property.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via Paypal.

This project is being funded in Euro and any refunds processed will be in Euro for the exact amount received in Euro, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

Models will be provided unassembled and unpainted.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed.

If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

hi dears

resin copies are going on. we had a little trouble in the past days because of the terrible weather and resin froze in the workshop.
anyway, we are confident to finish production in a pair of weeks
magnets have arrived last Friday, fields are here and bases as well.
we are on a good way (but I will not scram my joy until everything will be finished)
I have also to announce you that in the meanwhile I am finishing production and preparing for shipping the creative team is preparing to launch a new team.
let me explain you why: The chaos dwarf team was nearly ready last autumn when gaspez launched his dwarfs. campaign.story:
Once More into the Breach!
Once again the world renown artist, Bob Olley continues sculpting halfling skeletons full of character and beauty (but don't say that to their face).  This is kickstarter 4 in the Halfling Skeleton Army Series.  Now we get the heavy hitters and scouts pivotal  in any successful army.  We also get a halfling skeleton necromancer to cast spells and take over for Count Von Herbimyre.  If you missed previous kickstarters, not to worry, you can get the units and characters featured in earlier as add ons in this one!
Halfling Dan
Dan was a late riser and today was no exception.  The last thing he remembered was the rush!  He had been trampled to death by town's folk trying to get at his illusion of a four story strawberry cake.  He got to his feet and straightened out his robes.  Wow he felt much more magic-y now!  Seven skeletons stood around him.  One began to speak, "Uh, we need a leader, want the job?"
"Yes!  answered Dan.  "I am the most powerful halfling necromancer of all time (Which was probably true, in fact he had never heard of a halfling necromancer before)!  I will lead you, after you lead me to lunch!"
Later, Necromancer Dan surveyed his army.  What he really needed was some scouts and a strong cavalry on horse.  Trouble was that there just wasn't going to be too many dead horses in the land of the small folk, maybe a few ponies and that was all.  What to do....what to do....bacon came to mind (since there he still had some on his cloak) PIGGYS!  There were an abundance of pig skeletons!  We shall have mounted SKELETON PIGS!
Shipping:  
A shipping invoice will be sent after surveys are complete.  Please see the FAQ for details.
You know how this works! Your pledges are how we will make Halfling Skeletons Armies a reality.
         Add-ons are additional Halfling Skeleton miniatures you can pledge for to expand your armies into a truly terrifying host! To pledge for an-add on simply add the cost of the item to your pledge total and tell us what you want in the backer survey we will send out after the project funds.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risk and challenges are low. This is the fourth kickstarter in the series and the first three went very well. We did have some of the boys get detained and deported from Amsterdam for bad behavior. They were allowed back in as long as they promised to be nice and not pester the residence for snacks. Afterward we added some etiquette lessons to the training and taught them the halfling skeletons how to pick up after their mounts so all should be good. 

Production is 90% complete and all our previous kickstarters have shipped within about two months of funding.

These wargaming miniatures and are not recommended for children under 14 years of age. They may contain lead which may be harmful if chewed or swallowed.

All miniatures are supplied unpainted, without bases (with the exception of archers that maybe added on will be provided with bases).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Better your tabletop gaming experience with this five Elements Dice set - Fire, Water, Wind, Lightning, and Earth! And they are with Glowing Resin! 
Each pledge is essential. Each of you can make our dream bigger. Simply share our things on any web-based social networking to help spread. We welcome you to be part of our project and let's do it!
 Introduction
Fantasy Dice is a unique design dice that dedicates to tabletop game lovers, dice collectors and toy maniacs who love fantasy design. It brings your dream of Magic, Sword, and Elements mage to reality. With only one roll away! And they are with Glowing Resin!
Fantasy Dice is made by injected glowing resin with different colors background to make it looks Magical and Elemental.
Color Options
Shadow Black
There are 3 ways to maintain the power of 5 Elements, using the mysterious dark energy from another world is one of them. The force of dark energy is different from our world and it's so strong that can keep the natural force of Elements unable to breakthrough. But great power also comes with consequences...And they are with Glowing Resin!
White
The Ancient power of Sage is able to seal the power of elements into bones or ivory and allow a caster to summon stable and controllable Elements' force to handle life or battle. However, the academy charges very high for even one Element dice. And they are with Glowing Resin!
Iron
The North men are very good at dealing with steel and metal. They use a different way to train mages and control the power of Elements. With the strength of their Chroma Iron, they are able to maintain the force of elements inside for nearly a century. And they are with Glowing Resin!  
Checkout the Glowing effect HERE
   Rewards
In USD
  Stretch Goals
  And Add-ons!
About the Add-ons, just add the right number to your pledge and we will come back to you in the survey! Please help us unlock the 2 final goals!
In USD
  Standard 16 mm dice
Chamfer corner
And they are with Glowing Resin!
Finishes with protective coating
  Design Process  
We've have created a 3D-print prototype in order to achieve maximum quality, we are improving the graphics on our dice, in order to achieve the highest quality of laser cutting and visible to the eye lines and experimenting with depth of laser cutting, from 1 mm to 0.1 mm.
We have tried to paint some of the 3d print dice ourselves, but it is very difficult to paint the center area as it has many mini craters. We are not very good at paint things ourselves, that's why some of the prototypes are sent to some reviewer with painting expertise! We will update you on that soon! And they are with Glowing Resin!
That is why we need your help on Kickstarter! The molding for casting is really expensive due to the design complexity. And Fantasy Dice requires secondary processing in addition to the resin casting which is much higher than other products. And they are with Glowing Resin!
Right now the final design is knocked down, manufacture for the dice are ready, all we need is your pledge! And they are with Glowing Resin!
Timeline
May 2017 - Come up with the idea
Oct 2017 - Stage 1 design with 2D graphic
Nov 2017 - 3D modeling, rendering, and video making
Dec 2017 - Start Funding on Kickstarter for 40 days
Jan 2018 - Molding and price deal of the final product
Mar 2018 - Finish production and start shipping
May 2018 - Get all your hands on Fantasy Dice!
About the Team
We are a group of young people who love playing RPG and board games, sometimes even enjoy making creative and social related board games in Hong Kong!
We have a thought to make our own accessory for gaming cause we love fantasy game so much, sometimes greater than our love towards space or sci-fi games. We checked out online and there are not many Elemental dices that can attract our eyeballs, that's how Elemental Dices come out! And they are with Glowing Resin!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We can’t deny that there are risks backing a new company. We have worked hard to mitigate as many risks as possible. Most of the design has been done and 90% of the art has been finished.

As any ongoing projects, there is uncertainty in the process. For example, production delay is one of the major concerns. We have carefully considered the unknown in our planning, we honestly believe that we can deliver on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Maki Games and Royal Art Games are raising funds to start the production of a resin version for our chaos teams. Both Chaos teams are a collection of amazing miniatures made previously in high quality white metal and soon in high quality resin. 16 different miniatures per team, including a Big Guy (Bloodthirsty Beast or Minotaur, depending on the team). Don´t loose the chance to support this amazing project!
Given the constant increase in the price of metal and the growing competition for fantasy football teams, we felt the need for more affordable yet top quality products. For these reasons we decided to switch the production line from metal to resin. For this project we partnered with Royal Art Games for the manufacturing of resin teams since they have proven to be able to manufacture resin teams for fantasy football at the highest standards. The metal teams will soon be discontinued so this is the best chance to get a team in metal, if you like your players to "hit like solid metal".
The Blood Demons Team includes 9 Pit Fighters, 4 Blood Demons, 2 Blood Demons Heralds and 1 Bloodthirsty Beast.
        Ares Blood Demons were designed by Macs Gallo, sculpted by Jin Vi and painted by AXIA.
Ares Blood Demons Team
           The Chaos Chosen Team includes 11 Beastmen, 4 Chaos Chosen Warriors and 1 Minotaur.
      Himeros Chaos Chosens were designed by Macs Gallo, sculpted by Irek Zieliński and painted by Mindworks Games.
Himeros Chaos Chosen Team
        Size Comparison
              Unlocked Freebie!
    Unlocked Add-on!
    Unlocked Freebie
    Unlocked Freebie & add-on!
  Unlocked Freebie
  Unlocked Freebie
  Freebie
  Once we raise enough funds to reach the funding goal, it means the resin version of our Chaos and Blood demons team will be produced at the end of the campaign. However, reaching the funding goal is not the end! 
The campaign will go beyond the basic rewards of the project and the more people join the project, the more stretch goals will be unlocked.

The beauty of crowdfunding on Kickstarter is that you can choose how much to spend during the whole duration of the project. This means you can join the project to get all the updates of the campaign and change your mind until the very last minute of the campaign. So, if you like our teams you could join with one of the lower pledges and then decide if you prefer to drop it before the end or to pledge more funds and get a more expensive pledge or addons.
After the funding goal is reached we will announce new stretch goals for the project. The stretch goals will either unlock new add-ons or add free items to your existing pledge, so the more people join the project the more free items you will get without spending more. This is a very good reason to help us spread the word on social media and in your community of gamers. If your friends join the project you will all benefit from it at no additional cost.

SHIPPING COSTS AND ESTIMATED DELIVERY
Shipping costs for this project will be charged after the campaign in the pledge manager. This solution allows us to charge only the actual shipping costs, which might be different if you take only resin teams, only metal teams or if you opt to get a mix of both.

Estimated shipping cost are:
10 euros for Europe
15 euros for USA
20/25 euros for Rest of the world
Estimated delivery for this project is early January for the metal teams and late January for the resin teams. There might be minor delays for the resin team depending on the customs clearance process since the resin teams will be manufactured in China.
Maki Games is a well known Dutch manufacturer of terrain and miniatures. The company was founded in 2013 thanks to the backers who supported our first Kickstarter project. Since then we launched several fantasy football teams thanks to the creativity of Rolljordan, co-founder of Maki Games. In addition to creating our own products we collaborated with several Italian and international firms and manufacturers in the tabletop games market, helping them to manage their Kickstarter projects from concept stage to fulfillment and supporting them in the creation of high quality miniatures. 
In these 4 years we had the pleasure to work with several world-famous sculptors and artists whose passion and creativity has been fundamental to develop our company. We grew in experience together with our partners and artists and, as we did from day 1, we are committed to maintaining the the highest quality in our casting process.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have successfully completed several crowdfunding projects in the past and we are confident that the rewards will be delivered.
In crowdfunding projects there are always certain variables that could escape our control and as consequence can provoke a delay in delivery. These delays are typically caused by last hour additions to the campaign, as new Stretch Goals, that can make trigger a delay in the predicted delivery time when combined with other issues like the sculptor's schedule being full in the short term. 
In any case, we will keep backers updated about the state of the project.

Metal teams are already in stock so there should be no delay associated to their delivery. 

Resin teams must be produced by Royal Art Games in China. This means there might be a small risk of a delay due to customs clearance. However, Royal Art Games has already produced several teams in China and they are confident that the estimated timelines are realistic.

Every crowdfunding campaign we made in the past was analyzed in retrospective and we learned from our mistakes, improving our processes and our estimates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Check out Dark Rituals: Malleus Maleficarum
updates.update_content:
Support our friends
During these years in the entertainment market we met many amazing people working in different companies. We shared ideas, tips and helped each other to resolve common issues. One of these companies is Dark Gate Games. They have a new project which is live on Kickstarter right now and they asked us for some help in spreading the news.

Yesterday we received the replacements from the resin manufacturer. This means that by the end of next week all replacement parts will be shipped and the project fulfillment will be completed. For those backers who reported a missing component we will get in touch with you to confirm your address before shipping your parcel.
The delay between the initially announced delivery (late July / early August) was outside our control and probably made worse by the Summer holidays which might have sensibly slowed down customs clearance for the parcel containing our replacements.
Thank you all for your support to this small project!

Our experience in the world of Fantasy Football was extremely fun and exciting but all good things come to an end. As previously announced we will stop the production of the fantasy footballl line to focus on new projects. However, we will keep selling all teams until we run out of stock.

Once again thank you for supporting our project and for the positive feedback on our teams. Knowing you like our miniatures inspires us to work harder and improve ourselves.
The fulfillment was completed last May and we are now handling the last few issues we had with the shipped parcels.

This week a couple of parcels have been returned to our address. The reason was "parcel unclaimed".

If you have not yet received your team, please check with your local post office (they might be waiting for you to collect your parcel). If you have questions, please, contact us via private message here on KS. Next week we will email the backers whose parcel has been returned to arrange a new shipment.

Replacement for missing resin components will be shipped at the end of July/ beginning of August, depending on when the parcel with the additional resin parts will be shipped to us.

Hail to all fantasy sports fans

Sun shines over the football courts and teams are on the way, getting ready for some competitive gaming. Prepare the brushes and get ready the paint jars! 

Tip of the day: DO NOT OPEN THE PAINT JAR NOW. It is highly recommended to wait for the mailman to deliver the package first ;)
Good news! The parcel with all the resin teams arrived yesterday and we can finally move forward to complete the fulfillment.

updates.update_userinfo: Quick Update: Resin teams landed in Europe
updates.update_content:
A quick update for the weekend.
We got news that yesterday the parcel with the resin teams was already in the Italian customs. As soon as we get the tax bill from the customs the parcel should be delivered to RAG in a few days.
Although the customs clearing process is something we cannot speed up, we are getting ready to ship the parcels as quickly as possible once we get the teams.

Good news on all fronts!
METAL TEAMS
We managed to ship 3 more orders and only two orders have not yet been fulfilled. These two orders will ship along with the resin teams and, as promised, they will get a free gift to compensate for the delay.

Chinese New Year has come and gone and activities are starting again in China.
2018 is the year of the dog, which is a good omen. Dogs are loyal and trustworthy and they are trained to fetch items for their human friends. Shall a friendly dog bring us the long sought resin teams in the next couple of week? 
About Resin Teams
The resin teams should be shipped mid-March and the chances that fulfillment will start by the end of March are good. All resin teams will be shipped from Italy by Royal Art Games.

January has come and gone: it is time for an update!
A tide of chaos players is flooding the football league! Despite all the efforts of the league organizers to control the rampaging and frenzied chaos teams, a new wave is on the way from the Eastern marches. The cultists and secret sects are excited at the idea of cheering the Chosen creatures of the Chaos gods. All other citizens are simply scared at the idea of having them feasting and celebrating in their cities and taverns after every match.

updates.update_userinfo: Progress update and New Year offer
updates.update_content:
We are happy to have some good news in our first update for 2018.
We have collected all the surveys and in a few days we will start collecting the shipping fees. All orders without RESIN miniatures will be shipped from the Netherlands immediately after that.
Royal Art Games has given the green light to start the manufacturing for the RESIN teams. As soon as they will be shipped to their warehouse we will give you an update on the estimated delivery time. Royal Art Games will take charge of the fulfillment of the resin miniatures and the parcels will be shipped from Italy.

campaign.story:
Hey Everyone!
Every time I think that you guys have outdone yourself, you prove me wrong. THANK YOU! Everyone involved in this Kickstarter, from writer Michael Curtis on down, is so grateful for the amazing support you have shown this book. 
And if you missed out on the Kickstarter, you'll still be able to grab copies of The Dungeon Alphabet from a store near you, or from our online store in due time. 
If you are a backer, WOW! You guys not only hit every goal we thought of, you added some ideas of your own that we tossed in for good measure! You got past the Leather Edition and moved well beyond, hitting the gatefold map and several extra letters. Amazing. Beautiful. Crazy. Dynamic. Extravagant. Fabulous. Great. ...and you get the idea. All the way to Z. 
Help bring The Dungeon Alphabet back in a deluxe 4th printing! One of the most popular titles ever released by Goodman Games and a precursor to the design elements that would eventually make DCC RPG so popular, The Dungeon Alphabet is a book of dungeon inspiration that blends creative writing and inspirational art. Every RPG enthusiast, whether player or judge, will find their minds abuzz after reading this book. 
This Kickstarter funds a 4th printing of The Dungeon Alphabet in a hardcover. Since we’re running this Kickstarter over Black Friday, we are also offering a 40% discount! The book is priced at $12, but only during this Kickstarter. After the Kickstarter it will return to its list price of $20.
The 4th printing is expanded with 16 pages of additional content for a total of 80 pages. Depending on stretch goals, we may be able to add deluxe printing features like a sewn-in bookmark, cloth binding, and possibly even a leatherbound edition. (See below for more on that.)
You can also add on copies of The Monster Alphabet, a previously-released sister project to Dungeon Alphabet, to your pledge. These are also at the 40% Black Friday discount!
What Is The Dungeon Alphabet?
The Dungeon Alphabet is a book of fantasy inspiration. It is filled with random tables that are themed to letters of the alphabet. For example, A is for Altar, B is for Books, and C is for Crypts. The target audience is dungeon masters and anyone who wants ideas for dungeon design. We have heard over the years that many players also enjoy looking through the book as well.
Each page of The Dungeon Alphabet uses a letter of the alphabet to provide inspiration. In the first printing, so many years ago, there were 26 entries for the 26 letters. With each new printing, we have doubled-up on select letters to add even more material. This 4th printing is now up to 41 entries, including 2 completely new ones and others collected from our annual Gen Con Program Guides, to add a total of 7 letters that are new since the 3rd printing:
C is also for Crypt
G is also for Guardians
H is also for Hazards
L is also for Levels
O is also for Omen
Q is also for Quests
U is also for Underwater
J is for Jewels
Show Me An Example!
Certainly!
Here is a preview of the Table of Contents, where you can see all the letters.
Preview of the table of contents
  And here are pages 6-12 of the 4th printing, showing several entries.
Preview of pages 6-12
  Tell Me About the Author
“Manly” Michael Curtis is the ruffian behind the writing. The Dungeon Alphabet was his first professional RPG publication, and has launched him on a professional RPG writing career. Michael is well known for his contributions to the Dungeon Crawl Classics line, where he has authored more than a dozen adventures, including the Shudder Mountain setting and associated Chained Coffin adventure. Michael is also the creator of Stonehell Dungeon, and an instrumental contributor the Goodman Games renaissance of the Metamorphosis Alpha line. He is also the lead designer on the DCC Lankhmar project, and the mastermind behind our license to publish the works of Fritz Leiber’s Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser.
Michael's work on The Dungeon Alphabet has been recognized repeatedly. Among many accolades, the book won the Three Castles Award at the 2011 North Texas RPG Convention.
R is for Rooms
Tell Me About the Artists
The Dungeon Alphabet is illustrated by a who’s-who of old-school RPG artists, from TSR founding artists to luminaries of the Old School Renaissance. With each new printing we have added even more art. The roster for the 4th printing includes:
TSR Alumni: Erol Otus (cover art and interior art), Jeff Easley, Jim Holloway, Russ Nicholson, Jim Roslof
Goodman Games Artists and OSR Luminaries: Doug Kovacs, William McAusland, Brad McDevitt, Jesse Mohn, Peter Mullen, Stefan Poag, Chad Sergesketter, Chuck Whelon, and Mike Wilson
The Endsheet Art
The first printing of The Dungeon Alphabet featured an amazing two-page spread on the endsheets. It was a cave exploration scene by Peter Mullen, printed in the same sky blue tone as the original inside covers of the TSR adventure modules.
Various endsheet images: the 1st (blue) and 3rd printings
With each subsequent printing, we swapped out new art for the endsheets. Peter Mullen provided a second 11x17 image, then Russ Nicholson drew an amazing scene for the 3rd printing. And based on the popularity of this approach, we asked Peter Mullen to illustrate another scene for the endsheets of our GM Gems hardcover.
For this 4th printing of Dungeon Alphabet, we plan to include Peter Mullen’s original illustration on the front endsheets, appropriately printed in “TSR module blue.” We’ll also include his other endsheet illustration on the inside back cover. And in the hardcover centerfold, we will print Russ Nicholson’s two-page spread from the endsheets of the 3rd printing!
Design Inspiration for DCC RPG
Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game, or DCC RPG, is one of the most popular role playing games on the market. Now in its sixth printing, DCC RPG has inspired and re-engaged thousands of gamers, through both its rules and presentation. What many do not know is that The Dungeon Alphabet was a trial run for the graphic design that would eventually come to life in DCC RPG. If you love the overabundance of art in DCC RPG, and the classic pen-and-ink feel, you will love The Dungeon Alphabet.
Y is for Yellow
Add On The Monster Alphabet or Other Versions of The Dungeon Alphabet
You can add on copies of The Monster Alphabet to this Kickstarter. You can also add on copies of The Dungeon Alphabet in either format (color or gold foil). All are at the 40% Black Friday discount.
The Monster Alphabet: Given the synergy between The Monster Alphabet and The Dungeon Alphabet, we are also offering The Monster Alphabet as an add-on. Two years ago, Goodman Games published The Monster Alphabet. Designed with the same principles as The Dungeon Alphabet (and also featuring Michael Curtis’ work), The Monster Alphabet focuses on inspiration for monster design. 
The Dungeon Alphabet: If you pledged for the gold foil edition and would also like to add the color cover edition, you can do so.
To add items on to your pledge: simply add the "dollars" to your pledge amount. At the end of the Kickstarter we will send out a survey where you can tell us exactly what you ordered. 
The Monster Alphabet: Add $12 for the color-cover edition of The Monster Alphabet (in print+PDF) or $18 for the gold foil edition (in print+PDF)
The Dungeon Alphabet: Add $12 for the color-cover edition of The Dungeon Alphabet (in print+PDF), or $18 for the gold foil edition (in print+PDF), or $60 for the leather-bound edition (in print+PDF)
Stretch Goals
Once we have cleared the basic pledge level, we would like to add a bunch of special features! Here are the stretch goals.
$7,000: CLEARED! We will print The Dungeon Alphabet with a sewn-in satin bookmark. 
$9,000: CLEARED! We will unlock an option for a new gold foil edition of The Dungeon Alphabet. This edition will have new art that will be embossed in gold foil on a faux leather cover. Once this option is unlocked, backers will be able to buy the gold foil edition for $18 (a 40% Black Friday discount on the $30 retail price).
$11,000: CLEARED! We will print The Dungeon Alphabet in a clothbound hardcover format. The spine will be clothbound with an imprinted title, while the front and back of the cover will feature the original color cover art.
$13,000: CLEARED! At this level we will unlock an option for a deluxe leatherbound edition of The Dungeon Alphabet, bound in real cowhide leather. Our leatherbound editions of this nature normally retail for $100 but for this Kickstarter we will offer it at the Black Friday price of $60 per copy. The leather edition will feature new “alphabet motif” art, different from the gold foil edition.
$15,000: CLEARED! At this level we will add a dust jacket to all printed copies!
$20,000: CLEARED! At this level we will add one new letter, created just for  this printing!
$25,000: CLEARED! At this level we will add a gatefold page with a "starter map." Think of this as a blank map for your canvas to run wild with. It will be illustrated in the "DCC style" that many of you know so well, and you can use the tables in the book to populate its contents.
$30,000: CLEARED! At this level we will add another new letter, created just for this printing!
F is for Fungi and G is for Gold
Shipping
Print copies ship at a flat rate regardless of whether you order The Dungeon Alphabet, The Monster Alphabet, or both. These rates are:
USA: $5
Canada: $8
UK+EU: $10
Rest of world: $15
The Reviews
Still not convinced? Read some of the fan reviews. Since The Dungeon Alphabet first released way back in 2009, it has been universally praised by fans. Here is a sampling of customer feedback.
Skyland Games: "I cannot recommend this book highly enough for the dungeon master looking to get the creative juices flowing, and keep their players guessing!"
The Earthlight Academy: "Even if you don't end up using the tables as presented, just flipping through the pages of this book will have your head swimming with ideas. This is due, in part, to the absurd amount of old-school fantasy art."
Grognardia: "In the end, it's Michael Curtis's terrific little entries that are the heart and soul of this product and they never once disappoint. Each one of them is a tiny masterpiece, a succinct elucidation of not just what makes a good old school dungeon but also what distinguishes the Old Ways from the new."
GameKnight Reviews: "Curtis came up with some very unique (and humorous) tables, such as the one for Books. For example, one special property is “Book is enchanted to prevent theft. Screams ‘Thief!’ constantly while handled…” Another has the soul of the previous owner trapped inside and the book wants more…"
Gnome Stew: "The Dungeon Alphabet is a great resource for such details in its random tables, which will allow you to quickly grab an element and use it to spruce up your dungeon. Where this book really shines is that in its descriptions of each element it is an inspiration for creating your own elements. In this way the book serves a dual purpose, doubling its value."
Dungeon Fantastic: "This is a book I wish I'd written, and I'm sorry I took so long to find it and buy it. Outstanding stuff, and any dungeon fantasy GM (from OD&D DMs to GURPS DF GMs) can make use of this. It's better for a class-and-level, gold-and-dungeons game, but it'll work for any variation of fantasy world underground delving for treasure. Highly recommended."
The Drunk Umber Hulk: "What I love about this book is not just that you get all kinds of fun tables and charts to roll on, it really ignites your imagination and gives you so many ideas and suggestions that can make your dungeon unique and varied. "
Tenkar's Tavern: "If you don't have a copy, you probably should."
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Goodman Games has run more than a dozen Kickstarters. The primary risk we anticipate is delays if the stretch goals add great features that take longer to produce.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Dungeon Alphabet backers!
It's been a while, but we thought you might want to know: the Cthulhu Alphabet Kickstarter is now live! You can find it right here!
Please hop on over and check it out!

Hi everyone,
Bulk shipping for The Dungeon Alphabet is complete!
We are working through a handful of remaining damages, short-ships, etc. If you've already contacted us about that, we're on it! A handful of copies are currently en route.
The "worry date" is May 15. That means, you should be worried if you haven't gotten your copy by May 15! If you don't have your copy of #1 by May 15, get in touch so we can figure out what's going on.

updates.update_userinfo: Bulk Shipping Complete; Worry Date is May 15
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
We have now shipped more than 96% of the Dungeon Alphabet Kickstarter deliveries. 
Some orders are still in transit. And there are the last batch of "problem orders" that we're working through - missing items, damaged books, old addresses, and so on. We'll keep working on these until everything is at 100%.

Hi everyone,
A short update to let you know we have now shipped 83% of pledges, which has increased since our last update. We're continuing to ship things as fast as we can! We just posted a ton of tracking numbers to Backer Kit so check there to find yours. If there's no tracking number yet, don't worry! We're still working on the remaining pledges.
As a reminder, if you backed more than one Goodman Games Kickstarter among the ones shipping now (this one, Dungeon Alphabet, and Mutant Crawl Classics), your tracking number may be posted under another Kickstarter but will include Dungeon Alphabet.

Hi everyone,
The Dungeon Alphabet Kickstarter is 71% shipped! It's been great to see some of the comments from happy backers as these shipments land.
Many of you have seen tracking numbers upload to Backer Kit over the last several days. The US tracking numbers can be tracked via USPS.com, and the international tracking numbers can be tracked via asendiausa.com (use the "Tracking" button at upper right).

Hi everyone,
The first (very small) batch of pledges has been shipped. It's not a lot yet, but it's the beginning of the coming wave. As we get more books shipped we will let you know!
Once your order has gone out, you'll receive a tracking number in BackerKit. 
More to come as we get more shipped!

Hi everyone,
The 4th printing of The Dungeon Alphabet is now in print!
Here are some photos for you.
We'll be starting the shipping process soon. It will take a while to get all the orders out the door and we will post updates as they start moving!

Hey Everyone!
Things are moving quickly here. The print product is due to ship out shortly, and we'll be sending product pics the moment we get them. 
In the meantime, we have released the PDF version of Dungeon Alphabet, 4th Printing! Along with it, we also released the rest of the PDFs that were ordered as add-ons! So, you should have a bevy of PDF goodies waiting for you on BackerKit!

updates.update_userinfo: PDF Product Now Available to Backers!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone!
Wanted to drop a friendly reminder that we are locking down the BackerKit information on Saturday morning, so be sure to get your information filled in by this Friday--February 2nd--by Midnight, so that you don't miss out on the Kickstarter shipping! 
The book is already at the printer, and we intend to get it out to you as soon as possible, so thanks for helping us out and getting your information in on time!

campaign.story:
Hello Fantasy Football fans! I’d like to present my personal project that I have been working on for a long time and it is finally finished! I have designed and sculpted a team of northern men inspired by ancient Vikings and characters of Nordic legends. I hope you like it as much as I do, and I hope this project will be the first of many. Thank you!
  They arrived from cold lands of the north, rough warriors ready to clean the fields with the bodies of their rival teams. They are ready to harness the great powers of Odin!

This is my first project as a manufacturer of miniature figurines and I hope to launch it successfully and make it the first project of many. 
If we have a massive success in financing, we will try to bring forward the date of shipment, with an update via email or in the project updates.

campaign.story:
We are glad to introduce to our Fantasy Football fans and supporting the players community with another amazing team. From the old world the Raptors are coming, One of the most fun teams to play. We want to produce a complete 16 players team, which include all the positional with no duplicate models cast in with the highest quality resin And all with an incredible price that only RAG and RJ can offer. This is why we need your help more than ever, we have committed a great effort and lots of time to offer you this high quality team, with stunning models at a very competitive price.
  1 - Kroxigor
  6 - Saurus
  9 - Skinks
  5000€ - Free Turn Counter
5500€ - Free Score Counter
6000€ - Add-On Coach 
6500€ - Add-On Re-Roll Counters
7000€ - Free set of Block Dice x 3
8000€ - Add-On Star Player Silly Billy
 We ship to all the world. Shipping costs vary depending of your location.

For a full Team + freebies, the estimated shipping costs are:

Italy: 7€
European Union: 10€
USA/Canada: 15€
Rest of the World: 20+€

 If you live near buy another player we can combine shipping and send you one parcel, this way we can charge shipping only once.
 Shipping costs will be charged later during the pledge manager. Our delivery date is on Jan 2018. This is an estimate based on predicted add-ons to be added. But we will try to speed up the process and with a little of luck we will be able to make all the shipments before the estimated date.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Through our experience in past crowdfunding projects, we are confident about our shipment dates, so the project shouldn't have any issue that could produce a big delay on delivery.

Despite this there are certain variables that can escape our control and as consequence can provoke a delay in delivery. For example, last hour additions to the campaign, as new Stretch Goals, can make that the predicted delivery time can't be accomplished. In any case, we will make regular updates about the state of the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We are closing the KS to get time and revise, print and get a better presentation for the models before relaunching the KS.

This allows us to launch the 2 resin team conversion project we have for Daemons and Chaos teams.

Yes is correct our MK1881 line teams will be released again in resin at an amazing price, the teams will be quite affordable.
2 Full Rosters. (1 Demon Lord, 2 Minion Champs, 4 Minions, 9 Barbarians, 1 Minotaur, 4 Warriors, 11 multi component beast man models + freebies) for 90/95€ + shipping.
